Reviews.Title: “Great wedding venue BUT”
Reviews.Author: floating_lavender
Reviews.Content: I attended two weddings within a month in this hotel. The first being in March whereby the service and food was fabulous beyond description! The service staffs are polite and the service was as smooth and delightful as the experience the hotel is giving me throughout the night. I totally left with craving for a second time. The second however, just last Saturday, was not as desireable. There was this constant yapping at the side of my table from one particular specy grey suited man. This yapping totally destroyed my evening with old friends and killed off my evening straightaway. There was so many occasion we signalled for service but all the staffs seemed destracted by the guy to notice us. This was not all as I noticed the same guy taking photos around during the dinner! This is invasion of privacy! I thanked the service staff for their hospitality after the dinner knowing that I will not come again in the near future. Such inconsistency is a real shame to such a luxurious hotel with incompatible staff.

Reviews.Title: “2009 vs 2012”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in in March 2009, a year after its grand opening and it was amazing. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g294265-d678328-Reviews-The_St_Regis_Singapore-Singapore.html Upon returning to Singapore we were torn because we loved St regis so much when we first stayed there we wanted to stayed there again. But we like to try out new hotels and stayed 3 nights at Fullerton Bay and 1 night at St regis. In 2009 the hotel was shiny and brand new,service was excellent. Our room was made every time we left and a tray of fruit and chocolate was brought everyday at 2pm. Also when we were showed to our room the butler asked if we would like our luggage unpack and when we leave he will pack it for us. Mr. Yngvar Stray,the general manager, was constantly seen on premises and making everything run smoothly and accordingly. We met him and he gave us breakfast everyday comped. Buffet breakfast was wonderful but selections were on the lighter side compare to what they offer today. So now its March 2012,things have changed since then. They have a new GM and we did not see him once. But that wasn't the problem. Checking in process needs to be revamped. There was so no line when we checked in but when we went out later I saw a rope was put up and people waited online to check-in. I would have been displeased that we had to stand to wait on line while people checking in were sitting. They should do away with those desks and put a large check-in area where everyone checking-in had to stand. The 3 years since we've been there,the rooms has taken a beating and it looks as they do not maintain them. The pillows on the chair and sofa were stained and ripped. There was a massive stain on the sofa's red upholstery,the bathroom which is made up beautiful marble of needs a good polishing. The butler service has changed,room was not made up every time we left,no fruit and chocolate plate was brought to our. I asked them about it and the butler made me feel like I had 2 heads and then proceeded to say,"Oh yeah! I guess they forgot". The two butlers we met never offered to unpack or pack our suitcase when arriving. This property is still a beautiful and stunning but it has lost some its excellent qualities that made it quite memorable for us. The breakfast buffet is more extensive with a lot to offer then 3 years ago so that was a plus. The staff & service in the dining room is still excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous stay but service can improve”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: St Regis Singapore (hereafter SRS) is a luxurious property where they have done a great job of implementing the legacy of Lady Astor of New York with an oriental interpretation. The hardware of the hotel is dotted with ample luxury and refinement and it goes a long way to making your stay special. There are still little misses in terms of service levels, but nothing major to deter the lavish experience that SRS stands to provide. I was at the SRS when it was at its busiest since its birth – The receptionist actually confirmed this; that they were indeed at their busiest time ever. Carla who checked me in was very friendly and professional but was in such a hurry that she forgot to mention the elite amenities with her radio-earphone ringing into her ear with non-stop calls. I think she wanted to escort me to my room but decided not to when we reached the elevators – she wished us a good stay from the lift doors and assured us that our butler would greet us in the room shortly. Well, the butler never came until that same evening, some 6 hours later. This brief check-in encounter was actually symbolic to the entire service experience at the SRS for our entire stay. The staff are friendly and genuine but are not as ‘polished’ in their delivery of the actual service. The door-men, for example, were helpful and charming when we engaged them but when we didn’t they were busy in their private chatters whilst the guests walked right by them. Not a big deal – I do not need to be greeted with a “welcome back” like they do at the Shangri-la - but certainly a sight unfit for the name of a St Regis. The breakfast service was equally friendly but lacking in efficiency. We had our breakfast at the ballroom since the restaurant closed. I ordered eggs at the egg-station and was told to wait in my seat and that the eggs would be delivered but they never arrived. When I went back to check some 5 mins later, my eggs were already cooked and placed on the side and… forgotten about. The lady apologized and offered to make new ones but I politely declined and brought back my not-so-hot eggs. Friendly? Yes. Efficient? Not really. The same was seen at the drawing room during the platinum happy-hour. The lady who seemed to be a manager was evidently ‘training’ one of the gentlemen in handling the electronic register, that it was extremely difficult to get either of their attention. When I did get their attention, they were attentive but it got frustrating after a while in having to wave our arms so much that I found myself getting up to walk up to them to make my orders. Friendly? Yes. Delivery? A B- grade at best. Perhaps the only saving grace in terms of service was the butler service which I found to be quite prompt and service-oriented. Wilbur, in particular, was evidently more seasoned than the other butlers at the SRS and he made me feel at ease with the requests. Unfortunately, this butler service alone was not enough to salvage the general unpolished service levels at the SRS. Having said that, the service levels were not bad per se, just a tad under-whelming for a property carrying the St Regis flag. Aside from these service-level misses, everything else was fit for a St Regis brand. Many have concerns over the design aspect of the rooms at the SRS but I actually found it charming. Bathrooms are made of marble with great showers and a wonderful deep-soak tub. The pool & spa was a welcoming space and I did enjoy the artworks around the property very much. Do not pass by all the paintings mindlessly but take time to check the artists’ names… you may be in for a pleasant surprise! (Here is a challenge, look out for originals by Picasso and Miro!) Location-wise, the hotel is perfect if you are looking for proximity to the shopping haven of Orchard Road whilst being far enough to be in a quiet location. Next to the SRS is the Tanglin mall where you can find restaurants as well. The ION Orchard (center of gravity for shopping in Singapore) is about a 15 min walk – and given it is a walk along the Orchard road it is a pleasant one. It is also a stone throw away from the American/Australian/UK embassies and the royal botanic gardens is also within walking distance. Although not as ‘central’ as say, the Hilton or the Marriot (both of which are in the middle of Orchard Road), I did find the location ‘right’ for me. I should also mention the Astor Bar at the SRS. It is worth mentioning for two things, the jazz musicians that play at night and its very impressive wine collection. Whether you are looking to share a casual glass of Chardonnay with SGD 100/bottle or a lavish night of splurge with a 1996 Chateau Rothschild Lafite (five digits SGD) and everything in between, you will find them here with a smooth live band under a luxurious setting. I would highly recommend that you stop by for at least one night, pour yourself a red, admire the artwork from your luxurious furniture with soulful jazz surrounding you and… a service level from the bar staff that is friendly but very slow (again… the service issue).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ok location.”
Reviews.Author: Jennyp622
Reviews.Content: if your plan in Singapore is to only shop-this is the place for you. we were a group of friends traveling so it was far from the marina/casino and restaurants Excellent mix of luxury and art though. New hotel, great spacious rooms, awesome butler, beautiful small spa and pool and delicious bfast. if your a first time visitor just know that here you will have to take taxi's everywhere (which are usually readily available).

Reviews.Title: “isolated location, excellent rooms, but overall overrated”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: since the standards are so high for st regis, i will focus on the bad things about st regis. - location is isolated. far from orchard MRT so you need to take taxi everywhere. the malls in the vicinity are like airport duty free malls and lack local charm and culture - check-in queue took 10 minutes of standing in line. there were only 2 staff checking people in while a supervisor looking lady was just supervising / looking over the staffs shoulders / glancing at her smartphone. someone should have been proactive and offered the 3 parties in the queue to take a seat on the couch. however, i should mention that the sitting check-in staff were very courteous and apologetic for the wait. - buffet breakfast was just OK. definitely not worth S$100 for 2 pax - there are dozens of adult movies on demand but only 9 blockbuster movies on demand?? - gym feels like an afterthought. even the gym at the sheraton towers feels much better

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and slick service”
Reviews.Author: Siwalks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night as a treat for my wife and I. The checking-in was seamless and friendly. We were given a room on the 19th floor, it was beautiful and the views amazing. We made use of the butler who was great and is a nice touch. Really top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: CK L
Reviews.Content: This is not my usual type of place to stay but my company insisted on putting me here after a long flight from LAX. It started at check in when they could not find my reservation. I guess they put the new people on the desk at 11pm as the woman seemed lost trying to use the system. Went for a quick bite to eat at the restaurant in the morning and the hostess took 5 minutes to ask co-worker where I could be seated even though half the restaurant was empty. Check out was cold and impersonal. I was only in the hotel 8 hours but was not impressed if this is supposed to be one of Singapore’s top hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Slipped a bit since last year”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: Last year we wrote that we considered this hotel one of the best in the world but, unfortunately, they have slipped a bit. Small things like stained carpeting in the hallways and in the rooms. Failure by housekeeping to respond to a request for an electrical adapter. Getting a call on the day of departure asking when we'd be vacating our room when, as Starwood Gold members, we are entitled to late checkout and informed them when we checked in of our intention to checkout at 4:30 pm on the day of departure. The hotel was very busy and it seemed that they were inadequately staffed for that level of occupancy. All this for a very high price. Hopefully, they will wake up before next year when we plan to read some current reviews before booking them again.

Reviews.Title: “Singapores diamond”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the st Regis for a few days and loved everything about it! Th rooms are divine, the staff are amazing and the spa is excellent! You cannot believe the breakfast, stunning! Best hotel in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “A good city stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmanuelleB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the St Regis. We won a night on a golf competition. The executive suite was very nicely decorated, the bathroom amenities great as you expect it at the St Regis. However, the butler was very slow to answer and since everything is there, I do not understand why you need to call the butler for little service like tea or coffee.it would be good to have all those in room and call the butler for buffer things. We had no ice in the bucket.... Overall the service was ok but I am sure they can do better, after all it's supposed to be an excellent hotel. The restaurant in the hotels are quite good and the service is good for Singapore....I love the bar, it has a very British feeling, and love the Picasso on the walls.... Everywhere in the hotel there is art and this is absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Infopal
Reviews.Content: Modern, Luxurious, comfortable and relaxing interiors of guest rooms. However I found the lighting in the room a bit dull. The service was great always people around to assist you. Butler service is great and efficient, one gets to meet people of different nationalities that adds to the flavor of this hotel. Food was great and the breakfast was excellent. Location on orchard road is very convenient as it is on th email drag. Overall a great stay

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious & Impressive Stay.”
Reviews.Author: DIAMONDROSES
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a superb 1 nite stay in this spacious, classy and meticulously-maintained hotel. The well trained and courteous check-in staff enquired the reason for my stay and later had some delicious cake and wine sent up through our personal butler. This was a pleasant and well appreciated surprise. Requested for the services of our butler twice and spoke to 2 different butlers - both young ladies were prompt, gracious and helpful. The room (just a Executive Deluxe Room) was huge and beautiful. The decor was tasteful, expensive and still looked very new. The king-size bed with the top end Sealy Mattress was very comfortable. Loved the long window seat and 2 seater sofa and well matched cushions. The huge bathroom was in marble with luxury furnishings plus a state-of-the-art tv in the mirror facing the bathtub. The walk- in closet in the bathroom was an added bonus. We had no trouble with the automatic day n night curtains or any of the other fixtures. My birthday dinner in the beautiful Brasserie de Saveurs did not disappoint. Service and food was impeccable. Ordered a birthday cake and it came with a candle and complimentary photo and card. Enjoyed the luxurious facilities in The Remede Spa too. Altogether our stay in The St Regis Singapore was an outstanding and unforgettable experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: MelBNolan
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights over the Easter weekend at the St. Regis Singapore. The overriding impression that I've taken away from my stay is the hotel's lack of consistency that abounds in every area and customer touch point. If a hotel is going to bill itself as a luxury 5 star property and commensurately charge room rates and F&B prices in line with a luxury experience then it must perform. Sadly this hotel failed to provide a price/value relationship or a memorable positive impression. High Points: 1. Steve and George at the Remede Spa were highly professional and provided an amazing experience and a very high level of service. Low Points: 1. Upon my arrival two of the three check in desks were manned and I stood in what felt like the middle of the lobby waiting for someone to check me in. No one offered me a drink or a seat. At lesser hotels I've been escorted directly to my room and the check in process handled out of the view of public inspection. 2. The overall quality of the F&B at breakfast, dinner and room service was mediocre. Add to the average food less then average service. Not once in the 5 mornings that I had breakfast in the hotel did anyone remember that I drink a flat white and offer to bring me my coffee, nor did anyone every come back to ask if I wanted a second cup of coffee. 3. The wall sconce light fixture over the night table on the right side of the bed was missing the decorative crystal base and was a mismatch to the light fixture on the left side of the bed. 4. The door on the decorative wood cupboard that housed the small frig and in room bar was broken and did not close properly and remainder ajar during my entire stay. Points 3 and 4 may seem petty, if i was staying at a 3 star hotel i would not bother to mention them but this is a 5 star property and the lack of attention to detail is not acceptable. 5. Breakfast on Saturday and Sunday was not served in the restaurant, instead it was served in one of the Ball Rooms and was a 3 ring circus disaster. I was not given any prior warning that the venue had moved. As a courtesy to guests I would have at least expected a note from the general manager delivered to my room informing me of the change and offering me the option of room service. 6. Very young inexperienced staff. The highly touted butler service that the St. Regis is supposed to be know for was less then stellar. I don't think I had the same butler more then once. When I stayed at the Alvear Palace I had the same 3 butlers on a rotation who sat at a desk on my floor in the lift lobby and greeted me every time I went in and out of my room. As a SPG member I am predisposed to use Starwood properties when I travel. Given my recent stay at the St. Regis Singapore I'm now reconsidering my up coming stays in May at the W in Seminyak and St. Regis Nusa Dua.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 6 star hotel as claimed”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: Sheraton have badly mislead travellers by claiming that the St Regis as a 6 star hotel. It is not even up to the same standard as other 5 star hotels in Singapore. We booked a suite and the first problem arose upon checkin when the staff tried to sell us an upgrade to a larger room. Hey, we already had a suite, so the attempt to extract more $ wasn't appreciated. We were also supposed to receive butler servcie, but never saw any such person. The room was large with a separate lounge area with flat screen TV etc. All OK. We experienced problems operating all the equipment. The air con unit wouldn't respond to our desired settings. The remote controlled blinds were difficult to operate and we couldn't find the controls. Where was that butler? Like wise for the room lighting, complicted to turn on/off, again no instructions. Breakfast was only average, poor selection and the egg station was never manned when we were there. For the price not worth it, better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, dining and food of very mediocre quality”
Reviews.Author: thedonchop
Reviews.Content: We got a special weekend rate at the St. Regis in Singapore. As we are residenced in Singapore and did not have time to take a trip abroad for the long- weekend, we decided a night at this luxuirous hotel would be a nice getaway for a comfortable stay. Check- in and the butler service were in-line with a quality 5- star hotel. The room was very spacious while the bathroom was amazing. The stand-alone tub, the ample space, and modern shower made it the best bath I have ever had. There was a complimentary wine- tasting in the Decanter bar that was a nice touch though, we were limited to three glasses that needed to be picked on the spot. Also, the cheese selection was okay but I suspect this was down to one of the other parties taking heaping plates of whatever was on offer. The Astor Bar is a cool place to have a cocktail and a chat. Good mix of old & modern ambiance. The staff were superb including the butler that was very professional and seemed to be very proud of his the service he offered. My main gripe about all of this was the food- the breakfast buffet and the dinner - a combination of room service and food sent up from the French bistro located in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was good but, it was clear that during the facade cleaning and other maintenance, the rate was lowered per night for the weekends and the breakfast moved to one of the conference or ballrooms. While this was still more than sufficient (the food quality was good), the choices were quite low in quantity and very generic for Singapore 5-star hotels. This was not even close to Shangri- La's "The Line" even though the St. Regis has much better cosmetic appeal. The room-rate I was charged indicated breakfast would be at the Brasserie Les Saveurs restaurant or the Italian restaurant. While I was aware of the Italian restaurant being under renovation, at check-in we were nonchalantly told breakfast would be in a large general area. I had heard pretty good things about the buffet breakfast and was disapppointed to find that the experience would be downgraded. Also, we ordered dinner in our room from Brasserie Les Saveurs. While it was fantastic for the butler to have this arranged, the food quality was not good. Yes, hotels tend to charge more for food services (as evidenced by our SGD 29.00 paneer makhani from room service that was passable), but the dinner from Brasserie Les Saveurs was totally unacceptable. There are at least 4-5 similar type of restaurants scattered throughout Singapore that charge less for the same or specific items AND provide better quantity and quality. It's not even close. I assumed this would be the case but, my partner convinced me that a hotel of the quality that St. Regis posses would provide good good as compared to say a four- star hotel or even some of the so-called 5- star hotels in town. This assumption made total sense but in hindsight, I feel as though we should have went along with my original plan of buying the similar food at one of the other French restaurants/bistros in town + Indian food from near our residence in Singapore and packing it up for dinner. Everything was fantastic apart from the food. While this may seem trivial to some, this is a 5 start hotel and every aspect of the stay evidenced this apart from the dining. I was looking forward to a good meal for dinner and at breakfast but, I was disappointed as I only had one day to use for my holiday and was misinformed when I booked the room about the breakfast offering. The breakfast buffet was loud (service was good- but eggs took 20 minutes for over-easy) and had a feel of a huge cafeteria with carpeting. Overall, this was a unique and comfortable stay but it could have been better. We seemed to be warned on number of occassions that the hotel was full. Understandable, but not an excuse to scrimp on some services such as dining. Coincidentally, this type of warning was also mentioned in previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the St Regis”
Reviews.Author: ed8586
Reviews.Content: About two weeks ago, I booked a St Regis suite for my proposal to my girlfriend. The suite had a living room with a seating area to hold 7-8 guests. i had some guests (family of my fiancee, party of five) who came to celebrate the special occasion with us , and I wanted to get them some hot beverages. As such, I followed the instructions that came along at the wet bar and contacted the In Room Dining to proceed ordering. I was informed by the staff that attended to me that we were only entitled to two orders, that of the registered guests plus one. He added that the policy states that the other drinks ordered will be chargeable. However, this was not what I understood based on the instructions at the wet bar (no instructions that said we could not order beyond 2 guests, and nothing about being chargeable). Given that the hotel gave free flow of cold beverages from the mini bar, I was perplexed why this did not apply to the hot beverages as well. At the spur of my frustration, I questioned the staff: if I had wanted to try a variety of drinks, would the same policy apply. He said that if that was the case, I would "only be allowed to order once every few hours". I was appalled at his reply, and did not expect such a service level from a six-star hotel. I then requested to talk to the director of hotel rooms, Mr Ian Tan. The staff mentioned that he would get Ian to call me.After 15 minutes, I did not hear from Ian, and as such, I gave them a call again. Another staff picked up the call, and when I told him that I was waiting for Ian's call, he asked for the reason behind that. I quickly recapped what happened, and was given a similar reply. Frustrated, I ended the call after hearing the same reasoning.A few moments later, our butler came into the room with the original orders that they allowed. I explained our situation to him, and he said he could waive the charges for us. I was pleased with his attempt at service recovery, and I thanked him for his good service.Shortly after, the manager-on-duty called and reiterated the hotel's policy. He also mentioned that other hotels would have done the same by providing drinks for registered guests plus one. That was not what I experienced in other hotels though. He later added that since it was my big day, he would make an exception by waiving the charges of the additional beverages.Paying for the additional charges was not the bulk of the problem. I was upset that after paying so much for the room and the flower arrangements in St Regis, this was the service I had received from the In Room Dining team.Thankfully, our butler came in with all our orders, and included a box of chocolates, which was thoughtful. The butler really helped turned the situation around. We were initially considering having our wedding at the St Regis, but after such an unpleasant encounter, I think I would have no choice but to choose another hotel. There were two things that really upset me. The manager on duty said that I would be receiving the same treatment at other hotels. However the reason why i choose this hotel to have my engagement was because I strongly felt St Regis wouldn’t be like any other hotel but offer superior service as compared to its competitors. I was disappointed. Secondly, after emailing them about this and waiting a week for a reply, I have received none. I am starting to think that maybe my comments don’t matter at all to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite address in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Qim84
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Singapore has been my utmost favorite place to call 'home' whenever i am in Singapore. For both business and leisure, St. Regis never cease to make me wanting to come back again each time i checked out. Location wise, it is not exactly near to where the shopping action is. Eg. U gonna be all sweaty by the time u reach ION. I would love to suggest creating a shuttle to and fro or just one way to ION or anywhere along the shopping strip. St. Regis should know what type of clientele that they are expecting, and I bet they often see their guests coming back in with many shopping bags along (me). W Hong Kong, for example provide shuttle service to Tsim Sha Shui for their guest. I think most guests in SR would definitely love SR more if there's such service :) Service, as expected from the SR name. I won't say the best, but improvements are always there. Most staffs are helpful and gracious. Doormen are always cheerful, and receptionists are always smiley. Rooms are large, and the butler service are quite fast. However the housekeeping seems to be on the 'stingy' side replenishing. In all, this is a hotel that even until today, it gives such aura that whenever i took the cab to the hotel, most taxi drivers would start asking what do i do, how nice is this hotel is, or how much per night etc etc some even say 'isn't this a 6-star hotel!?' with such astonished tone. So, St Regis Singapore, please keep up the good work or improvise services so that such aura will continue on. As for me, I guess I will be seeing you again by the end of this month :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not luxury with a good location”
Reviews.Author: kichristag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice decorated and a good hotel in a perfect location with good connections to Expressway and business locations. Generally i do not have many things to complain, if it would be a standard hotel. But for this price class, i expected much more and was disappointed. Even if they are small things, but in a luxury hotel this should not happen. Sheraton is much better and has much lower prices and better services. Room: nice and functional, except the Air Conditioning, which is never had the set temperature and was always to cold. Set 23 degree and actual 20 degree. So a few minutes on and then need to switch off manually. Perfect lightening, even a little complicated with the control panel and also the master switch, is not switching off the bathroom so need to be switched off separately. Service: generally good to perfect with many details: The entrance door needs to be opened by your own, as there is nobody at the night. When i had a problem with the electric curtain, the first day, nobody repaired until i was home in the evening and the second day the room maid, said that it needs to be repaired and somebody will come immediately. After 2 hours i went sleep and put the sign Do not disturb, as nobody was coming, Even if the sign was there the door bell was ringing, i guess from the maintenance stuff. Food: There was a canapé for platinum members and the choice of food is very poor compared with another hotel from SPG. Breakfast: We need to queue for getting a seated as the restaurant was overcrowded and this should not happen in such a hotel. If i am in vacation, that is not a problem, but in a luxury hotel, you need to guess 30 minutes, this is not expected at all. Further (it was 30 minutes before closing time) some kind of food was not anymore available or needed to be waited for a long time. (egg app. 10 minutes, Bacon was not available, butter was not available) I think, for this price and for the name St, Regis this should not happen and disappointed me totally, especially as i came too late to my appointment due to this reason. Also i was seated to a small table and when i came back, the table was occupied from somebody else and i needed to wait for another table, with the food in my hand. The selection and quality of the food is average. Finally i am platinum member and not had the choice for the wanted amenity at check inn, nor was upgraded, even if there, according to the hotel site, there was all rooms categories available. (or maybe i did not recognized, that the room was upgraded, as i am not used to this hotel and only has the feeling) Finally: it is a good hotel with nice rooms, but not worth the money for a luxury hotel. If it would be a 3 star hotel I would rate the hotel as “perfect”, but not a higher standard. Definitely I will not come back and cannot recommend as high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a trans pacific flight to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Eijtraveler
Reviews.Content: We picked the St. Regis Singapore for a one night stay at the end of a cruise because I am a Starwood Platinum member and I could use points. I was very pleasantly surprised at what a great hotel it was and how beautiful and spacious the standard rooms are! The bathroom itself was nearly 2/3 the size of a typical hotel with a claw footed tub, a multi-jetted spa shower and a separate room for the toilet. The walk in closet was well appointed, given that this was not a suite or even a junior suite. The service and friendliness of the staff was also exceptional. We look forward to any opportunity to visit again! I give this hotel my highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Period grandeur with modern conveniences and bespoke service”
Reviews.Author: Wendy Y
Reviews.Content: Classy and tasteful decor. Room was good-sized, though view was only of Tanglin Road. Service was good eg instead of the usual beverage packets in your room to make your own tea with, here, you call the butler and he comes with it made and served on a nice tray. Doormen also auto offered umbrellas on our way out for shopping on cloudy days. Bathroom comes with state-of-the-art tech ie tv in the mirror for you to watch while soaking in bath. While we knew beforehand the distance to the shopping belt, it was still hard to reconcile to the actual walking; a tad far from the main Orchard area. Needed to take a bus out but hard to take one back as the road flanking hotel is 1-way, so return alighting point is way behind or needed to take the only 1 or 2 buses that made the u-turn to the side road of hotel. Didn't try any restaurants in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool ,service incredible love the wily butler with coffee at your door awesome.”
Reviews.Author: W0rldcitizenkiwi
Reviews.Content: I have always live the st regis singapore a suburb hotel with an eclectic collection of art and beautifully finished , very amazing location great location F and Beverages a bit pricey but ok far from reasonable mind you. Forecourt service good arrival and departure , checking personal efficient , private, conceirge very accommodating I go here every trip to singapore if not for the entire stay at least for a few nights start and finish for the Luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed, unprofessional service for a luxury brand”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to be wowed with such a luxury brand and when you get to the hotel you really feel the luxury and style. The lobby is impressive and the quality of furnishing throughout is top notch. As a platinum member I was expecting a special check-in desk but there was none. However I did not need to wait much. I asked for the Butler service as it is advertised and they make such a fuss about this, however, and despite my platinum status I got no Butler. The front desk personnel were lost as nobody was answering their calls. It was Saturday afternoon and there was no Butler to be seen. Eventually he appeared unexpectedly in my room one hour later and I was already unpacked so I sent him packing (if you pardon the pun!). So I cannot comment on this service other than I have the feeling that not getting this service is quite normal. It feels like they are under-staffed and for such an expensive hotel this is not good. In the evening while I was going back to my room and was alone in the elevator, a porter entered with a huge trolley packed with over 10 suitcases. He almost crushed me in the elevator and I felt this was completely wrong. Why would they send trolleys with guests as opposed to using a service elevator? I noticed they were hogging 2 elevators with trolleys and they were not paying any attention to all other guests trying to get into them. It felt like a 3 star hotel at an airport and for over $500 for a standard room this is unacceptable. I brought this to the attention of the Duty Manager who, besides saying how sorry they were, she did not give any explanation regarding why they are using guests elevators instead of service elevators for luggage. She looked puzzled like this was the norm and natural to squeeze guests and trolleys in an elevator and at the same time (not even waiting for the next one) I noticed that all the Staff were very young and they looked also very inexperienced which would explain part of this, but it does not explain that a luxury brand like St. Regis would treat guests like this. The double room was very nice with a superb bathroom full of marble and luxury furnishings. Great looking classic lamps throughout and all in all looking expensive. Only issue that I can say about the room is that you need an engineering degree and loads of patience to manage the control panel for the lights, curtains and the rest. I could not turn off the lights at night. and finally had to go to the entrance and switch off the master control. Reading other reviews at Tripadvisor I can see other people experienced the same. They should have someone coming with you to your room to explain it all, but as explained before no Butler and not even a porter helped me with this. All in all, very underwhelmed by the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DELHIGURU
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place ...3 hotels generally in singapore are considered the best:- mandarin oriental, raffles and st.regis....i would rate st.regis higher than the other 2 and yes, some people might find it shocking that i am rating it higher than the iconic Raffles.....reasons are simple...the st.regis butler service is one of the best I have seen.....raffles has history on its side but it becomes too much of history if you have to watch TV on a 1960s era small Hitachi TV in the Raffles vis a vis all the uptodate modern facilities of the St.Regis...this hotel also overshadows the Mandarin Oriental whose room service food was amongst the worst i have ever had..overall, i would highly recommend the hotel to the business traveller//....

Reviews.Title: “Losing it's sparkle?”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1001
Reviews.Content: Last year when I stayed at the St Regis I really liked the hotel. This time I wasn't so sure. On the positive side, the hotel is well located with large comfortable rooms and impressive public spaces. The standard of fittings in the rooms is extremely high. The brasserie (in fact more like a smart French restaurant than a brasserie) is excellent and the wine list especially good. But the experience of staying there as a guest was very mixed. Check in was chaotic. As the electronics in the rooms are surprisingly complicated to operate (I still had not mastered the lights after two days staying in the hotel and despite the help of three pages of notes on "Technology and Telephone" in the directory of services), it would be better to show guests to the rooms rather than just directing them from the lobby. A request for a soft feather pillow was followed by a long wait and then the delivery of a hard foam pillow. The restaurant was full at breakfast this morning and so I was asked to sit in "the Drawing Room" (part of the lobby) to eat breakfast. The breakfast buffet was crowded and poorly laid out. Unfortunately the Italian restaurant was closed for renovation so dining options were limited. I suspect that there are now better options in Singapore at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “The design and decor are its only saving graces”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: Before I delve into the reasons why this hotel is highly overvalued, I should note that the hotel itself is beautiful. I believe they commissioned an American architect and the decor is very nice. They use a lot of deeper and richer colors and it gives off a sense of class. Unfortunately, St. Regis' service is unable to live up to the expectation that St. Regis' pricing and decor set. My wife and I stayed one night in a suite, but we encountered the following difficulties: - My father wasn't able to check-in to his own room until after 4:30pm (with an inflexible check-out time of 12pm, this is crazy) - I asked for a butler to come move several bags from my father's room to my suite (St. Regis touts 24 hour dedicated butler service. As my dad joked - it takes 24 hours for the butler to come), he comes almost half an hour later, and offers the following explanation for the tardiness: The hotel is at full occupancy, also, the St. Regis hosts many VIP guests, such as a lot of royalty from Dubai. This infuriated me for two reasons: Firstly, I don't know how a high class hotel such as the St. Regis is going to tell me that they don't have the manpower to deal with full occupancy. It's obvious they don't have the manpower because their housekeeping is unable to turnover the rooms until almost 5pm on a weekday. In another tripadvisor review, I saw one of the manager responses quote "full occupancy" as a source of their problems. Hey St. Regis - You're a premier hotel, and you need to start filling out your staff to be able to meet the demands of a fully occupied hotel. I imagine that's business 101. Secondly, I don't need to be told there are more important people than myself staying at the hotel. Please don't insinuate that my time is worth less than someone else's time because of their pedigree or wealth. If you expect royalty to be highly resource intensive, you need to hire new staff rather than take away staff that would otherwise be serving me. I pay way too much for that sort of treatment. - I called the front desk to send up a transformer because I needed it urgently. They called me back 20 minutes later saying they don't have one available. If I need one "urgently", please at least check to see if you have one so you can let me know asap that there is none available. I would have found other ways of solving my problem. This one ended up being a massive pain in the neck and cost me 20 minutes that I didn't have. - And here's the worst story of the night: It was actually my wedding night and my wife and I retired to our suite at 12:30am after spending the end of our wedding night out with family. We wanted a nice bottle of wine to just settle down and and relax. The room service menu had a few selections of wine but stated that it has a more extensive list upon request. I called downstairs to have the list sent up, and 10 minutes later, f&b calls me to say that I have the menu in the room. I ask, "is it the one in the room service menu?" She responds, "Yes that's the one." I inform her that it says there's a more extensive list available. She says she will get it to me right away. Another 10 minutes pass and I call again, they said it's coming up. Half an hour after the initial call, the menu still has not arrived. Infuriated, my wife and I just walk out, and the only option we find is 7-11. So rather than a nice meal and some nice wine to end the night, we end up with 7-11's finest, as well as a bag of Lay's Sour Cream & Onion. It wasn't exactly the way we wanted to end our wedding night, and really it was all due to St. Regis' ineptitude. - There were a few minor technical problems as well including running out of tissue, faulty light (that the technician actually took out the entire bedside console to try and fix, and ended up resetting electricity to our entire room for). - To end on a bright note, the shower was pretty amazing. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anybody. Not just because of a bad personal experience, but because the service received fell so short of what you expect at the price point. I've stayed in motels with much snappier service than the St. Regis. There are many cheaper hotels along Orchard that will give you a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Didzis R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of hotels in Singapore, so far this was the best experience. When I thought that a club room at Marina Bay Sands was good, St. Regis topped it. Not worth writing any more- everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: NaTom6869
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the St Regis. The service is excellent, the rooms are luxurious and the butler service is very good. The gym is equally well appointed and the pool is stunning. Bars and restaurants are very good as well. The only slightly negative point is sometimes the lengthy check in/out so people need to queue. I also queued twice for quite a while to have my room key re-actived - should not happen at a five star property like this one and the concierge should be able to deal with this. Will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbwoods
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with excellent facilities. Service can improve a little more.

Reviews.Title: “A Starwood expectation!”
Reviews.Author: RavenFrost
Reviews.Content: My first experience of the St. Regis SIngapore was simply...Whoa... the art at the lobby and even the drive thru was impressive... being a regular Starwood visitor.. when i checked into the Lady Astor suite.. i thought it couldn't get any better! but i was wrong... the room was out-fitted to impress the most critical guest especially since once was paying top dollar!.. to add to this our Butler helped me unpack and organize my stuff which i believed was a god-send!... and wished i could stow her away in my suitcase and take home as a souvenir...! dinner @ Brasserie Les Saveurs is a must if you want to have a romantic escape whilst being pampered by gastronomic delights... however i was very disappointed to see that they served Shark Fin soup...being an avid Shark fan this was something i found unacceptable. I did have a great holiday and will definitely be back..

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL IN EVERY ASPECT!”
Reviews.Author: chrisperryman
Reviews.Content: We love to travel, and enjoy plush accommodations, excellent service and delightful cuisine - THIS HOTEL HAS IT ALL AND MORE! It certainly lives up to its 5 Star rating. We stayed in November 2010 prior to an Asian cruise, which Singapore was departure port. We booked what we thought an exceptional package through LUXURY LINK and a very good price. VIP pickup at airport was the beginning of a wonderful experience and stay at The REGIS. Whisked through customs by personal valet, while we waited for our luggage to be brought to us, served with whatever drinks we preferred and tasty snacks. Then into our Bentley to take us to the hotel. Simply huge corner suite, gorgeous view, decor, furnishings, marble bathrooms - everything top notch, oh and we checked in in our suite! Service all the way! Wine a cheese everything evening and cofee/tea brought to our suite whenever we wanted. ALL included in a fantastic price. When we had to leave, The Bentley arrived to take us to the port. Oh yes, food at the Restaurants was extremely well prepared and served. We will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Property”
Reviews.Author: drmark77
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated on Tanglin Road adjacent to the spectacular shopping mecca of Orchard Road. The service was impeccable and attentive. Private check-in areas are a nice touch. We were picked up, as arranged, at the airport in the middle of the night by the most pleasant and helpful driver you could ask for. The new Mercedes was immaculate and perfect for our short ride. Our room was exquisite and perfectly appointed with terrific amenities. Everyone on the hotel staff was absolutely perfect in their duties.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful place to lay your head at the end of the day.”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that this property is around the bend from the end of Orchard Road in a more residential area. It takes 5 minutes to get to Orchard road with many great coffee places and shopping. Depending on your walk speed, 10-15 minutes to the MRT station, which I didn't find to be a burden. The lobby and check in were great. The room was amazing with a huge bathroom and every mirror heated, even the one in the shower itself. The electronic controls for the lights and shades were well laid out and worked very well. Everything in the room was high quality and useful. The room was not huge but quiet and had everything you would expect. One tip for those who arrive early - At 7:30 am I was asked to pay for a full half day for a the same room I would have gotten had I waited until 10:30. I realize they need to maintain a certain posh factor and I do appreciate the staff not knocking me about with lies and being direct.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Natssant
Reviews.Content: I would say this is the best hotel I ever stayed. Everything was so perfect from start to the end. The style was tasteful, modern but yet luxury (not a cliché luxury like others) Stayed 3 nights in April 2011 in the deluxe room. The room was very spacious for the basic category in Singapore. The bathroom is fabulous and very large. Staffs were very friendly, smart and attentive. Butler tried so much to serve whatever we need. Room was equipped with Bose sound system and LCD but for St.Regis I would expect Blu-ray and LED instead. The food was exceptional for taste, quality and service. The spa area was amazing and looks very well crafted. Our stay was amazing as we spend most of the day in the hotel instead of go out and explore Singapore city. Would definitely come back again .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: flavorKobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5nights and enjoyed good stay. Coffee service aft morning call is good for day activity start up, and also wine tasting was very good. Breakfast buffet menu variety was not so wide if we compare with that of Shang lira close by, but taste was good. View from room is wide sky and clear view. About 5min walk to Orchard MRT, but easy to go out with taxi. I would like to back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Miklos1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions. Both times I was completely satisfied. Unlike many modern hotels the rooms are large and have high ceilings giving a very spacious feeling. The restaurants are good but you do have to make reservations for them since they are perpetually full. The one complaint I would have is the selection of pay per view movies is tragic at best. I also wanted to mention that I read the reviews of the hotel and found the ones complaining of bad service to be perplexing. I can report absolutely no issues. Everything worked like clockwork, all staff behaved in a very professional manner. I would and will go back to this hotel every time I visit Singapore. It is simply better than the rest.

Reviews.Title: “I am impressed”
Reviews.Author: mchour
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1517. Spacious room filled up with technology (incl Bose sound system). The deco is not my taste (prefer contemporary style) but all in top shape and maintained in such a way that i felt the hotel opened yesterday, and all perfectly clean. The staff were well selected and trained - came across as genuinely polite and humble. Setting for breakfast and selection items great too. We have not seen all hotels in Singapore but this is certainly one of the best. The only negative comment stop charging for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Rachpl
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience one of the best hotels in Singapore, then definitely give St. Regis Singapore a try. From the moment I walked into the lobby I was greeted by a friendly doorman and was immediately taken through to the check-in area where it didn't take long for them to show me to my room. The room was very generous in size as there was plenty of wardrobe space, a sitting/couch area and one of the most spacious and luxurious bathrooms. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, the only complaint I have is that they were too comfortable and I simply didn't want to get out of bed in the morning! St. Regis is also located in a very convenient part of town, just a short stroll away from Orchard Road shopping. The morning breakfast was also a delight where there was a great selection of eastern and western style food. It was certainly a treat to enjoy breakfast at St Regis in a light filled room just beside the pool. The only fault I found whilst having breakfast were the non-attentive waitstaff. I had to wave my hand several times to get their attention for a refill of tea, but perhaps that is just the quality of service in Singapore generally speaking, which compared to Thailand, they still have a fair way to go. I can't speak in terms of value for money, as I didn't have to pay for my stay (business travel), but I certainly do recommend it if you want to experience top quality luxury in Singapore. I have stayed in other mid-range to 5 star hotels in Singapore before, but this definitely topped them all!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2boysVN
Reviews.Content: I live in SE Asia (expat from USA) and have been to Singapore several times and stayed at different hotels - all good (except one and I wrote a review of same). This hotel is exceptional - I tend to only bother reviewing great or awful experiences. This is a wonderful hotel - has a boutique luxury feeling but also amazing business amenities. The rooms are spacious with beautiful furnishings and excellent baths. Rooms are very quiet. Food and service all you could ask for and location... Perfect. A stone's throw from Orchard but on a serene stretch of Tanglin road and very near GlenEagles Med center and the US and AU embassies. One block away is Tanglin mall with a variety of shops favored by moms and a few eateries. I will never stay any place else. The only caveat is that the rooms are very hi-tech - auto day curtains and blackout shades - Bose surround sound and iPod hookups and auto light settings for everything. Took a while for me to figure out if I wanted "cozy" or "welcome" and needed engineer to come a few times to help me with tv, listening to my iPod and even the air con. At this moment, i am waiting for someone to help me close the auto drapes but don't mind. Techies will love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marlene1124
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a three week business trip in November 2011. It was honestly one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The rooms have an old world decor but are very new and the appliances and amenities are very modern. The type of service you get here is unrivaled. The hotels in Asia are definitely top grade in service but the St. Regis certainly took the cake! Would return here in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tybas
Reviews.Content: My wife, sons and I had a very nice stay at the St. Regis Singapore. This is a great business hotel. If you are on business, it is the place to stay. Breakfast was great, our suite was spacious and clean. The hotel is incredibly quiet, which we like. The butler service was nothing but great. All good. Nearby excursions not to miss for families include the Singapore Zoo (one of the best we have been to) and the Botanical Garden which was very tranquil. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Excellent hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ieasabel
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel near Orchard street. The hotel is really great and it looks very modern and luxurious. The hotel is well known from its excellentbuttler service. The staff knoledge and kindness was very good. The check in and out was express. I am waiting that from 1 march 2012 all SPG Gold members will get complimentary internet access because it was really no sense to pay a lot for it. The Hotel is well known from excellent Remede Spa and its fitness and pool amenities. But it is nothing comparing to indoor teniss court. The breakfast offer was excellent and huge range of products whatever hot or cold. I totally recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: TONY_TravelLover
Reviews.Content: The room is very impressive with huge LCD TV and Bose stereo. They even have a TV while soaking in a bathtub. My favorite of staying here is to have a list of 15 different kinds of pillows to choose from. The service though seems to be quite disappointed. Don't like food there either. I was in the hotel for a week on my business trip and breakfast looks pretty much the same everyday. The hotel is closed to Orchards rd but it's on very far end which requires about 10+ mins of walk to hit Orchards shopping area. To me, it was a good experienced but not really value-to-monry.

Reviews.Title: “Is it becoming the Marina Bay Sands?”
Reviews.Author: London-Lourson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times due to business trips in Singapore and I must say that the service is definitely deteriorating. I arrived at the hotel at 2pm and had to wait 15 mins to check in, then I learnt that the room was not ready (see my review on Marina Bay Sands). I was then told that when my room was ready I would get a call from the reception. By 3pm, no one had called so I went and asked them if my room was ready and to my surprise it was. Now, why didn’t I receive that call? During my wait for the room, I wanted to have some lunch so I went to the coffee shop and was told that they only served snacks. So when I asked where I could get some lunch, the waitress advised that I could go to the restaurant next door. However, they stopped serving lunch at 2pm and I ended up at the coffee shop. Now, why didn’t the waitress know that or did she lose her watch? I expect a lot more from the St. Regis. On the hotel itself, it is a very nice hotel and the location is second to none. But for business trips, I might return to the Conrad and the Grand Hyatt for hols.

Reviews.Title: “Second time's the charm.....umm”
Reviews.Author: Mister7Star
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd and probably unfortunately, the last time we will stay here. The hotel itself is lovely but the service, food and hospitality is definitely not 6 star. After our last review and correspondence with the hotel management, we were told that we would be 'looked after'. Well, nothing happened! Not even an acknowledgement that we had stayed there before until breakfast on the last morning. This review is not just because of this but the hotel bills itself as 'one of the best'. It is not. The service can be 'hit and miss' depending on the staff member but overall one doesn't get a feeling of warmth or hospitality.......the butler had a scowl on his face when he bought us the coffee to our room! From our last visit, it appears that the food is still not as good as it should be. The chicken curry I ordered for room service was appalling (rubbery and bland) however breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hardware, but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: PeterTheGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: As an SPG member, this is my first time at this hotel. Pros: -The room was classy, beautiful and overlooking the botanical garden. -The food quality (room service, which I had 3 times) was excellent -The service at the bar downstairs was great Cons: -Just waiting to check-in (they have only 3 desks which is inadequate during busy times) took 15 minutes, and another 15 minutes for the check-in process at one of their desks. After a long flight, I was annoyed, but no one seemed to give a damn -I asked to speak to the Hotel Manager (twice in fact) and left my mobile number, but they NEVER called me back which I think is strange. Being on a busy trip for business, I can't be bothered to keep chasing them -This morning I called at 7:30AM for room service THREE times as no one picked up the phone. Finally I called the operator, who apologized and who took my order. At this price range and hotel class, I will definitely choose another hotel that has better service--a real disappointment and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with the service”
Reviews.Author: TheStyleTraveller
Reviews.Content: I enjoy each time I stay at St. Regis as the service is impeccable and they live up to their promises. Its in a great location close to the main shopping area of Orchard road and getting around either by foot or public transport...its all there. The rooms are always fresh and when there has been the odd issue, they have quickly solved it. Great breakfast with the atmosphere to enjoy, though you need to pick the right time with the limited space.

Reviews.Title: “Worst St. Regis experience...”
Reviews.Author: nyay
Reviews.Content: This 6 star hotel dissapointed me a lot. Of course, anyone's expectation to 6 star hotel must be very high instead, we pay good price for the value. At their multiple restaurants, it seemed waiters were all inexperienced. Worst one was a waiter kept forgetting the orders, or messing up the course- while someone was eating appetiser, some other waiter came in and started to ask dessert- it was very chaotic. When a big group arrived at the hotel, this room service answered that the food wouldn't be ready for another 90 minutes because they needed to prioritize the group. Hotel staff seemed to be panic in dealing with a big party, and was so surprised at their capability. The room cleanliness was also a question- I ended up calling to warn how to make bed and keep clean the room as hairs stay in the bed and toilet papers are not exchanged even though it's used up. The night time chocolate was a joy and a friendly bell boy was very refreshing throughout this appalling experience at St. Regis in Singapore. - also Spa looked excellent though I didn't have time to use.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Bramantoro
Reviews.Content: My heavenly hotel room was at level 10something. Facing to the street, it was everything that I could ever wanted. It was a really luxury to stay in St Regis, the bathroom, well I stayed too many times watching tv while bathtubbing in the bathroom. And it has a massage shower also. The location was at the end of orchard road, Tanglin rd. So you might have to walk around 5-10 minutes to reach Ion orchard subway station (the nearest station), but knowing that your hotel is a safe haven, the walk is worth it, after spending time around Singapore whole day, you go back to the warmth of the exclusiveness of your room. You have your own personal butler too. That's how exclusive it is.. All in all it's a 5 star ecperience. I love to love it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious oasis.”
Reviews.Author: noddie11
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights here after a cruise round Asia. We had such great service on the cruise, I was expecting our hotel stay to be a let down, but I was wrong. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from town but near a shopping mall.Very good service. We had a butler and I can't fault the service we had from them. Pressing was returned quickly and efficiently and tea was brought within minutes of ordering. I even had a bath drawn which seemed to amuse the butler as much as me! However, I did think it would have been nice to have a biscuit or something with the tea, and we had a bottle of orange juice on arrival, but only one during the entire stay.Evening turn down was good,with lovely chocolate bars being left. The room was comfortable and very nicely decorated with lovely silks. Housekeeping need to pay more close attention however as I discovered a face cloth on the window sill on arrival, that was still there on departure and a big pile of dust at the back of the settee. Theses were minor niggles and the hotel was lovely otherwise. Great breakfast buffet with huge choice of foods. Service in the restaurant was attentive and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Luxury”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: After a very long journey from San Francisco, the St. Regis is an oasis of luxury and refined style. I was last in Singapore ten years ago. In the interim, the city skyrocketed in terms of pure energy and as a hub for travelers from across the globe. The St. Regis is an incredibly welcome spot from which to do business or simply enjoy the incredible city that Singapore has become. Checking in at two a.m., I encountered a front desk team that was efficient, friendly and totally ready to make my stay perfect. I was brought to my room by my butler who took my packed suit and shoes and ensured me that they’d be pressed and shined in time for my busy morning ahead. He would have unpacked everything, but given the time of the morning, I chose not to take his help. My room was large, beautifully appointed and comfortable for sleeping, working or just relaxing. The bathroom was a standard for luxury baths. As a Platinum SPGer, my breakfast was included. Unlike the larger hotels of the American chains in Singapore, breakfast was lower key, more refined and highly personal. Instead of the 500 busy business people standing inline for the buffet, the St. Regis offers personal service and a beautiful and delicious selection of Western and Asian items. The health club is small by hotel standards, but well-equipped and open the a very nice pool. I’m heading back to Singapore in April and already looking forward to my return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - but some aspects of service let it down.”
Reviews.Author: Robh9999
Reviews.Content: Describing a hotel as six stars inevitably invites comparison with the true best hotels & in this case the St Regis, whilst still being a lovely hotel, falls down on some aspects - particularly service. The positive. This is an imposing & immaculate hotel in a good (not great) location on Tanglin Road. Walking to the Orchard MRT station takes about 15 minutes. However, taxis are cheap and plentiful and the hotel doorman are very efficient and helpful. The public areas were very impressive, and the pool area is very inviting with a long but relatively narrow pool surrounded by jacuzzi jets and wet beds. We were not upgraded as the hotel was full, but the "standard" room was a good size and extremely well appointed & luxurious. The bathroom was particularly impressive with the best shower I have ever had, the Remede soaps and gels are my favourite from any hotel brand too. The in room butler service was excellent, prompt and professional. We took advantage of the on-demand teas and the St Regis bubble bath. It is also worth mentioning the benefits if you are a Starwood Platinum Guest - cocktails and canapes by the pool, wine appreciation, breakfast & the usual free internet. We were also extended a 5.30pm check out. So, what wasn't up to scratch for a six star hotel? In short, some of the service was well short of the best hotels I have stayed in. Three examples: On check in I would expect to be taken up to the room & shown the various controls - this happens at hotels such as The Peninsular & Savoy. Here we were shown the lift, but had to ring for the butler to show us around the room. Only a small point, but at this level one that makes a difference. We had a problem with the air conditioning in the room & not only did it take four phone calls before it was properly sorted, but promised calls back to me to tell me what was happening didn't happen - something I would expect in a four star hotel. The service at the pool was poor, people were gesturing at staff in the italian restaurant for service, and the towels weren't frequently put out on the beds, or dirty ones removed. Shame, because this is a great pool. The staff in the restaurant didn't seem to know about the Platinum Starwood canapes and on both days I had to go and find someone to explain why I was waiting. Overall, this is a great hotel - if they can sort out the fine detail of the service it could be a really great one.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel but service slipped a bit”
Reviews.Author: Jayteekay
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel in two months. I found that the service at breakfast to have slipped a bit. I asked for warm milk for my coffee and it did not arrive. I had to ask a second time. Instead of the waiters checking whether your coffee needs refilling, the hotel was so short staffed that I had to look for a passing waiter, waved one of them over and asked for more coffee. Then only one coffee showed up when there were two people at the table. I expected more attention from St Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay But Not for All the Right Reasons”
Reviews.Author: GreenApple07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our travels in Singapore. As Starwood Preferred Guest Gold Member, we expected an upgrade but did not get one; however, we did not notice any separate Starwood Preferred Guest floors so it is possible that no upgrades are available to Starwood Preferred Guests. Here's a breakdown of what we thought about our stay: 1. Room: Beautiful. Spacious bathroom and convenient automatic shades and lighting system. The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable as were the gorgeous bedsheets. Two complimentary water bottles were provided along with a small box of St. Regis chocolates. The shower was amazing. Perfect water pressure. 2. Butler service: Convenient and easy. We were greeted after checking into our room by a butler which was a nice personal touch. We used the service twice to order freshly brewed coffee and tea to our room. It was delivered promptly with impeccable customer service. 3. Wi-fi: No free wi-fi available even in the lobby. We were a bit surprised about this as we have never been to a Starwood property in Asia without any free-wifi in public areas. If I remember correctly, each hour of internet usage in the rooms was about $10 but daily packages were also available. We used the Business Center to access the internet but found this lack of free wi-fi service in public areas to be inconvenient and below expectations of a luxury hotel. 4. Business Center: Located to the left of the check-in desks, the Business Center is equipped with one Apple computer and two PCs. Printing was fairly easy and we did not have any trouble using a computer as there was never more than one other person using the Business Center. 5. Location: Convenient but not as convenient as other hotels such as the Hilton and the Marriott (both are located on Orchard Road). The hotel is about a 5-minute walk to Orchard Road and about 10 minutes from Ion. 6. Concierge: Memorable but for all the wrong reasons. We asked the concierge (one of whom is a Clef d'Or) for two things: (i) the nearest place to do yoga; and (ii) the nearest HSBC Premier Banking Branch. For the yoga request, the concierge told us that he would have to check around to see which yoga places allow drop-ins, which made me raise an eyebrow since most yoga places all allow for drop-ins unless it is a boutique yoga place. The concierge told us that he would leave us a detailed message to our room re: yoga. As for our second request, the concierge took out a map and circled the place where he said we can find a HSBC Premier Banking Branch. When we arrived back to the hotel room 5 hours later, there was no message from the Concierge re: yoga places nearby. I had to go downstairs again to speak to the same Concierge to inquire about whether or not he could tell me the nearest place to do yoga. When I asked him, he stated that one yoga place he found had a waiting list and that the earliest time I would be able to do yoga was in 3 days. I asked him for the name of the yoga place as I did my research online about places to do yoga in and around St. Regis. He replied "Pure Yoga" and I looked at him in disbelief and stated that Pure Yoga has classes almost every hour and that it doesn't make sense that I would have to wait 3 days to do one yoga class. He then quickly picked up the phone and said he would check Absolute Yoga which was located right next door. After speaking on the phone, he found out that I would be able to do a drop-in class the next day at 12:15 pm at Absolute Yoga. I thanked him but felt quite annoyed at his lack of professionalism, knowledge and service. In addition, my husband went for a walk to find the HSBC Premier Banking Branch using the map that the Concierge provided and came back only after finding out that the place that the Concierge circled on the map was not a HSBC but the British Council building. He then went down to speak to the Clef d'Or about this error and was instructed to go across the street from the British Council building. My husband made a second trip based on the Clef d'Or's instructions but again he returned in frustration because he did not find a HSBC Premier Banking Branch but a HSBC ATM machine. Later that evening, my husband and I went for a stroll and discovered that the HSBC Premier Banking Branch is located near the Shaw Center which is nowhere near the two places that the Concierge and the Clef d'Or mentioned. We returned to inform the Clef d'Or the whereabouts of the HSBC Premier Banking Branch. He did not seem apologetic at all which was annoying given the amount of time my husband spent on looking for the Banking Branch. We were surprised and deeply disappointed by this lack of knowledge and service from the St. Regis Concierge and its Clef d'Or!!! As avid travelers, we've come to rely on and trust all Clef d'Ors in luxury hotels for their knowledge, customer service and experience in assisting travelers with their needs. Perhaps St. Regis should consider educating its Concierge about the whereabouts of certain key places that guests frequent so that they stay up-to-date with the exact locations of such places. Overall, the experience was not all worth the hype of a St. Regis hotel. This is our first time staying at St. Regis and we likely will not be choosing St. Regis over other luxury hotel brands as we felt that the customer service was lacking and the overall experience was not entirely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Adam_in_Africa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as part of a 2-week honeymoon. It was all fine - rooms, food, service, ambience, facilities - as one would expect from a hotel of this Group. Didn't take my breath away or have any fun surprises to set it apart from competing hotels. Probably a good place to spend a business trip or weekend citybreak - no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: PSJ1234
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a very nice size....bathrooms are fabulous....but the service right from the front desk at check in to the restaurant is highly average. The pool side area is nice for a drink. Very well located ..and close to orchard road. I'm not sure if I would stay here given the service which was average.

Reviews.Title: “Use to be much better”
Reviews.Author: VerySpecialK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St Regis for more than a dozen times over the past 4 years since they've opened. I can only say with regrets that the service level at this hotel had dropped dramatically in this time. The first time I checked in to this hotel, the doorman greeted me politely, asked for my name, discreetly informed his other colleagues via the wireless and everyone was addressing me by my last name throughout my stay. SPG Plat members could order any one drink off the menu at the very chic Astor Bar. The butler service was professional and prompt. Those things, and other attention to fine details, brought me back time and again, on both business and personal account. I believe in good service and willingly pay for it out of my wallet. Service has dropped steadily over the year as the hotel started to fill out and I presume with staff turnover. To their credit, St Regis has always tried to improve and given time, rectify the situation (seasoned guests: Remember how long the breakfast line at La Brasserie was in the early years). But this has to be the worse service I have encountered. The reception was cold and scripted. There was no more the warmth and friendliness from the previous year. "The best room" they can offer me, which is an SPG Plat upgrade as I am informed, is on the 4th floor, just above and facing the swimming pool. Nothing else is available for the duration of my stay (2 nights). After pressing a little, a higher floor room was offered, but was made to wait for more than an hour, with no offer of coffee or tea. The SPG Plat drinks are now at the poolside bar and now restricted to house pours. Look - If you are lucky to get an experienced reception staff to check you in or can stomach the average service of a newbie, the rooms are pretty new and pretty nice. Location is a little off the main thoroughfare on Orchard Road but still within walking distance or bus / cab away. Just don't expect additional SPG Plat service at this hotel anymore. I won't be in future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Pure Incompetence with an Ample Dose of Arrogance”
Reviews.Author: steveamcb
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this hotel is one of the very best in Singapore. The rooms, restaurants and facilities are excellent. The staff however, aside from a few, clearly originate from a different planet and many are either incompetent at their job, arrogant in their treatment of guests, ignorant of sensitivities (e.g. with respect to halal food), just plain rude or display a combination of these traits. The GM opted to selectively respond to a list of serious issues experienced and endeavoured to gloss over the problems by stressing how privileged I should feel to be afforded a suite upgrade for the final 36 hrs of my 5 night stay. Starwood Corporate gave generic answers one would expect of someone who clearly hadn't digested the full extent of what I'd encountered on what was intended to be a relaxing break. All rather insulting. Frankly the property and the guests who stay there deserve infinitely better.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jon P
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel and Location. The service, food and sports facilities are excellent - the daily wine tasting is a great way to relax after a day's business.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Very Best”
Reviews.Author: travelerhnl
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many luxury properties all over the world, I have to say that that St. Regis Singapore was notably more refined than most recent hotel experiences. From the hotel's expensive but marvelous "Jet Quay" pickup at the airport -- which entailed a greeting at the gate and tram ride to a very private Immigration checkpoint, luggage retrieval service, and a ride to the hotel in a luxurious new Bentley -- to the warm greeting and seamless check-in, the welcome to Singapore could not have been more pleasant. Another wonderful thing about the St. Regis is the feeling of expansive space everywhere. Not only was the lobby a soaring expanse of marble that seems de rigeur for luxury hotels in Asia, but the room itself was uncommonly comfortable because of the generously high ceiling height and overall feeling of airy spaciousness. Butler service was deferential but uncloying, and room service was efficient and surprisingly restaurant-like. The gym, too, was uncrowded, sunny, and sufficiently equipped for a hotel facility. I look forward to the the opportunity to stay at this beautiful establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and found the entire stay to be flawless. The room was amazing; well maintained, large, and beautifully decorated. Staff was so helpful. Perfect central location. Gorgeous spa and pool area. I would come back to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with high level of service. Stunning room and very modern. Staff go out of their way to help you. Pool lovely. Breakfast was great. Ten minutes walk to Orchard Gardens. Is a little walk in heat to the MTR at Orchard Road but taxis are really cheap in Sinagapore. Perfect if you want some luxury

Reviews.Title: “a very luxurious hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sainbasha
