Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at St. Regis, hotel in Singapore. I must say it was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. It was simply oozing with luxury. From the check in to check out, you felt totally like a VIP. The decor all over was great. The bathrooms were out of this world. Not to forget the butler service. Overall a great hotel and a must visit while in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: daisycutter
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the recent reviews of this hotel I can't believe that some of these reviewers were at the same place as my wife and I. We have travelled extensively and have always been lucky enough to saty at 5 star hotels or resorts. Based on our stay this is the best we have stayed at. From check in to departure we only encountered the best in service and facilities. The check in was very smooth and straight forward and even though we were well before check in time we were shown straight to our room. The room was just wonderful. and we had a staff member explain how everything worked and what hotel services and facilities were available to us. The bathroom in particular is fantastic and unlike an earlier reviewer the tv in the bathroom worked perfectly. The bed was very comfortable and we definitely and no external noise problems. We had breakfast at the hotel and the standard of food and service was again top class. For anyone capable of walking this hotel is not far from Orchard Rd shopping malls including the large ION complex which was an 8 minute walk for us. That also brings you to the MTR. On check out we asked the staff whether they could package and post an item that was too long for our luggage. Kelly went to a great deal to check with the airline and verify that we would be able to take the item on board at no cost. To have posted it would have been an $83.00 exopense so thanks to Kelly we were able to take it home free of charge. We must mention four staff members in particular who made our stay memorable. Leon, Daria, Kelly and Noorali were all very effiicient, courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just not there yet!”
Reviews.Author: IslandBreeze63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated close to Orchard Road, yet in a quiet neighborhood. I think overall this is nice option for staying in Singapore, however, they need to address their attention to detail if they want to command a five-star rating. I never really saw my butler during my stay, so I think that they need to inform their guests of the services. I am an avid Four Seasons guest and this was my first visit to a St. Regis property, and what I appreciate about FS is their attention to detail. They never have fruits in the room, however they did leave a Christmas cake on Christmas Eve that was nice. It's just not there yet, but the hotel has potential to rival other properties in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wanabe 6 stars but closer to 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Bond88
Reviews.Content: Just back from a business trip from Singapore staying at the St.Regis. Arrived at 16:10 for the check-in but room was not ready until 17:25. Check-in process took 15 to 20 minutes per person for no reason. Food decent but very small portions. Lifts slow might take you several minutes waiting time during peak hours. Large rooms but design not practical (light switches, bathroom). Overall ok but better keep the expectations on the lower side.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Ru C
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the other reviewers were at the same hotel as us! We had a fabulous experience, with every member of staff, from receptionist, to butler, to door attendants, to the pool attendant, providing us with friendly and helpful service throughout. We all agreed this was the best hotel of this calibre we had stayed in throughout all our travels. Kettle in room (hidden away in drinks table - but where else would it be?), cookies for the children, scrupulously clean, attentive butler when our wi-fi wouldn't connect, huge selection at breakfast. My husband has now stayed three times, and each time has had the same great experience. To say it isn't within walking distance of the shops isn't right either - Tanglin Mall was a two minute walk away in one direction, and Orchard Road was two minutes walk in the other. Thank you St Regis for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: DNG6711
Reviews.Content: The service is good enough although the staff are not that all friendly and approachable. Though, the rooms and bathrooms are spacious, clean and neat. Having a butler service for 24hr coffee, tea, cookies is a real treat. And since they know that it was my birthday they gave a small treat of extras. But I still don't think they live up to the 6 star hotel thing.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: snah55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Orchard Road and easily accessible, just a 7 mins walk away from the Orchard MRT station. I went there in Dec 2011 together with my fiance to spend a night there. It's definitely worth the money paid to stay there. Not only do you get your own butler to cater to your needs during the stay, you can experience the facilities at the Remede Spa which both of us enjoyed. We had free flow of drinks that you can order in to the room, eg, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. The buffet breakfast also had an excellent spread, if I can remember it starts at 7 am. The rooms are furnished in a stately manner, and the bathroom is big with a tub, his & hers counters, shower with massage functions. The bed is absolutely comfy and there is a pillow menu! I can't wait to go back to this hotel to enjoy the facilities again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but definitely needs some attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Eud
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the St. Regis many times now (probably 25+ days over 4 or 5 trips). It aims to be a 6 star hotel apparently but there is no chance of that. Its a solid 4 that needs to pay some attention to detail if it wants to be a 5 in my book. The good: Great location, very nice pool area, very friendly door people, helpful concierge (assuming you are not calling), good food selection, great vibe bar (albeit expensive), nice spa, free wine tastings every night at 530 pm, quiet rooms (or being a top notch hotel if you are beside screaming kids you can get moved most likely as I had to do once). The bad: Calling your butler can be an exercise in futility, calling room service can be an exercise in futility, getting what you ordered for breakfast can be a problem and require sending someone back for what they didn't get, something always seems to be wrong in the room (this trip for instance its a leaky something in the bathroom by the sink as well as a sink stopper that required reattachment to work). I wouldn't hesitate to come assuming you are getting a good rate but if you are paying rack (I am currently getting corporate), I am not sure its worth the premium to other alternatives. I really like it, I just wish that they would get their butlers to be around to answer phones (same with the in room dining) and maybe do a bit more checking for faults in the rooms. Oh, and the best thing - the shower; I have to say that Toto shower head/system is simply the best shower you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service from F & B”
Reviews.Author: bleach_12
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hotel for the count down for 2011, the comment from a senior service staff when i made an enquiry when i am having breakfast spoilt my day i did not except to hear from a 6 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: reneemarbella
Reviews.Content: Impressive hotel in a very nice part of Town. Walking distance to the main shopping centers. Everything in the hotel in impecable, beautiful rooms, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Place”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in a Grand Deluxe Non-smoking Room with 2 oversized single beds in March, 2011, after having checked out of the Value Hotel Thomson. The hotel was obviously a big change from the Value Hotel and that alone may have accentuated its luxurious aspects because I definitely had the feeling that this hotel was a very nice luxury property throughout my stay here. Arrival Experience I arrived quite early by taxi, at around 10am and my room was not yet available, nor should that be expected at that hour and in any case, I had not informed the hotel of my early arrival time. However, my room was still ready by 11:30am, which was much earlier than the official check-in time. The doormen here were not the best, they didn’t appear to be all that friendly. Check-in was friendly and I was basically checked-in even though my room was not available. The process took a while and although the attendant was amicable and the general idea was to have a relaxed and informal process, I thought that the process just took a little too long. The Room Upon entering the room, an immediate impression was created of quality, which applied to the materials and to the overall fit and finish in the room. There was a heavy bathroom door, all of the furniture was of a good quality. The wardrobes had solid and thick quality doors. The coffee table was also solid and of a good quality. The chandeliers in both the main living room and also the bathroom were also noteworthy in terms of their quality. Even the room directory and notepads were presented in thick and quality covers, which was generally the theme throughout the room. The hotel is located close to the busy Orchard Road, it’s actually on Tanglin Road but very close to Orchard Road and there was traffic directly opposite my room but the soundproofing was excellent and I could barely hear a thing from outside my room. The view outside of the park opposite was also quite nice and there were also a few interesting apartments and condominiums as part of that view. The bed in the room was very comfortable and I found it to be quite firm. The pillow was quite soft and the linens were very comfortable on the skin. I thought the bed was just right for me and better than the heavenly beds from the Westins which I had experienced previously in both Sydney and Kuala Lumpur. The only bed that I can definitely recall which really bettered this one so far was at the Peninsula in Shanghai, although there may been other beds which were just as good or very slightly more comfortable. The lounge sofa in the room was very nice, soft and comfortable. The TV provided was very large and offered good visual and sound quality. The sound was actually a Bose surround-sound system. The curtains were automated but there seemed to be a problem here, as they were not completely blackout and unfortunately let in a little bit of light during the day. The bathroom was of an outstanding quality, with excellent and pleasing marble being used throughout. There was a TV in the bathroom with good sound quality as well. Materials used throughout the bathroom were impressive, everything from the taps to the showerheads and the freestanding bath itself were of excellent quality in terms of presentation and also function. The work-desk area used a comfortable and soft chair but it was not the usual ergonomic mesh chair that is usually found in this area in many hotels, probably because such a chair would not have suited the character of the room. The room deployed auto-lighting functions with various preset options. The buttons were all soft touch and the progressively dimming and brightening functions were good. I have included videos of the hotel room on my hotels page, the link is within my profile section. Location and Public Areas The location of the hotel was quite convenient, being quite near the main part of Orchard Road with its various shopping malls and also the MRT station in that area. However, it was not actually in that great a location relative to the many other hotels on Orchard Road for those inclined to do shopping or wanting to be near the Orchard MRT station. The St. Regis was a bit further away from the action compared to the other big names in the immediate area. The public areas of the hotel were generally opulent and nicely decorated, with a very nice lobby and lifts. There were also numerous quality artworks on display and the general impression of luxury was definitely present. Service Generally, the service at this hotel was very good, including from the butler service, the room service personnel, the sauna and staff facilities staff members and most of the staff who answered the phone. There was just one occasion where the phone to the butler line took a while to answer and the attendant didn’t seem too pleased upon answering, perhaps a shortage of staff at that point in time. Another issue, if it could be called that, concerned delivery of my requested newspapers, which I actually asked for quite late in the evening and it took some time to deliver those, about thirty minutes. However, I suppose it was an odd request at that time of the day. Other requests such as for the complimentary welcome kit were met quite quickly and I requested additional chocolates. I was able to try out the Jacuzzi and steam/sauna facilities which were all very nice and new. The attendants were helpful and the general quality of these facilities was probably second in my experience only to those at the Landmark Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong and were slightly better than the W in either Hong Kong or Taipei. Even the robes provided were of a nice and fluffy quality. The spa products used were generally the same Remede products provided in the rooms themselves, which were of very good quality. Breakfast was held in a large and opulent dining area on the ground floor with a very high atrium and generally the food quality was very good but there wasn’t a huge selection available. Some of the buffet containers were quite difficult to operate. The seating in the area was very comfortable, the area was spacious and it felt much more like a spacious lounge than a dining area. I tried in-room dining twice and the food was excellent on both occasions with friendly attendants bringing the food and setting up the table. Conclusion Overall, in considering the various components of this hotel, it seemed to offer a very good combination of excellent rooms and public areas together with solid staff service. The location was also quite good and the rates at the time were also competitive for a hotel of this calibre. Perhaps having just stayed at the Value Hotel Thomson, the St. Regis may have seemed more outstanding but I still think it would be very good in any situation or environment and helped to continue to affirm the quality or luxury hotel proposition in my mind. NOTE: Videos of the hotel room and functions can be found on the link within my profile section.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality again!”
Reviews.Author: GJVO
Reviews.Content: After my stay in the Surabaya Sheraton i had to go to Singapore. First choice was a Sheraton, so it was the St Regis. Very good, Sheraton quality. Classic luxurious hotel, very nice to stay. I wished i could stay there longer, but next time i stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and poor customer experience”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love coming to Singapore and I thought I would give this new hotel a try since I've always had fantastic experiences at the SF St Regis I would love to write a glowing review but this was a true disappointment and the reviews really hyped what actually happens when you arrive. There was absolutely no high end service from the time I arrived at the hotel to the time I left. I won't give you a list of everything that went wrong but I did express it and nothing happened as a result while I was at there. I am a frequent business traveler and two of my criteria for a great hotel experience are 1) a warm service experience where you are treated as a valued customer and 2) no drama - just a great experience throughout the stay. I wish I had something positive to say about this St Regis but I really wish I had stayed at another hotel. And I just had one of the best experiences at The Naka Island in Thailand, which I would highly recommend. So my last two days of my vacation were not a great way to end this much needed break. Note: I tried to post this as feedback on the Starwood site but received an email that >> We could not post your review because it contained: A reference to one of our competitors.<< The Naka Island is part of Starwood so I am not sure which competitor I mentioned :-) There are always competitors and why consumers have choice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with some service shortcommings”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravDaddy
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the rooms in this hotel. I have stayed here on 6 occasions and it is one of my favorite hotels in the world. That said, there were several service mis-steps. Each was corrected by management, and I hope that these do not reflect a deteiorating service culture at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but I don't get 100% satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: demidov48
Reviews.Content: + good furnitured room excelent breakfast location near sopping place good service - slow internet not close to Marina Bay Worse than Marina Bay at New Years Eve (far from Fireworks) No view in the rooms lower then 10th floor (we were on this floor, but I think, that upper don't have also)

Reviews.Title: “Catastrophic service- hotels are not just about fancy hardware, St Regis!”
Reviews.Author: Globaltattler
Reviews.Content: I almost don't know what to say. 6 months ago we stayed at this hotel and highlighted the issues with the housekeeping, check-in etc but gave it a high rating anyway. This time let's just say all Goodwill has run out. We booked the St Regis Suite with an infant and small child in tow for a short getaway...moving on from the Fullerton Bay Hotel. This is a USD600 a night one bedroom suite. I have never given a hotel a 1-star rating but this one takes the cake. It is shocking. First we were told to check in at 3pm, which by hotel standards is already pretty late. We showed up at 330pm, and were told, after standing in queue to check in, that (surprise surprise) that the "room was not ready". Instead of offering us the next available category room, we were told to go to a "resting room" and wait. Annoyed we asked why check out is at noon, and at 330pm the room was still not ready- three and a half hours is a long time, is it not, to clean a room? We asked how long the room would take and whether they could offer us another room so that we wouldn't have to move twice. The lady serving at check in kept disappearing for long periods of time behind a door to "go and check what she could do", leaving us sitting dumbly at the counter with a long line piling up behind us. What's worse, during her disappearance, with us still sitting at the desk, the receptionist at the next counter hopped over to our counter to serve a different guest. Our receptionist finally re-appeared to firmly repeat that she could only offer a " rest room" which was of a lower category and she would "send us some tea" while we waited until 5pm for our room. We then lugged our bags ourselves with the help of another lady receptionist to the elevator to go to the "resting room". We waited until 450pm, essentially wasting the entire afternoon sitting there waiting... And finally called the reception (waiting a long time for the operator to get through front desk for us), to check on the room. We were told they would "go and check"!- no one was pro actively looking out for us. Finally, at 5 a man appeared to help us with our bags... But he couldnt get his key card to make the elevator work.... We entered the lift, tried the card, let him try his card, tried again, then quickly rushed out with stroller, bags, baby, child etc because of the frantic beeping of the elevator... Only to find the same lift was the only one that would come....finally tumbling back in when the bell hop's key worked.... And after much fuss, we finally arrived at our room....to find housekeeping still inside with trash and trolleys and cleaners.... and the rollaway bed which we had requested a day in advance completely forgotten. We went to the pool... Or rather tried to. With no indication in the elevator of what floor the spa/ pool was on, it was up to us to make random guesses as to what likely floor to get off on. Finally, we went to the first floor to enquire and came back up, The deck chairs were all occupied... If not with guests, then with the leftover glasses and towels of guests who had vacated their deck chairs but had not been cleaned up after. We then gave up and returned to our room. We proceeded to the wine tasting and canapés which I think are the redeeming features of this hotel- but seriously, we are not reviewing restaurant or wine bars here but a hotel and as a hotel, the failings as a luxury hotel are astounding. The video player was not working, much to my child's disappointment, and the repairman could not fix it... The next couldn't either... Nor the next...and an hour later they all gave up and left. Moving on to the turn down service- what turn down? No one showed up to even replace towels or offer drinking water! The suite itself is nothing to write home about- the bedroom was ok, but the living room was cramped and dim as was the bathroom and the tiny powder-room is best avoided. The dim lighting gave everything a sort of 3 star hotel seedy quality. Where was the body moisturizer? Housekeeping seems to randomly leave some bottles of amenities and forget others, We asked for some money off the room and a late check out in view of the disastrous check in process, which was granted (not pro-actively offered, mind you), but all I could think was "oh dear, what about the next guest who shows up and finds his room is not ready because we were granted a late check out which overlaps with his check in time...?!

Reviews.Title: “My father would only stay here.......”
Reviews.Author: Yew-Joo
Reviews.Content: This is the place we would stay every time we go to Singapore. And for the last 3 years, we must have stayed here over a dozen times - anywhere from 3 - 6 nights per stay. Why? My father will not stay anywhere else. And this after we've stayed at the Fullerton, Grand Hyatt, Four Seasons, and each time before I make any reservations just to see if he wants to try some place else and the answer has ALWAYS been emphatically - NO. Why? The service has always been so special. From the guys at the door, to the butlers, to the breakfast guys - they have always been so attentive. The bell boys will always insist on helping my umbrella for a walking cane mother carry her paper bag (no matter how small) to the room for her and help her with the room key. They also always offer us an umbrellas before we head out on our walks on over-casted days. My butler once after bringing me my AM coffee, hears me hoarsely struggling on a conference call, came back with lemon and honey and tells me it will help my throat. My breakfast gal Yessica once helped me order my prata and fish curry without being asked when I was just arriving at the end of b/fast - talk about attention to the needs of the guests. That's just my rave on the people that works there. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and spacious - from the Grand Deluxe, to the Lady Astor room, to the Lady Astor Suite.Is this place expensive - yes, but so is the rest of Singapore. Yes, I am often referred to the El' Cheapo - but this place does not have to work very hard to pry the cash out of my cold stingy hands. Sometimes I am torn on writing good reviews on things I like - cuz I don't really want to give away my secret to the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ksiazemati
Reviews.Content: Second hotel chosen in Singapore during our stay. Excellent choice. Very good location. Much new than Sheraton Towers Singapore. Perfect design of the interior Very high standard as in all St. Regis hotels from starwood chain. The customer service was excellent. Fast check-in & out in SPG guest counter. The buffet breakfast offer was really huge, I think the biggest offer I have seen even comparing to all incl hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid place”
Reviews.Author: Loverly4u2
Reviews.Content: I've travelled regularly to Singapore and this has been my first visit to the St Regis. Perfect place, beautiful surroundings, great buffet restaurant. All I have to say about it is positive whether traveling on business or leisure. A prime choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: gipsona1
Reviews.Content: I dont know how much i paid as it was part of a rail trip package, but it was not enough. Great location, great room, great staff, great butler. One for a treat or if you can afford all the time then good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “really excellent”
Reviews.Author: nikolai69
Reviews.Content: Checked in and stayed here one night as part of an E&O package (see separate review). This hotel is simply extremely well done into the smallest detail. Welcome and smooth check in was fast and curteous. Our personal butler kind and introduced us to the rooms many amenities. The room elegant with everything the heart may desire (including 16$ Wifi connection - why oh why does a hotel of this caliber not make that sort of service complimentary? it is annoying to have this small extra charges when the room is expensive enough on it's own). The bathroom truely elegant with beautiful amenities, oversized bathtub (with in-mirror tv) and separate shower. The bed just lovely to sleep in. Tried the La Brezza restaurant which was just lovely with beautiful authentic italian cuisine (at european prices for sure) a very attentive sommelier/restaurant manager and a lovely winelist. The best of the hotel was the Spa - just wonderful, simple and elegant with 3-temperature zoned steamroom, dry sauna, two jacuzzis (one outdoor), and a wonderful space overall with great service. Didnt have time to try the treatment rooms, but Im sure it is equally good. In all a just wonderful experience at the upper end of Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Never misses a beat”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRichie
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the St. Regis Singapore having had such a great stay last time. Again, my stay was very enjoyable. The staff are incredibly helpful and professional and attend to every request promptly. Great location. Spacious superbly appointed rooms. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent true 5-6 star”
Reviews.Author: SyedNoorMShah
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in 2010. Excellent hotel and services. My kids used to get special care and free gifts everyday. Very good Breakfast. The rooms with the electronic buttons are amazing and the rooms are Gigantic. Its a true 5 star + hotel. I would say a 6 star. Staff was great as well. I will defitetely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of discreet luxury close to orchard road”
Reviews.Author: unfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. The St Regis on first impression is that of discreet and understated elegance rather than ostentatious opulence and luxury. Check in is very personalised rather than lining up in front of a desk in most other hotels. Our check in was however somewhat messy and we sat in front of the lady for almost 20 minutes as she tapped away on her computer apparently trying to locate a room even though we had confirmed reservations. We were reassured that the room was available and she was just heckling if the final inspection was done, though at one point we were asked if we had a very strong non- smoking room policy, to which I replied there was absolutely no compromise on that count! We were then ushered to the drawing room for complimentary coffee while she took some more time to get our room which was finally sorted in another ten minutes. Whatever misgivings I had up to this point was instantly forgotten once we got into the room. Wow. It was a large room , with two large double beds and a sedan. There was also a mini alcove with your minibar. The adjoining bathroom was stunning, with a free standing traditional bath tub facing a second flat screen television set, with a His and Hers washbasins, and a separate WC and shower cubicle. The room was equipped with a fantastic Bose surround sound system which could be linked up to your iPod or iPhone . There is no free wifi or internet unfortunately. We took advantage of the complimentary butler service to order afternoon and morning coffee. Yu could also get your clothes pressed and shoes shined if you wanted. There is a complimentary wine and cheese tasting evening session at the Decanter bar which was a very nice prelude to venturing outside the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to orchard road in one direction and the botanic gardens to the other, but we preferred to avoid the crowds and went instead to the closer Tanglin shopping mall. There is a turn down service in the evening and a selection of Bernard Laurent chocolates left by the bedside . Breakfast was served in a different ballroom as we were there during the Christmas season . I wood rate the breakfast selection as fair and not fantastic, as I have had better in other five and even four star hotels elsewhere. They have an Asian selection and I was disappointed with the porridge which was somewhat tepid as well as the coffee which tastes rather flat. Likewise the gym was very average in my opinion, which left me longing for the one at the Taipei Gand Hyatt. The pool was also somewhat small but nice, with lounge deck chairs partially immersed in very shallow water bordering the main pool. Check out was very efficient, and we were also given complimentary car parking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: rougecoco12
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay here for 2 weeks for business. My room was so luxurious and elegant. There's a console of buttons to control the lighting and shades. The bed was really comfortable and there's a pillow menu. The in-room beverage service was a nice touch. The TWG Alexandria mint tea was the best tea I've ever had. Breakfast was good, but the items don't change much. I would come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: JohnJampot
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the St. Regis after a 13hr flight and the check in took over half an hour with very little being said to us while the receptionist tapped on her key board! This is supposed to be a 5* plus hotel and we didn't get told anything about the hotel, what time breakfast was, where the lift was or anything. The rooms themselves were great. Super king size bed, Bose sound system, rain showers etc.But the so called butler service, non existant. The hotel was in a great location if you plan to shop as it is just off Orchard Road and great to see Christmas lights. there is also a few other major problems with this so called 5* hotel. The lifts!! You can wait up to 5 minutes for a lift and the hotel only has about 15 floors. Also the breakfast room is not big enough for the hotel size. One morning there was a queue of couples, kids & business people all waiting for a table, luckily my colleagues were already at a table but when I left some of the same people were still waiting! Not good

Reviews.Title: “Class in the best location”
Reviews.Author: showbizandi
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here as I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest and am always swayed by collecting points: Sometimes for the better, sometimes for the worse. This was FOR THE BETTER. From Check-In to Check-Out this hotel delivered. The rooms are big and have a lighting control with presets for different moods. Large bathrooms with seperate bath and shower (I was unaware of the brand of shampoo etc...but it felt and smelt high end). For the room I had booked I had the use of a Butler (assigned) for the floor, complimentary tea or coffee as well as packing and unpacking. Room Service was prompt and not to expensive and the staff never made me feel they were waiting for a tip (unlike when in America). Breakfast is a feast again with great service. The location is just off Orchard Road yet still VERY central (2 Starbucks within a 5 minute stroll). It was the staff, that really made this hotel, no request was too big. If you're thinking of staying at The Hilton or Marriott, don't; They're both TOO busy and right in the thick of Orchard Road, this hotel offers a little peaceful haven within minutes of the craziness of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Experience at a Good Price Point!”
Reviews.Author: BusLeisTravler
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for a week on business and decided to stay at the St Regis - what a wonderful decision. I asked the hotel to arrange an airport transfer for me and they sent the Bentley - that was unexpected, but also just lots of fun - good to treat oneself when one can :-) Upon arrival I was welcomed immediately at the reception desk, quickly checked in and up to my room. St Regis follow the concept of a floor butler. He greeted me and introduced me to my room. These rooms were excellent, large, well-appointed. To me success comes down to the shower pressure and the bed. I was so happy with both, I was disappointed for the last 2 weeks taking showers at home and other hotels. I had breakfast in the lobby most mornings and considering the price for the buffet it is probably one of the best deals I have ever seen in a Starwood property. The staff were always attentive - coffee and tea - free and available at the touch of a button to the butler. The toiletries were excellent, so no need to pack them (save the weight)! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, excellent and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_FRA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed four nights in this fantastic property. Everything from the check-in to the check-out was fantastic. Our room was very very nice. Charming classical furnishing with a good size, bath simply heavenly. Everyone is very helpful, always very kind and smiling. Our expectations has been exceeded in every aspect. The lobby is cosy, with modern paintings from contemporary asian artist. We have enjoyed high tea at the lobby bar and was charmed by the staff. The butler service in the room is impeccable, my wife ordered several times coffee and tea and was very attired by the service. As Platinum SPG we enjoyed a complementary breakfast. The variety was great and everything of course very delicious. The location of the hotel is excellent. The botanical garden and the Orchard Road are both at walking distance. I highly recommend for business and leisure also.

Reviews.Title: “Does perfection exist? Yes, and this hotel is proof...”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelMasta
Reviews.Content: I really can't stay enough good things about the St. Regis in Singapore. From check-in to check-out this hotel was the best part of my visit to Singapore. I stayed in this property for nearly two weeks, so I have a fairly good perspective. The service is impeccable, everywhere. Everyone is nice, smiling, instantly responsive and helpful. I really have never received service like this at any hotel, anywhere. And my room--where to begin? Heaven. the appointments were luxurious, the attention to detail superb, the daily cleaning service would even organize the items on my desk neatly and orderly. The shower and bath were invigorating. The coffee from my butler, outstanding. I was visiting Singapore on a not-so-fun business trip and I really couldn't wait to get the heck out that place. But the St. Regis was my rock on that trip--I knew I would go home at the end of the day and and be completely relaxed. Reading a book next to the infinity pool was my favorite activity. The Chinese restaurant at the hotel was VERY good, as was the poolside Italian restaurant. Avoid the overpriced breakfast buffet. The hotel never seemed to be able to get the in-wall TV in the bathroom working, but everything else was so "right" at this place I didn't even care. Don't care what people may say about Raffles, the St. Regis is hands down the best hotel in Singapore. Can't recommend highly enough, for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “An Oplulent, Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sramrevo
Reviews.Content: The image that St. Regis portrays is one of luxury, opulence and grandeur. I am glad to say that on my first ever visit the hotel has exceeded my expectations. The lobby is fittingly cosy and welcoming, but also showing off that little extra touch of class. The room does not disappoint, being of a good size with a nice high ceiling. Well chosen furnishings in design and material complemented the room perfectly. A very nice surprise was the Bose surround sound setup together with the large flat screen TV. Impressed. More surprises to come in the bathroom where you can laze in the bath while watching TV neatly integrated into the wall. Very impressed. The service staff were good, although not exceptional. Similarly for the gym and swimming pool, which is open 24hrs. An important part of the holiday for me is the breakfast. Regrettably the breakfast fell short of expectations. Although the dining environment was very nice, it was a full buffet breakfast. At this price range, for this level of hotel, I expected a cold buffet and to order my hot foods (as practiced in hotels of similar stature to Raffles Hotel, Four Season, Ritz Carlton). Overall it was an amazing 4days/3nights at St. Regis and I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: As Platinum SPG guests we received an upgrade to a corner suite, which is very classically appointed. Many other reviewers have written about the in-room entertainment center, which is extremely difficult to understand. We found the staff to be very friendly, but also very slow: it took an average of 20 minutes for our butlers to bring tea. other requests also took a while. Great breakkast and food quality overall. Good location as well, just around the corner from the major shopping and within easy reach of both public transport and good hotel taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: ezperia e
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in st. regis last month. This hotel is close to my favourite place -Orhcard road. Room is spacious and very good layout,it has a nice big bathroom. The breakfast is a bit disappointed and the sitting area is too small.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect!”
Reviews.Author: cechin
Reviews.Content: This St. Regis property lives up to the standard of the brand. Having arrived past midnight, the check in process was smooth and they were able to accommodate my request to stay in the same room, despite having had two separate bookings due to a last minute travel change. The suite was immaculate and the bathroom was jaw dropping: large, soaking tub, separate shower stall, double sinks, plus a TV! The bed was extremely comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows were well isolated. Despite being on a low floor (3rd), I couldn't hear any street traffic. The hotel is also well situated, in easy walking distance to the shops on Orchard and the MRT. Wifi is available for a fee, which is unfortunate. Otherwise, my only regret is my brief visit to an amazing property.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfulness abounds at this property!”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_Los_Altos_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed only two nights for work, but wish I could have stayed longer. Upon check-in, although I was early, the front desk attendant relally spent time finding an appropriate room for me that she could expedite on the cleaning schedule to get me in as soon as possible. The room was everything you'd expect, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravellerMunich
Reviews.Content: even for singapore an exceptional hotel. rooms are large and very comfortable. butlerservice. sometimes a bit slow. very comfortable bed. three points to be improved: wlan access not only to one device. friendlier and more efficient service at the front door/cab line and improve spg platinum service/lounge time. overall recommended

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Tonyvaya
Reviews.Content: Everything was spotless throughout our 3 days stay at the St.Regis Singapore. it was raining one morning so we had our breakfast by the pool, very refreshing in the open air with very delicious congee!! fab. Highly recommended to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: travelbeee
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location, fab interior decor. Only cons is that not all rooms have a view, and most rooms have view of other buildings. Great bathroom amenities and room layout. All in all,still one of my first choice hotels in Singapore! Proximity to Orchard Road, and short taxi ride to CBD area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and discreet”
Reviews.Author: spriya4
Reviews.Content: St. Regis is located just off Orchard Road on Tanglin Road, near the Tanglin Mall. Its a great location if you want to just take a stroll on Orchard Road after a hard days work; proximity to the best shopping district in Singapore and fantastic service. Their breakfasts are fab, the personal butler does indeed take personal care of your dietary requirements. Big Rooms, big bathrooms, one thing about business hotels is cramped rooms and a tendency to go bang your toe on some furniture. Trust me, you wont find it here. Nice big rooms, comfy furniture, large windows with window seats to enjoy a good morning tea.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: TravelledBandung
Reviews.Content: After reading the posts on tripadvisors, I had high expectations of the St Regis Singapore. I am spending my first night here and it is already a huge dissapointment to me. As a well travelled businessman, there are several basic lack of quality in the service and quality here such as. 1. There is a hole on my duvet cover. I called the butler to voice and concern and the house keeping change them right away. However, this is very basic of what one expects of a good quality hotel let a lone a luxury hotel. 2. There is no comb and shaving kit in the toilet. As a luxury hotel there should be shaving kit and comb in the toilet. I requested them from the butler and it is sent right away. On the positive note, the home made chocolate bar on turn down and the tea service in room is a very nice tuch of luxury

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it...”
Reviews.Author: Thaimae
Reviews.Content: I traveled on business and had a chance to stay at the St. Regis. While it's nice to stay at such a nice hotel, the ammenities aren't cheap. The staff, location, hotel - nothing but compliments and no complaints but a couple of things that I did not like: 1 - no ironing board and iron in room - after having traveled from the States to Singapore my clothing needed a little pressing and even when I asked they said none were available - the prices for pressing were way out of my price range. 2 - a hot water kettle but no cups in the room as they wanted you to order tea / coffee through the St. Regis butler - nice thought but I really like just fixing my own without the fuss. 3 - the breakfast buffet was not worth the price - you are far better off taking a short stroll over to Orchard Road and doing it on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Service, Exellence”
Reviews.Author: maddog4200
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I agree this hotel deserves 6 stars. The old 5 star system is outdated if the plan is to keep USA hotels in the same rating system program. There is nothing in the USA to compare to Singapore hotel service and luxury. Let's start with the fabulous curb service we recieved when we arrived before the room was ready. Perfect. Polite, helpful men take your luggage and keep it safe. You never have to worry about security in Singapore. The location of the hotel is ideal for dining, shopping on Orcard Road, and nightlife, all within walking distance. There's a fabulous Japanese restaurant about a block away toward Orchard Road. I'm getting sidetracked from the best part. The rooms are incredible. Every modern convenience is at your fingertips. Lighting, stereo, bathroom fixtures, the all important BED and PILLOWS, all the best I have ever encountered. I have stayed at some of the newest 5 star hotels in the USA, including the new Mandarin Oriental in Vegas, Trump Chicago, several Ritz Carlton's and Four Seasons. This hotel is a step above the best. In the morning, make your way down to one of the most elegant breakfast buffets in the world, included in your room price. Everything was fabulous. The service in this hotel was outstanding as well. Every time we called for anything it seemed like they were waiting outside our door. The pillow menu was the most extensive I have seen. At least 15 pillow styles to add to the 4 super plush pillows already on the bed. One of my biggest gripes about most hotels are the pillows and quality of the mattresses. Many USA hotels disappoint in this area. This hotel has the finest beds and pillows, period. If I had to complain about anything, which is difficult, the pool was just a degree on the cool side. My travel partner loved the temperature but I'm stretching here to find something negative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service in beautiful room for extra care guest.”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMumOfTwo
Reviews.Content: I contacted the St Regis prior to my overnight transit stay on October 16 due to my special care requirements (I was 8 weeks out from having broken my ankle and was travelling alone). I had been concerned about some reviewers reporting that the St Regis Butler service was slow and unreliable so I emailed Ian Tan directly and passed on details of my situation. Mr Tan responded and reassured me that the St Regis would be happy to ensure my needs were met and looked forward to my brief stay with them (I was only in the hotel for 14 hours - arrived 5pm and departed 7am). While my original plans had included an evening walk around the Botanic Gardens and maybe Ion in Orchard Road, I was now confined to my room for the duration of my stay and I could not have asked for a better room to convalesce in. I loved the decor (I was in an Executive Deluxe Room that I had got at a special weekend rate - it included breakfast) and the photos on the website are very accurate so if you don't like this kind of Regency decor then don't stay here - I loved the space, the hugely comfortable bed, the couch and window seat, the plasma, the desk, the huge bathroom which most importantly for me boasted a flat walk-in shower, and the walk in robe. The lovely lady who checked me in (at a sit down table in the lobby) showed me to my room (being very patient as I hopped along with my crutches) where I was then met by the floor's senior Butler, Narinda, who gave me his business card and then personally took my order for a much-needed tea, which was delivered, piping hot, only a few minutes later. At check-in I had been offered breakfast delivered to my room the next morning to save me having to negotiate the buffet - it was explained that this would only be the continental breakfast option (ie. not full a la carte choices) but I was very happy with this as I had been worried as to how I would manage a buffet breakfast particularly since I needed to be checked out by 7am. I didn't want to pay for internet so just sent of a few texts to let my family know I'd arrived safely, and then turned on the TV and enjoyed the plush opulence of my room. I ordered a simple tosted sandwich and fries plus dessert from room service (Narinder had organised this for me) and felt very special when he wheeled it in on a beautiful trolley and all meticulously displayed. I never order room service so this was a real treat for me! (BTW - he even knew that this was the start of my special 50th birthday holiday so wished me a happy birthday and a great holiday ahead). I had a wonderful sleep and woke on time and enjoyed some quality time in the fabulous shower (spa jets as well as overhead) and slowly prepared for the next leg of my journey. My wake up call and breakfast were all on time. Check out was simple and pleasant and the staff member who took my small on board case down for me had also organised a taxi - yes it was a Merc, and yes, it cost double the amount my standard taxi had cost from the airport the previous afternoon, but it was so clean and comfortable and I was excited to be off to visit Bali for the first time. I have stayed in 4 different 5 star Singapore hotels and they all had their good points, but for my needs on this occasion - I'm very happy to have chosen the St Regis and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again (Narinder - I still have your business card!). Thank you St Regis and Mr Tan in particular for ensuring my stay was such an easy one given my special needs.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary W
Reviews.Content: Where else can you go for a beer and sit with 10 little Picassos? Just been staying at the St Regis in Singapore for four days and we had a wonderful upgrade to the Caroline Astor Suite. It was a fanatstic way to end our holiday. The only criticism is that the restaurants seemed too small to accommodate everyone at breakfast time and this led to a lack of attention to detail, forgotten orders and rather frantic service. This is a general comment on many hotels in Singapore. However the Concierge was exceedingly knowledgeable and very helpful with advice. The location, decor, artwork and feel of the hotel is excellent and a beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of attention, training and staff spirit lets this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: stiletravel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with extraordinary quality finishes. Staff service is lacking, it appears staff morale and training is very negative. Nothing requested comes quickly or smoothly. THe Butler service can take long time for a simple coffee to arrive and when it does it is often luke warm. THe breakfast buffet is OK but the hot items are not kept hot. The service attendants at breakfast are in a day dream and if you need anything you have to jump out of your chair to get their attention - and again when you do request something it either doesn't come or it takes a long long time. THe concierge gives you the feeling that he is too busy to help. The front desk staff are quite efficient as are the porters and bell desk. It is no way comparable to Four Seasons service standards and frankly is no where near the high standards in this region. I often stay at St Regis Bangkok - which by comparison service and staff are without fault.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions since it opened (at least 8 times). This hotel was really good in the beginning with lots of attention to detail and I always was happy to come back but is now nothing special anymore. They seem to have lost their way and are most certainly not on top of their game right now. Still a nice property with very nice rooms and generally friendly staff but all pretty mediocre in that category. The so called 'butler service' is not worth the name and really no different from any other hotel service. In the past they would come and intoduce themselves and offer tea or coffee on your arrival and unpacking service - not anymore. Plus, do not count on being recognized or greeted as a returning guest. When I mentioned to the receptionist that I had stayed there before on sevderal occasions she could only say - oh, we can't see this kind of thing on the system - stone age? No welcome card in the room either. This is all pretty much standard procedure and it just shows lack of attention to basic details when it does not work. When I arrived from a pretty long flight at 6.00 am and had booked from the day before especially just to make sure I could get to my room straight, I was made to wait for over half an hour as the room I had booked was not ready - what if I had checked in the day before as I had payed for? Breakfast experience is OK if you are on holiday and have lots of time but not if you are after efficiency. Staff at breakfast is also not really friendly. All in all pretty lame for a 5 star hotel in such a competitive location...

Reviews.Title: “Your Headache-Free Destination”
Reviews.Author: Sina149
Reviews.Content: This property of Starwood is just about everything you can imagine to expect from a luxury destination. A real HOME away home... The Staff are really well trained and always wearing an smile; They do not just try but DO their best to accommodate your every requirement no matter what! I really liked the St. Regis Butler Service and the complimentary delivery of Tea or Coffee in the comfort of your stunning room... The service is more than perfect. Ordered something around 4AM and it was delivered in a perfect way in just 5mins. Location is perfect and you have easy access to Orchards St. and you can have everything by a simple walk out of the door.... Breakfast is ideal... No Complains... Well done St. Regis... Well done Starwood...

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved it! Cream of the crop.”
Reviews.Author: CatherineChristensen
Reviews.Content: Yan ting was the best dim sum we ever had! Service was quick and impeccable. Loved the butler service, night calls for latte and cookies. Super clean, absolutely comfy beds, Loved the staff. Big smiles all way around. Would stay again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_Jamie
Reviews.Content: One of the best stay for us in Singapore. Friendly service. Check in was good. We were upgraded to a corner suite. Big room with 2 beds for 2A2C. Bathroom was huge with separate shower and toilet, 2 basins, bathtub with TV, lots of mirror, etc. wonderful. Personal butler to show you how everything works in the room. Also make 2 personalized bear cookies with chocolates for our 2 kids. thank you! Gripes are swimming pool is a bit small, and TV channels are limited, with no kids and major sports programmes. More suitable for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: A truly luxurious hotel. Excellent service, beautiful room - loved the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wifsys
Reviews.Content: The best I have stayed in Singapore so far. Amazing bathroom, real posh in the true sense. Bit confusing using the array of switches on the sideboard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy P
Reviews.Content: Our check in was very slow but that was due to a number of us arriving at the same time. Apart from that until checkout everything was fantastic. The Butler we had for the first 36hrs was great (unfortunately I do not know his name). No matter what our request it was met promptly and efficiently. The room was gorgeous and very well maintained. We enjoyed a dinner in the Italian restaurant where staff were very accommodating. The spa was great especially the facilities we were able to use during our stay. Wine tasting each evening added to the experience. Our check-out was smooth and hassle free. Would definitely stay here next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: SEAVisitor
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay the week. After discovering the following, decided to relocate: First, the gym was very so so (no MBS Banyan tree for sure), as was breakfast and the pool (the pool at the residences, however, looked quite nice ... too bad). The bed linens were over bleached, and I awoke to a rash. The butler service was lovely as were the staff in the hotel in general (provided you don't mind being asked nicely to either wait for a table at breakfast, or be asked to eat breakfast up stairs outside by the pool in the heat ... not so nice especially when the breakfast was so modest compared to Regent, Grand Hyatt, etc.). My Chinese neighbors had their slippers in the hall and the tv loud with their door wedged open stuffed with newspaper to keep it from closing. Not elegant at all. All in all, a very average hotel experience. Sorry St. Regis,-- not up to snuff.

Reviews.Title: “A Plus rating”
Reviews.Author: inprazi
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels in Asia. Everytime I go to Singapore I always book my stay here. Not mentioning about the room but the services and staffs here make it an ideal location for businessmen like me. I prefer having lunches and dinners in the hotel’s restaurant. They have a variety of dishes from west to east and local. I love the Singaporean frog portridge in the restaurant, tasty and delicious. You should try once!

Reviews.Title: “One Word..."WOW"!!”
Reviews.Author: AngiePang
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at this magnificent hotel for 2 nights as a stopover from Europe back to Australia. What a joy it was! The hotel itself is opulent and majestic - one cannot fault it. The stunning lobby with its wonderful works of art and sparkling chandeliers are a wonder to behold! And the room we stayed in was absolute elegance and comfort. We felt very pampered and every single staff member were so welcoming and helpful. Our package also included daily breakfast which was all very fresh and beautifully presented. We also used the Spa facilities...Fantastic! Highly Recommended! If you want to feel special then do not hesitate and please book St Regis Singapore, you will not regret it! We hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Specialty Suite”
Reviews.Author: BarnieSg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Knickbocker Suite over the 8/9 Oct weekend. From point of arrival through to departure, everything was great - butler service, housekeeping, the bubble bath. Service and food at Les Saveurs was good. And for lunch the next day at Yan Ting, superlative! Keep it up! My only gripe was the Bentley arrival transfer... driver drove like a demon, not smooth at all. Though the return transfer was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service at St Regis Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lady Astor room over the weekend at Singapore. Upon check-in at noon, the booked room was not ready. Thus, they gladly offer me a grand deluxe room for me to freshen up and rest. Was pretty suprised to know that the hotel was quite occupied...maybe cause there was weddings taking place on both Sat and Sun when i was there. The Lady Astor room was big and overlooks St regis residences. Butler service was excellent, providing us with the requested magazines, tea and coffee. Was impressed that he even remembers my last name the next day! Overall the service at the hotel was awesome. My only disappointment is the breakfast spread. Expected better and wider selection of breakfast spread from st regis!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: susanmcm
Reviews.Content: Amazing, amazing, amazing great location top of Orchard Road - 5 minute walk to train station. The most opulant hotel room we have ever stayed in & we have stayed at some wonderful hotels around the world. If you always book Starwood Hotels you will never be dissappointed

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for a hotel of this calibre”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times over the past two years and I really wanted to rate this hotel higher and the only reason I gave it a very good rating is because of the room and not the service. Check in is functional. As I have indicated the rooms are fantastic, large and classy. The butler service is quite good but you do have to ask for service from the butler. Getting through to him/her is a task in itself and getting through to concierge takes time. The gym facilities are average and the pool is quite good, not heated though. The location is really good, just around the corner from Orchard road. If the service levels were where they should be for a five star hotel this would be one of the best in the world.......St Regis Management please take note!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior with mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Epicurius_at_large
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. Regis in December 2010. While hotel decor was grand and oppulent, the service quality is rather subpar. Our shower had severe blockage and floor was flooded with water. I had to call house keeping 3 times to get any help with cleaning up the flood water. When staff first arrived, they simply handed me towels as though they expected the hotel guest to clean up the flood. Besides, if you carry a pc and iPhone, you must purchase WIFI separately for each device, even if you are staying in the same room. It is hard to imagine a high standard hotel with such arcane IT technology...

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lance M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very pleasant experience! Even though there were some inital miscommunication issues with my reservation details (conducted via internet) the staff were very speedy in correcting the problem and remaining pleasant and patient. This hotel is very luxurious and is a true 5star experience vs, others that just claim that title.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy J
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is a very good hotel and great service. The morning breakfast is astounding!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The rooms are equipped to satisfy your needs and wants.

Reviews.Title: “A mind blowing experience”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: Its a one of the most luxurious hotel in the heart of the city.The rooms are very well decorated with all modern amenities.The restaurant have a great selection of food but my favourite was tiger prawns.The hotel have a great view from the rooms and serve very nice room service.

Reviews.Title: “I love St Regis Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Astello39
Reviews.Content: St Regis is a fantastic hotel. The room (stayed in the Lady Astor) is big, tastefully furnished, comfortable and service is impeccable. Bathroom has a nice bathtub with a city view, separate shower stall with jet massage and tv. Hotel room also has the little things that makes a difference to some of us, automated day/night shades, various lighting modes and Laurent Bernard chocolates at turn down. Not to mention also the attentive butler service. The stay here was definitely a treat...good for a staycation, spend some quality time and also good for a shopping trip in Singapore. It is located in the quieter end of orchard road but it's good to be away from the crowd sometimes! It's only a 10 minutes walk to where the action is. Alternatively it is also convenient to take the public transport to get around. Breakfast is nothing to shout about though...

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: crwahwc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October. The staff are very friendly, from the receptionist to the butler, they are all very polite in a typical Singaporean way. I love the hotel room, once you stepped into the room, I just feel so overwhelming and luxurious. I jumped into the bathtub right away!The room size are big, not outstanding, but equipped with all the necessity. 1 downside is the distance to the nearest MRT is not within walking dis. So be prepared to take taxi in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bennybags
Reviews.Content: Luxurious rooms and facilities, all the mod cons well hidden in old world style fittings with lashings of marble! Great size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing really stood out”
Reviews.Author: HappySwan
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice service in general (front desk not overly helpful), felt a bit too stuffy for me. Also food at the brasserie and the pool is nice, but not overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “small cuts will lead to open wounds if not treated.”
Reviews.Author: xolo90
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is wonderfully furnished and decorated with commissioned art. I stayed here on a 3rd leg of a 10 day business trip in Asia. Upon arrival, the reception desk was not well managed, the person registering you to the hotel escorted you to the elevator, while leaving a long line of people waiting. Upon my arrival, 3:05 pm, my room was not ready and was told it would be a "few" hours, seeing my expression - I was offered a upgrade, thank you! The butler did a reasonably good job explaining the features of the room. I had, initially, a difficult time operating the Bose surround sound IPOD connection, a second butler had to come in to show me. I will offer the room was wonderful, a nice bed, new sheets, generous towels and grooming supplies. The shower was forceful, spacious and equipped with a rainfall shower head and three body sprays. A nice looking soaking tub (didn't use it) with a TV in the wall. The breakfast buffet was generous with american, asian and british offerings. The wait time to get a seat for breakfast was too long and on my last day, I was told I had to go to the second floor for breakfast, which I declined. The pool area was too small to be comfortable, this is Singapore, why not a better outdoor offering? The Spa was average, the staff was nice but average. I had on going problems with my room card lock, very annoying, I had to get few cards reprogramed. To be a Starwood hotel, attention to the small details needs to be reconsidered.

Reviews.Title: “another superficial chain hotel in Asia, quality is skin deep and service is 2nd class.”
Reviews.Author: dab-teo
Reviews.Content: excellent location, near orchard road. first impression and expectation is that you are stepping into a 5 or 6 star hotel. bottom line, another pretentious Asian hotel with poor service, improperly trained staff and skin deep luxury appeal and horrible quality and value.  summary: - lack of attention to detail and superficial sense of quality and luxury every you look. - check in staff was confused and unprofessional at best (two separate checkins within 4-days took more than 15 minutes to process and with multiple screw ups). - my friend checked in at 4pm, his room wasn't ready (at 4pm!) so he came up and waited at my room, butler took 10mins to carry the key to my room after they finally called and confirmed the other room is ready.   - my room was a deluxe king. looked very nice, bath was excellent, nice 5.1 Bose lifestyle system, that is where the surface appeal ends. - room had faulty automated window shades (called for repair twice), gave up and just left the open. - dirty and dusty room furniture (dropped my room key and had to shift a small entertainment cabinet under the main desk, top surface and the bose subwoofer tucked back must of had 1mm thick dust layer). - carpet stains near king bed, dust and bottle caps under the bed.  - nortel touch screen phone with world's worst resistive touch screen. pressing the butler button gets you front desk button,  4 inches away.  - bath and shower glass doors smash on metal frame. called to install bumpers  - 1 of two sinks clogged.  - message service (person reads you the messages ) sucks had 3 messages was only notified of 2.  - complained about all of the above, at front desk. then I got the dust covered cabinet surprise and called the manger to my room. all it got me was a sorry note (thank you for at least writing something Ms. Magdeleine Chew, assist manager). anywhere else they would have offered to change rooms or even comp you with an upgrade.  this is definitely a place where you do not get the minute attention to detail that you get in a Park Hyatt, Ritz or a Fairmont. worst part us that we had several rooms and a wedding reception there (so a ton of money was invested in the hotel). Never staying here again, even on a prepaid room as i had this time around. I am also going to get my corporate travel agent to remove the st Regis Singapore from the approved list. I recommend the grand hyatt, four seasons or the swisshotel in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Elfonashelf
Reviews.Content: The classically furnished rooms are showing wear. Sheets were ripped in a corner, definitely did not expect that. Butler was sweet but he took forever. Housekeeper sent to my room barely spoke English. Disappointing. Pool is small and tight. The plus side was the rooms are generously sized. The bellmen were very jovial and helpful, reminding us rain was forecast and even brought umbrellas out for us to use. Oh and their moon cakes were very good but unfortunately not good enough to redeem this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury escape!”
Reviews.Author: Missjane06
Reviews.Content: A couple of nights in this exquisitely lovely hotel madefor a perfect mini-break. The bathrooms are divine with the choice of either a rainshower or decadent free-standing bath (even drawn by your butler if you wish) with the tv on! Very comfortable beds with spotless linens and soft cotton robes make for a comfortable night. I couldn't fault the butler service (except you needed to call each time you wanted a coffee) but everything from reservation through to check out was seamless! My favorite touches - the "get well" menu items of comfort food when one isn't feeling the best and the yummy turndown choccies! Will I be back? This wins out over my usual Singapore hotels hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Butler service atrocious”
Reviews.Author: JSteinert
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is beautiful, has a convenient location, and most of the staff (from the doormen to the gym employees) are extremely friendly and polite, the butler service they boast is atrocious. Even asking for hot water takes over thirty minutes or requests are ignored. Many complaints later and a commitment from management to try harder have not materialized into improvement. Additionally as Starwood platinum members we are entitled to an upgrade to a suite if available. While we benefit from this at most Starwood hotels, we often are told that no suites are available even when online reservations show it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Up to Snuff”
Reviews.Author: Gary F
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time fan of St. Regis hotels, and in fact, I'd never stay anywhere other than the St. Regis in NYC. This hotel is nowhere close to that standard. The positives: great location at the bottom of Orchard Road, room butler's who tried hard even if it wasn't always done right, generally good service throughout the hotel, a good (but not great) deluxe king room, nice public areas. The not so positives: narrow hallways one would expect to find in a much lower quality hotel, overly complex room lighting, wifi system that was incomprehensible, no casual eating facility, disorganized banquet facilities. I spent 4 nights as a part of a large corporate group which used many of the meeting rooms and services. My luggage arrived a day after I did, and I was away from the hotel when it arrived. They asked if the butler could unpack for me and have any pressing done. I asked that two suits be pressed. I returned to find that the butler had done a great job of unpacking but had everything in my suitcase pressed, not just the suits. I appreciated the effort if not the cost. It took extraordinary effort to get the wifi to work on my iMac. In fact, it took tech experts from my company to get it done after the hotel staff had worked on it for a day. The absence of any casual dining is bothersome as well. One couple, looking for a quick bite, came into the bar and asked for a food menu. They were give the room service menu (which was quite nice) and room service prices. Most of my complaints were small ones, but they add up and the sum suggests that this St. Regis is not up to the standard I've come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy082010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 2, 3, 4 or even 5 star hotels but this is the best I have stayed. But there are some lapses in their service which I think it's minor. One example is the housekeeper took a very long (2 hours to be exact) time to come to our room after we gave them a call to makeup our room. I understand that the time was late (6pm) but 2hours was way too long for me. But the housekeeper was observant to notice that there were 3 kids in the room so offered more shampoo, soap and other stuff. Another example is the service personnel are always very busy and seems understaff. The response from them can be a bit slow. But I appreciate that they have many foreigners working in the hotel, Spain, France, Italy, Japanese, you name it. It helps when the guest is from the same country and they can speak the language. Overall, my family enjoyed ourselves. The food is fantastic. The breakfast's spread and quality is very good. I enjoyed the afternoon tea and wine tasting too. The decor in the hotel is very nicely done and I liked and appreciate them. The Bose sound system in the room is very good too. We could bring our DVD and watch with great sound system. The Bathroom comes with 1 TV, bathtub and massaging shower tap. We have a super king size bed which is so comfortable that we doze off quickly. The gym and swimming pool is great too. I liked that the gym has ice water which has cut fruits inside. It was so refreshing after a workout. If you have time, try the spa. It is very worth it. Take the time to try the sauna, cold shower and so on inside the spa. My children were very reluctant to leave and they rave on this hotel for weeks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant well serviced hotel”
Reviews.Author: jforjohn
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Singapore and stayed at the St Regis. Hotel is close to the main shopping area of Orchard Road. The gym and spa are well appointed and the pool is immaculate. The in-house restaurant offers exception food (and you can order special meals off the menu. The breakfast selection on offer was very broad and caters for all. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions don't always last”
Reviews.Author: mister_zee
Reviews.Content: I was planning a stay in celebration of our anniversary and decided to go with the St.Regis instead of Shangri-La or the Ritz Carlton due to the numerous glowing reviews, as well as being a Starwood Preferred Guest member. Stepping into the lobby, we felt like we have arrived on a luxurious destination. The doorman greeted us politely and it was brightly lit and beautifully decorated. Suitably impressed, we proceeded to check in. Hiccup number 1 - no one asked if they may be of assistance. We had to approach the staff. Wasn't it suppose to be the other way round? At check in, we were told our room was not yet ready and to enjoy a drink at the lounge while waiting. Unfortunately, there was no room for us at the lounge and we were ushered to a pair of armchairs at the other end of the lobby, where we were promptly forgottened unti l i went wandering to look for my check in staff. Hiccup number 2! When we got to the room, the Butler very professionally and cordially taught us how to operate the electronic panel and what not. When she departed, we decided to try the lights. Hiccup number 3 - one of the light bulb above the bed blew and was resolutely dark. Never mind, we said. We'll call up Housekeeping. Then, while indulging in the freestanding bathtub, we discovered the TV in the bathroom wouldn't work with controller. Again Housekeeping. Getting out of the tub, we decided to try watching a DVD we brought. Yet again, an issue - the TV went into black-and-white mode! Meanwhile, the electrician still hasn't arrived in all that time we took! Another call to the operator. Finally the technician came and rectified all the issues. Thank God, iwas beginning to think i must have forgotten to slip some money to grease the palms, so to speak. Then came another hiccup. I asked for ice to be in the room as i enjoy chilled water in the evenings. When i got to the room, the ice bucket had not been refilled the entire afternoon and now stood with a lot of water. Was this something very difficult to achieve or am i being unreasonable here? Now came the annoying part. The Butler clearly expects me to tip her even when it was only to ask her to send an electrician over to check the bulb (it blew. Again.) She refused to leave the room until my partner got up and opened the door, all the while staring at my wallet with the notes spilling out. That wasn't very subtle. It was our intention to tip at the end of our stay in addition to instances when we have been satisfied by their services. At this point in time, i was NOT only unsatisfied, i was beginning to lose my patience! The breakfast was lovely, as were the evening wine tasting. We were very impressed with both. The breakfast spread was commendable and our hostess was lovely. Again, the ice bucket was sadly neglected. However, we did enjoy the tea service which arrived promptly and warm,and finally gave a tip to the Butler. Yet at check out the next day, we once again experienced a hiccup. In fact, the entire affair made me adverse to booking another visit for my birthday. We were presented with a bill for a dinner we never ate at the hotel's restaurant. We balked. Thankfully, we had receipts with time stamps showing us at outlets miles down Orchard road at the time the dinner supposedly took place and cannot possibly be at the hotel. The staff was apologetic and, after making copies of our receipts, informed us the charges were waived. Not exactly a wise choice of words there. We requested for notification when the hotel has concluded its investigation but sadly the call never came. We wrote to the hotel weeks after the stay asking for the outcome and were told the staff did try contacting me via mobile. However, i could not be reached. If that were so, shouldn't a followup call have been made, or an email sent? None of these were done. Surely a hotel of such repute ought to be able to do this much without needing prooding from the guest! All in all, a rather bitter-sweet experience with the St.Regis. I hope other properties overseas fare better.

Reviews.Title: “My perfect holiday dream hotel~”
Reviews.Author: Juju1976
Reviews.Content: I had never thought an hotel could give me such an unforgettable memory. Just to stay in St. Regis, even without going out of the hotel, is worth my trip to Singapore. I travel frequently, and once in a while have the privilege of staying in a super luxury hotel, like Burj in Dubai or Peninsula in HK; but non of them give me the effortless perfection and friendly willingness to serve atmosphere that this ST REGIS impressed me with. Let me start from arrival: I arrived extremely early, my flight landed at 6AM, so I get to the hotel around 8AM ( oh, not that airport is SO FAR, I just grab a Starbucks at the arrival ~~ ) I wasn't hoping that they will give me a room since one normally checked in afternoon; besides my husband who booked the room's not traveling with me, he would only arrive much later. But I was warmly greeted and lead to the check-in desk. Instead of the standing up check-in counter, it's much nicer and intimate personal check-in desk like Des Indes in Den Haag. Jude, the receptionist checked me in with all the efficiency and friendliness, our assigned room wasn't ready yet, but he deftly checked other available room and changed the room for me immediately.
