He didn't question me or insist by rules that I must wait for my husband to arrive before check me in, this I am extremely grateful to him because I was exhausted from the night flight and a bad coughing flu I am experiencing. His assistance and compassion had made the beginning of my Singapore warm and welcoming. Always with a smile, he lead me to the elevator. Once I step into the room, I was over joyed, tastefully decorated classic room, though not as HUGE as the suites in Burj; but it's a very comfortable spacious room. And the free standing bath looks so enticing!!! within 10 mins my door bell rang; and the personal Butler - Sean came to greet me. He " toured " the room with me, introduced me to all the facilities in room, checked if every thing is in good order/functional and explained all the offered personal service that I can order through the Butler, such as FRESH TEA & COFFEE on demand, preparing BUBBLE BATH, and other special activities offered by the hotel; WINE APPRECIATION hour at the bar, free DRINK & CANAPE by the pool bar...etc. He was courteous and thorough. He left with my order for fresh tea, and soon the room service lady came back with a silver tray ladened with cups and silver wares and the fresh brewed tea. As soon as she realized that I have a terrible cough, she complied generously to my request with lemon slices and Honey, and brought me many bottle of water for me within 3 mins. Amazing service & speed. We were further impressed at the pool side bar where we were offered selection of drinks and canapes, open & airy, lovely spot to relax; and the waitress were so genuinely motivated at work, when we're leaving, she invited us to return next day for Sunday Brunch with such sincerity. Well done, Rosemarie, your smile is so lovely~ And one must try the bubble bath on demand, yes, of course we can prepare our own, but to have some one pampering you, setting up the bath while you relax on your sofa looking out of the window to the sparkling night view of Singapore; and when informed of the prepared bath in no time and step into the perfect-temperature bath ( I wonder if they carry a thermometer to test the temperature of the water?! ) I really had a feeling of being a PRINCESS ~~ ha ha!!! Well, not to get this review getting to long as it already is. The conclusion is that I had never thought a CHAIN hotel could never be able to offer personal services at this kind of level and apparently I was wrong. I can believe that how much hard work this whole team, from management down to the waiter or house keepers, every one has put in their maximum effort and willing to achieve. Congratulations the team of St. Regis. IF there's anything to complain, I would say only one thing, there's no "NO CHANGE TOWEL/SHEETS" cards available. I understand that your hotel opt to provide the immaculate cleanliness room grooming and would spare nothing to change towels and linens even it just have a crease on it. But for the environment, maybe it would be nice to give THE OPTION TO THE GUEST TO CHOOSE TO CHANGE TOWELS DAILY OR TO KEEP THE USED ONES DURING OUR STAY!!! I tried to explained to the house keeping but I don't think they understood, because I still come back to my room every time to see fresh linen and towels every time. Oh, and I didn't get my chocolate again on the second night turn-down service ;) Besides these, every thing's perfect, if I come back to Singapore, there's no other hotel besides St. Regis that I would stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel without exception!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiq
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, in a great location, with rock-star service. I can't fault the hotel. The rooms are large and extremely luxurious, the service is personalised and top-rate - when I checked in a butler knocked on my door to ask if he could iron my dress for dinner (all part of the service). I was in their 'standard' class room (nothing standard about it, it was amazing) so I can only imagine how special the suites and deluxe rooms are!!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly efficient”
Reviews.Author: parisnative
Reviews.Content: A dream 5-star, service is perfect from beginning to end, with bathrooms fit for a king and absolutely soundproof rooms. Well-located,10 minutes'walk from Orchard station round the corner of Orchard Rd (tho 10 minutes'walk in that climate is no mean feat) It' true that having to ring the butler each time you need a (free, 24/7) cup of tea proves to be a mixed blessing, but an excellent place all the same

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat dissapointed !”
Reviews.Author: Carlholg
Reviews.Content: Pluses : - Rooms are very luxurious and comfortable. - Location is convenient for Orchard Road. - Sumptuous Spa Minuses : - Breakfast is bland and boring, one of the most uninteresting eggs Benedict I've had in a long time. Food around the pool was also very average, nothing that would make you think you are in a 5 star hotel. - We arrived at 5:00 pm and our room was still not ready, so we had to wait another 30 minutes next to the reception. Hardly any apologies or a complimentary something to make up for it. - Was overcharged for the laundry, I contacted the Butler to correct the situation but ended it being too much of a fuss, so I just paid it. - The service was polite but aloof. Bluntly put; not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Economy Class Service at First Class Price”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to decide whether I should be writing this damning review on St Regis Singapore. This is because I'm such a fan of the hotel. Unfortunately, over the years, the service standard and product offerings at St Regis Singapore had deteriorated so much that I really don't think this hotel deserved all the praises. The feeling I get these days at the St Regis is like opening a Cartier box but only to find a silver ring in it. I have to stress that my review is based on my observation and five stays over a period of time from late 2008 till now. It's Cost Cutting Everywhere Nothing is more atrocious than implementing all the cost cutting measures (especially at the service and product offering) at the expense of the guests. St Regis guests do not pay peanuts to stay at the hotel. Most are discerning guests who do not mind the hefty price but in return would expect immaculate service and good value. Downgraded Bottled Drinking Water One of the things that I’ve noticed is that the hotel has replaced its drinking water in the room from the previous San Benedetto, an Italian mineral water, to a St Regis labeled drinking water. You might ask what’s the fuss over drinking water… Isn’t it just water? I wouldn’t even bothered about it if not because the hotel is St Regis. You do not expect such standard at a luxurious accommodation. St Regis just lowered its standard. The hotel needs to maintain or even surpass the other premium names. The other compromise is that the in-room selection of complimentary beverages has been reduced quite drastically. What a shame! Where's my Butler? When I first checked into the hotel two years ago, you could feel that you are an important guest and you are well taken care off. But these days, the staff at the check-in desk just checks you into the hotel, gives you the room number and points you to the lift. You can forget the “famous” butler service. During my last stay, the butler was nowhere to be found. The message is “Go figure it yourself”. Finding the room is not difficult but wait till get into the room… you will need a manual to understand all the switches. I thought I was the only one who got the service but I noticed that another couple got the same sub-standard service. Boo! So-so Food... cost cutting again?? The restaurants do not fare any better. Okay, maybe with the Chinese restaurant being the only exception. The selection of food has decreased yet I can’t say much about the price. It seems that they are inversely correlated. The Sunday brunch at the Les Saveurs used to have a good selection of food from all the three restaurants in the hotel but the management has removed the selection from the Italian and Chinese restaurants. Frankly, you can get better value food just next door at the Regent Hotel. Their Sunday brunch is about half the price of St Regis but the food selection and quality will impress you. Don’t expect much from the St Regis breakfast as well. To me, it’s just does not live up to the St Regis standard. Let me check! Staff I always remember hotel staff who have rendered good service. I try to do my best to compliment them as and when possible. But I do notice that over the last two years, most of the good staff have left the hotel. These days, you can count using one hand to count the number of excellent staff. Many are just not detailed and attentive. Imagine having to ask the waiter/ waitress to fill your glasses with water during the dinner… You have to remind them constantly… it’s either they are too busy or just not concerned. One more thing that really irritates me. In the past, you would get “certainly” whenever you have a request unfortunately now, you get a “let me check”. What do you need to check? I know you have it in the hotel so just served! Excellent Spa but has its weaknesses The only consolation about the hotel is that they still have an excellent spa (I wonder when the standard is going to fall). The therapists are excellent and their treatments are of first class… thank goodness for that. Despite the hefty price tag, the mani and pedi cure treatment by the famous Pedi:Mani:Cure Studio by Bastien Gonzalez is to die for. The only drawback is that the male spa and pool attendants are not detailed and attentive. It’s not uncommon that you find empty bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel in the cubicles, used drinking glasses in the spa, unfilled water jar, etc. I’ve noticed that the spa attendants would just walked pass those items and do nothing about it. Maybe they thought they have some super power to make those items disappear when they walked pass them. Are they not trained? But why the previous attendants did such a fantastic job and the current ones are not able to do them? High Staff Turnover I finally reaffirmed my view when I overheard an overseas guest complaining loudly to the hotel staff about the St Regis’ falling standard recently. He said the hotel just couldn’t get things right and everytime he complained, he will get a bottle of champagne as apology and things still not rectified. Apparently, he’s a repeated guest (but I guess he will not be anymore). He continued to say that he’s better off at another luxurious hotel just round the corner. I’ve talked to some of the regular hotel guests, they too complained about the cost cutting measures and falling standard. If you ask me whether I still patronize the hotel, my answer is yes but only when it’s really necessary. And I will definitely not recommend to my overseas guests. For now, it’s just a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: adityapune38
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is easily the best hotel in Singapore. Our stay here for 4 nights was truly memorable. This will be the hotel of choice for us during our future visits to Singapore as well. The rooms are large and spacious. The service is exemplary and easily the best that we have experienced anywhere. The location is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jona04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and I must say it is money well spent. Location - It is in a quiet neighbourhood, away from the hustle and bustle of the town area. If you choose to do some shopping, it is less than a 10-minute walk. Lot of places to have your meals around the area if you get tired of the hotel food. Room - Could see minor wear and tear in the room - the place where the card key has to be slotted, the laminating on the wall was peeling off with a burnt mark. There is a big chip off the shower room floor. I could feel it as I stepped in and out of shower. Other than these little imperfections, the room was close to perfect. Yan Ting - I had dim sum buffet lunch. The food was great. It was a bit hard to get the attention of the service stuff when I wanted to place my orders and some of my orders came very slow (the staff even thought all my food has been served). Brasserie Les Saveurs - Breakfasts were served here. There wide variety but not all dishes were great. On the second morning, when I asked for hot chocolate, the Maitre D forgot and I had to make a second request which came promptly. I had afternoon tea (which came in a set) here as well. I love the yummy scones, I wish there were more (there were 2 small ones). The sandwiches were average but pastries were a delight (I could only choose 2 per person). I thought the price were a little on a high side. Pool - Unfortunately, it rained during my stay so the water in the pool was cold so I didn't stay at the pool for long. A bottle of water was given during both visits to the pool which I really appreciated. Gym - It was a pity I didn't bring my running shoes or I would have loved to try out the gym equipments. I was woken up around 5 am on the second morning as I could hear the bulter talking and going in and out of the room (door opening and closing) next to mine. I didn't order any room service as the prices were high (eg S$20 for tiramisu) and I wish the wifi was free (S$20 per hour). Everything else was wonderful and will definitely go back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cl_51
Reviews.Content: For a St Regis hotel, the service standard was certainly appalling. We stayed at a suite on 30 Aug 2011, and the check-in time was supposed to be 2pm. We arrived at 2.40pm, to be checked-in by a surly front desk officer by the name of Katarine who told us that the room is not ready, and to return in 15-20mins time. We waited around the lobby, while she served the rest of the customers. We returned 20mins later, to be served by another front desk officer who again informed us to wait a little while longer. We had to return for the third time before we could be issued the access cards to our suite (1010). We went up to the suite, and the cleaning crew was still in the room. Upon seeing us, the cleaning crew left (which left us wondering if the room was really ready for our use). The butler service was equally patchy. When we checked into the hotel, we were issued a welcome letter from the guests relations manager (Fiona Zeng) that stated "We have outlined the following Suite entitlements which you will be able to enjoy during stay with us... Daily cocktails and canapes served in-room or Astor Bar at 6-8pm". Since we are travelling with a young child, we thought it might be inappropriate to bring the child to the Astor Bar. Hence we called the butler service at 730pm to request for the cocktail to be served in room. The butler said that he needed to check whether this request can be entertained and will get back to us. 10mins later, we called again, and the butler said this time round that due to safety (???) considerations, he would suggest that we proceed to Astor Bar to enjoy the cocktail and canapes, though he will check and let us know if it can be served in-room. I called the third time to check (a different butler answered this time round), only to be told with condescension that St Regis would "make an exception this time round to serve the cocktail and canapes in-room". I was aghast at the response. The guest was given a welcome letter with a choice. Apparently the option to choose became an exception which the hotel had to make for the guest on the grounds of safety concerns? If so, why offer such a choice to the guest then? I have stayed in other St Regis hotels around the world, but this by far was the worst experience thus far. There were no fresh flowers in the room (a common issue for St Regis suites), and the butler and front desk service were appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but horrible check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: vopuez
Reviews.Content: The room and the butler service are fantastic. I believe a lot has already been said about the lovely rooms. Thus, I’ll only like to point out on my horrible check-in experience. Upon entering the hotel for the 1st time, I wasn't sure where the reception area is. Staff members standing in the lobby made no attempt to approach me. I had to approach them instead to ask around. Since all 3 desks were occupied, I was asked to take a sit and will be informed once a desk becomes available. While waiting, I shortly realised that other in-coming guests have started to arrive and were being attended to while I was left behind. So I took my baggage and headed to the reception area. As there wasn't a proper queue, guests were standing around waiting while the receptionist looks clueless as to whom to serve next. Luckily, a kind gentleman had decided to let me check-in first. My booking came with breakfast but nothing was mentioned during the check-in. I was not informed of the breakfast location nor the timing. Also, I was not informed of the floor nor the room number I was assigned to. Once my credit card was returned to me, I was walked to the lift, shown how to operate it with the key card and the card was then handed to me while I make my journey up on my own. Mind you, I had to (a) figure out my room number, (b) upon arriving at my designated floor, I had to roam around to find my room while (c) carrying my own baggage. Not to mention that it took me a while to figure out how to work the lightings and the other facilities of the room, as I've basically entered a dimly lit room on my own. For the amount paid and the hotel star rating, I'd expect better.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises”
Reviews.Author: gokhanHk
Reviews.Content: No surprises , it is a St Regis and we pretty much like every moment there. All staff were very friendly but concierge deserves the special thanks for their quick and good arrangements any time we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely luxurious Hotel...Pricey though but just about worth it”
Reviews.Author: jambu583
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Singapore St Regis. Once again, staying loyal to SPG rewards programme. It is a fairly expensive hotel but you do realise what you are paying for when you enter the lobby. Fairly breathtaking. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the finishing is first class. We had no problems whatsoever with any of the staff or the services provided. A thoroughly enjoyable stay and will definitely revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room and very spacious.”
Reviews.Author: yojude
Reviews.Content: Visited Singapore last December and used my Starwood points to try the St. Regis. It is a newer hotel and the location is slightly better than the Sheraton on Scotts Rd. It is towards the end of Orchard Road but still within walking distance to all the shopping malls. The rooms at the St. Regis were very spacious, especially considering how premium space is in Singapore, and the bathroom was stunning. Unfortunately, our stay was only for 2 nights so we did not get to enjoy the tub. As for amenities, the soaps and shampoos were nice and the daily replenishment of bottled water was great. We did not have any meals at the hotel because their selection wasn't as good and there were so many other restaurants and food courts within walking distance. They also don't offer a buffet similar to that of the Hyatt on Scotts. Overall, my experience at this hotel was very good, the location was bordering on what looked like a residential neighborhood so it offered peace and relaxation after a busy day shopping and sightseeing. One last note, I used to butler service once for some tea but service was a little inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and Elegant Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BradS6
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to escape the hectic pace of the throbbing Singapore City pulse. A short walk from the Orchard MRT station, one can find a tranquil setting which winds down a very busy day. Staying at this St. Regis, while on business is an absolute pleasure. Thank you to the tremendous staff - in all areas of the hotel, including F&B, Front Desk, Housekeeping, Spa, Concierge, and the kind greeters who welcome you to this beautiful property each day. I very much enjoyed my three nights and days, during my hectic business trip. It was a pleasure coming back, taking a few minutes to myself in the spa area to unwind and relax. It is so quiet....only the sounds of water streaming down from all directions. And the lobby bar for my evening cocktail. The breakfast each morning was one of my favorite pastimes.....the food was delicious. Such a wide range of options. Thank you again to all management and staff who do everything they can to make the stay away from home, an enjoyable and effortless experience. I can't wait to return, on my next trip to SE Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: Caribnow
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the finest appointed hotels that I've stayed in. The room was up to date and beautiful while the common areas were spacious, well lit, and inviting. The service wasn't in the top tier of hotels that I've visited but it was definitely better than average. For example, we called the concierge to make dinner reservations at a restaurant he recommended and he didn't call us back to confirm the reservation or time. We had to call him back and discovered we had 10 minutes to be at the restaurant, not good. On the plus side the doorman paid one of our cab fares when we didn't have enough cash for the taxi, we didn't even ask. Naturally we paid him back after going to an ATM machine. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury, get the Jade massage in the spa too!”
Reviews.Author: writesitedubai
Reviews.Content: I've just left the St Regis after one luxurious night, and it's safe to say I could have stayed a lot longer, if I was rich. My room was pristine to the point of sparkling, my bed was like sleeping on a cloud and my butler was attentive and very knowledgeable about the area and Singapore in general. I love the TV over the bathtub here! I had a Jade hot and cold massage in the gorgeous spa, which saw my chakras were well and truly pampered. I highly recommend this massage, I felt so good afterwards and practically fell asleep during the hot part. Breakfast was an impressive buffet, the swimming pool area was well tended to and didn't have too many screaming children, and the TV in the room had so many channels I could have watched it all day, if I wasn't out visiting the Botanic Gardens just 10 minutes up the road (pay the extra $5 for the orchid garden, it's well worth it!) I would definitely not hesitate to say at the St Regis again. My ONLY complaint (and I hate to make it because it's an amazing hotel) is that the Internet appears to cost $10 an hour, a price which is really quite incredible when you consider that $50-a-night hotels offer speedy WIFI for free elsewhere in Singapore. Still, Starbucks and Chilis round the corner offer free WIFI (Chilis is best as it's faster and runs its own network) and you shouldn't waste your time on the net here anyway, not when you could be up in the spa experience the wet room which is free to all guests. I spent an hour there before my Jade massage. Try standing with your head under the waterfall that comes down from the ceiling in the middle of the indoor jacuzzi. Weird sensation, like having a head massage! Love it.

Reviews.Title: “we love it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: DanielOon
Reviews.Content: Counter Service was professional, prompt, hospitable & resourceful. Yan Ting Restaurant is splendid. Food is excellent. Waiting staff are courteous, knowledgeable & efficient. Ambience is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good bedrooms, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: MumuGB
Reviews.Content: When I booked at the St Regis, I expected it to be a treat -you just have to look at the price tag to understand why. The hotel was full and I think that they couldn't cope. We arrived, with two small children, after a long flight from Europe. Any parent will understand how we felt. We had booked two adjacent bedrooms but only one was ready. With hindsight, I should have made a fuss there and then and I deeply regret not to have done it. I wanted to be flexible and we were exhausted. We squeezed in our bedroom and started putting the clothes in the cupboards -you need to be organised when you travel with a young family!-. Then we went out for dinner. When we came back, we were told that the adjacent room was defective (a leak apparently) and we needed to move to a different set of bedrooms. The hotel staff were just looking at us packing our stuff in a hurry and didn't lift a finger to help. I would have appreciated them to move my things but it simply didn't cross their mind. I made my discontent known and from that moment on we kept receiving apology letters (from the receptionist, from the manager -who wanted to meet us and was calling us every 5 minutes -for god's sake we are on holidays,...). The bedrooms were fantastic (I especially liked the power shower) but you need to pay a hefty amount for wi-fi. It was unclear whether the breakfast was included (it was, in the end). When we checked out, they removed a little bit of our bill but it won't make me come back. On a more positive side, I highly recommend the Italian restaurant next to the swimming pool. The quality of the food was great and the service was spotless. Obviously this comes at a price!

Reviews.Title: “A "Real" St. Regis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleEinNY
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Singapore and I have stayed here multiple times. This is a real St. Regis Hotel. Some of the other St. Regis hotels are just branded "St. Regis" but do not live up the level of service and quality that is supposed to come with the brand (like the one in Beijing. It's awful. Don't stay there). Everything about THIS hotel, however, lives up the St. Regis brand - from the decor, the amenities, to service and even the toiletries (they use Remede products) and the famous Red Snapper cocktail. Pros: - Super location. Right around the corner from Orchard Road. - Impecable service. - Luxe rooms with terrific amenities. Fluffy beds, thick towels, great sized bathroom with 2 sinks, seperate shower and soak tub (with TV). - The rooms are set up well for people who need to do work. Built in coverter plugs, large desk, etc. Cons: - Room service food is so-so. - Room rate is absolutely absurd now if you do not have a corporate rate - S$620 when I stayed! I stayed here when it first opened 3 years ago and it was only ~S$200 then. - They're getting cheap on the products. No lotion in the room this time and they used to provide the Remede body gel in both the shower and the tub but now just in the shower. - They charge for internet access. I know lots of hotels do this but it's annoying when you are already paying a high room rate. - The gym is just okay. Small-ish and not a ton of equipment, though all of it is very new and it is very clean. Tips: - This is one of the best values for your Starwood points - only 12,000 points to stay here!! - Take all the Remede products in your room with you. That stuff is great and is super expensive (they sell it at the Spa, at Barney's in NY and at Sephora in the US).

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: dunmetiel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Regis Singapore in the weeks leading up to Christmas so because it was situated near Orchard Rd, there was a really lovely festive feel all around the hotel during that period. The moment you step into the St Regis, you KNOW you are in good hands and that you are in one of the best hotels in town. I thoroughly enjoyed the 24-hour butler service - they were super prompt and efficient in delivering anything you ask for. I especially loved the complimentary TWG teas served by the butlers. I am embarrassed to say I ordered 8 pots of tea in one night! The room was relatively spacious with beautiful classic decor with a hint of modern touch (large high-tech TV set in the room and a screen in the bathroom too). The lighting was fantastic and so was the view of Tanglin Road set with all the Christmas decorations. I loved the beds - so luxurious and comfortable. Room service was great as well. I really enjoyed the delicious food. The spa facilities were also provided complimentary, which I utilised when I went swimming in the pool. The pool itself was nice - large and peaceful. After my swim, I made full use of the spa facilities such as the indoor and outdoor jacuzzis, sauna, and shower. It was a fantastic experience. I stayed there the entire afternoon with my friend and aunt. In terms of service, all the hotel staff were excellent except for the spa staff who gave us condescending and dirty looks and weren't very cooperative in letting us use the lockers. When they misunderstood what we said regarding some issues, they responded in a very defensive and annoyed manner. Despite the unfriendly spa staff, I will still go back to the St Regis again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: TreyZ
Reviews.Content: First time at a St Regis and it was a great overall experience. Check-in was very pleasant with a complimentary upgrade (SPG Gold Member). Our room had the butler service which was wonderful, coffee and tea butler service at 1am is something I can get used to. All of the staff were very friendly, particularly the butlers and door men. The Astor Bar was a great place to relax. Definitely the only hotel in Singapore that I would stay at.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ashiyadudeman
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 4 days and wanted to be in the Orchard Road area. Selected the hotel based upon location, primarily. The place is very opulent & well appointed. We enjoyed nightly cocktails & the in room coffee / tea delivery was splendid. Would stay here again. A great value when you consider the total package.

Reviews.Title: “My place to stay in Singapore!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that St Regis is one of the best hotel in Singapore. If luxury is your top priority then this hotel is the choice. I have been staying in this hotel for many times and I kept coming to St Regis every time I'm in Singapore. Rooms were delicately designed and built to perfection. The swimming pool was of a good size and simple. Never been to the spa but it looked interesting to try. Breakfast was perfect. Lots of varieties of western and asian choices. The only downside was maybe its location which was not in the heart of the Orchard road but it's not too bad...

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel/room”
Reviews.Author: rockymsia
Reviews.Content: check in was smooth & they had my room ready. asked for late check out but it seems the girl checking me in automatically gave me late check out till 2pm which is initiative.The corner room was great,the Bose sound system was excellent and they had 2 cd for my listening pleasure. My friends who came to view the room was also impressed about the room and hotel. check in was good, so was bell service and other staff in hotel. money well spend. the only complain was the high charges for the internet service, thought starwood was not charging for wifi in Asia. anyway went around the corner to starbucks had coffee and free wifi,3mins walk. BTW the bathroom was excellent with tv facing the bathtub. Overall great place

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are Starwood SPG Gold members and we stay at many hotels around the world and a lot of them are Starwood. This hotel is simply sublime. The 24 hour butler service is seriously fabulous, the rooms are beautifully appointed and the staff and management are insanely friendly, attentive and helpful. From the minute you step out of your car at the St. Regis Singapore you will feel welcome, relaxed and you will have a great stay. The Executive Room The bathrooms in the executive rooms are larger than that of the grand deluxe but less space to put your clothes/bags etc. the showers in all the rooms catagories are the best I have ever experienced in a hotel room, the water comes at you from all directions and it's simply relaxing and soothing. The executive rooms are longer in shape than the grand deluxe and look over the pool. The Grand Deluxe Room The hand painted wallpaper accents in the Grand deluxe rooms and the view of the botanical gardens are what makes these rooms that little bit more special. They have gloss wooden doors and accents, the bathrooms are beautiful with in wall tv's above the free standing claw foot baths and fabulous amenities. The butler service is fantastic, they will unpack your bags for you and on arrival don't forget to give them you 5 garments for pressing. They will offer you fresh tea or fresh made coffee in the morning at any time delivered to your room,a real treat to wake up to and a hand delivered newspaper. Over all I rate this hotel 6 stars as it truly is an experience. Although only a 5 star hotel as is the Singapore Sheraton, the Sheraton Towers is like staying at a motor Inn, tired, rude staff and awful amenities. If you are staying in Singapore, there really is no other place to stay for true luxury ! Breakfast is great with Asian, American and western style choices with eggs to order as well as omelets. give it a go, you won't be disappointed. check my travel blog out for other hotels and restaurants that we have experienced. http://champagne4everyone.blogspot.com/ Brad and Rob

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsInATravelBag
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 4 nights, the total experience was good but not meet my expectation. As there is no exculsive service for SPG Platinum, and not provide the same stardard service by different day. for examep, when I checked in, they offered me a Fruit basket and second day they upgraded me to a suite and no fruit at all. sometimes housekpeer forgot to replace a new both gel. I wonder why? do they have a supervisor to check and should they maitain a same quality every day? will try another hotel next time in Singapore. been stay Grand Hyatt, Sheraton, actully, Grand Hyatt is best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Our preferred hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: June_198030
Reviews.Content: This is our first choice when we're in Singapore. This is like our home in Singapore, we prefer to stay here when we have business trip and intend to stay longer. We only stayed other hotels just to check what they offer but we always end up coming back to Regis. Pretty near for shopping at Orchard, great service especially their tea and cookies which you can call and let it delivered to your room anytime and as often as you want. Compared to other expensive hotels for us this hotel is where you can experience luxury inexpensively.

Reviews.Title: “Why such expensive Wi-Fi !!!”
Reviews.Author: FussyButFair01
Reviews.Content: I just checked out from a three day stay at the St Regis and discovered not only is the Wi-Fi very expensive ($18 per day) but the hotel charges this PER DEVICE! Have they gone completely mad. At the local youth hostel it's free! I guess they think their guests are wealthy and will pay it, that's probably true, but it still completely insane and a tad insulting. In this modern age it should be standard when you pay so much for a room. Everything is so expensive in this hotel I guess they think people won't notice. Otherwise as expected the room, service and location of this hotel are excellent if it's Orchard Rd you want to be near.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Ozymandez O
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a getaway with my girlfriend. Entered room; bathroom had no amenities (toothbrush, cotton pads), no shaower gel in the shower. Called house keeping and they admitted that they must have 'missed it out' due to my early check in (I checked in at 6:30 pm!!). Prefer room service. The caprese was a disaster: soggy mozzarella cheese accompanied by green tomatoes (red wannabes), tomato soup that was cold and horrible in taste, prawn masala with uncooked prawns and of course the French fries which was harder that the toothpick placed on the tray. Was so angry at that point that I called my butler and asked him to take 'the rubbish' food out of my room. Asked him to try the fries and he was very embarrassed. Total room service bill; S$140. I seriously recommend other hotels in the same vicinity with much better food and service quality. St. Regis is fairly new with very plush rooms, but everything else is terrible. Ordered room service, the

Reviews.Title: “Loving it less, disappointed with reduced amenities”
Reviews.Author: Genbi
Reviews.Content: This is my probably 4th or 5th time staying at st regis singapore and was loving it the whole time. But the recent stay was quite disappointing since they reduced the Butler's free in-room beverages to just the regular TWG teas, such as english breakfast, darjeeling standard teas. I missed the Silver Moon TWG teas and their varieties and hot chocolates which we always order in the morning and night. I also noticed, they replaced the St Benedictine naturale water with just a regular non-branded bottled water. Maybe they try to cut cost and reduced some of the luxury amenities which made st regis property luxurious before. As a loyal SPG member, I'm quite disappointed at st regis singapore reduced amenities since we paid more than our preferred better located Mandarin Orchard hotel. One thing that st regis singapore can improve is the Breakfast buffet line which is quite poor selection; they can emulate st regis bali with the lavish foie gras breakfast and ordering from a buffet menu from our tables.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kenhsiang
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's everything you would expect out of a St. Regis property-- a great room- beautifully and tastefully done, a nice gym, great service, great bloody mary's. Of course, there could be more staff to help you check-in / check-out and there could be some better instructions for the lights in the room but these are small issues. I would stay here everytime I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: CatnBear
Reviews.Content: Having transited through Singapore countless times we finally decided to leave the airport on the way back from the Maldives. Asking around we received several recommendations, with the St. Regis receiving the highest praise. And it didn't disappoint. With the Bentley airport transfer option, we were met at the gate and whisked off in a buggy to get our bags and clear customs. Once outside the driver took our bags, opened the doors for us and within minutes of landing we were reclining into the sumptuous leather of the Bentley. Arriving at the St. Regis the service didn't let up. The moment we stepped out of the Bentley we were greeted by a staff member who took us straight up to our room and did an in room check-in. Our bags arrived shortly after and then the butler knocked on our door offering tea and coffee. The room was spacious with all the amenities one would expect but the real stand out was the bathroom. With fixtures and fittings reminiscent of a 16th Century French palace, it included two sinks, a bathtub with TV and a shower with multi-directional jets. The toiletries provided were also of the finest quality. What we liked... Service: Impeccable. During check-in we were informed that breakfast was included and would be served downstairs in the restaurant. Upon check-out we noticed that we had been charged for breakfast. The staff were more than happy to remove the charge once we explained the above. Having later checked our reservation we realised that breakfast had not in fact been part of our booking. Butler: The butler service was a fantastic extra and we ordered many cups of tea, coffee and hot chocolate. Quality: All aspects of the hotel are of the highest standard. Location: Being at the end of the shopping madness that is Orchard Road and close to the Botanical Gardens this was an ideal location for exploring Singapore. Transfer: The Bentley transfer upon arrival is well worth it. We liked it so much that we booked it on the way back as well. What we didn’t like... Views: The outlook from our room was rather uninspiring showing three apartment blocks but this is a factor of the location rather than the hotel. Price: It’s not cheap but you certainly get what you pay for. Overall the St. Regis lived up to the recommendations we received and was an outstanding hotel in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “They certainly know how to do it.....”
Reviews.Author: alieneyes
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest, the trip did not get off to a good start! I booked an airport transfer with the St Regis and they forgot to pick me up. So I after establishing by 'phone there was no car coming, I got a cab. The concierge was so mortified and apologetic, he paid the cab fare - and it didn't appear on the bill. The hotel was as you would expect, luxury all the way; good comfortable room, good breakfast; bar was a little pricey. Wireless Internet access was the only problem. It was free with my room but extremely unstable on the 15th floor, continually dropping out without warning. Other wise a great stay in a very pleasant hotel. The final surprise was, when I checked out, there was no airport transfer on the bill to the airport. On being told it was included, I let them take my bags and get on with it. When I walked out, my free ride was the house Bentley..... It certainly changed my view of the place!

Reviews.Title: “Suite Experience”
Reviews.Author: fenghuo
Reviews.Content: Decided to give myself a luxury break over the weekend, and opted to take a weekend indulgence package to the St Regis suite (I think it is considered the executive suite) at the "address of luxury". Wifi, non-alcoholic drinks at the mini-bar, pay-movies etc were all thrown in with the suite which resides at the corner of the hotel floor.The windows of the lounge/sitting area open up to a great view of Tudor Court, and the Tanglin area, which was much better than the executive deluxe rooms facing the back of the hotel in my previous stays. I love St Regis for its highly comfy and classy settings/furnishings, where sleep quality is ensured with the nicely-sized King size bed, soft and comfortable bedding. I have no problems settling in each time, and this is coming from one who usually takes a while to get comfortable with hotel beds and getting a good night's sleep. Due to the partiioning, the bathroom area appears less spacious as it does not quite open up to a good space unlike experiences in the executive deluxe room. I love the double basin concept (no need to share and re-organise the toiletry space with your partner!), though the window of the bathroom at the tub area looking into the bedroom did not quite give the intended effect. I would rather opt for the rain shower, which has good jet power and relaxing feel. I was disappointed however for the fact that complimentary cocktails/canapes were served in the Drawing Room, which did not give a sense of distinction and serenity, as it was on the ground floor. Likewise, I would rather have the hotel extending an offer to serve breakfast/cocktails at the comfort of the suite for those who desire a quieter respite over the weekend. Altogether the hotel is worthy of its status, and I like the slightly quieter location just at the border of Orchard Road area to escape from the buzz of town, yet it is a short hop away from your needed (retail) therapy and other indulgences. Luxurious comfort can be tagged with the hotel name, though there should be finer touches to make guests feel more welcomed and recognised. It also seems that the hotel suffers slightly from a high volume of residents, which can be seen from crowds during breakfast time. (By the way, Sunday breakfasts are served at Brasserie Les Saveurs till 10am only, so those who wish for a lie-in on Sundays should opt for La Brezza on Level 2 which serves breakfast till 11am.) The butler service also seemed to less attentive as a result (e.g. welcome tea/coffee came rather late after ~20-30min).

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darrin_Smith
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay in St. Regis Very nice hotel, beautiful ground and setting, wonderful pool and excellent breakfast I will coming back in another St. Regis property in the world

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: cktiki
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis in singapore is a very nice property. The rooms are quite spacious and well done up - a good mix of the modern and old wold charm. The lighting system is a bit cumbersome to operate and we had problems several time of the controls not working properly. The hotel facilities are nice too. The breakfast is quite a good spread. The pool is small but not bad for a quick swim or a dip with the family. The concierge is good and they make good recommendations. The butler service is the highlight though. They are efficient and very helpful in making your stay comfortable. Since we were travelling with a small baby this was very useful. Along with the buttler service the in-room dining was also helpful to us in helping with our baby's food. The location of the hotel is also quite good. Its about a 7-10 minute walks from the malls like Ion. Also, we even walk to the botanical gardens which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “deluxe luxe”
Reviews.Author: craigr22
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here en route between Sydney and the US and from the moment we arrived it was heavenly. The room and its adjacent bathroom were beautifully decorated, a super comfy bed with an AM wake up from the staff butler who took our order for preferred morning beverage the night before & served it discreetly whilst we stirred ourselves from all that comfort.. Clothes sent for pressing were returned within a couple of hours in perfect condition. The pool and spa areas are serene and quiet. The function rooms also exude quiet luxury. Located in a great spot - easy access by taxi to all the sights & scenes of Singapore. Very nice indeed, very pricey, but worth the splurge

Reviews.Title: “Smooth as silk”
Reviews.Author: david_qld
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at The St Regis and am very impressed. The art of providing luxury and service without being over bearing and annoying is difficult to master. This property and the Park Hyatt Sydney are 2 that do it very well. Butler service isn't usually part of my normal mode of travel but it was certainly handy. It would be a dream come true for frantic business trips. Not so important for our leisurely long weekend but still nice to have. The breakfast is extensive which is a great way to start the day. No idea why breakfast in the main restaurant ends early on a Sunday morning (when people may choose a slower start to their day). Location is handy for the mandatory Orchard Rd visit and cabs are very reasonable in Singapore so everything else is in easy reach. The Marina Bay precinct (casino, ku de ta etc) is less than S$10 away. The hotel has a good selection of wines (naturally, at the usual inflated Asian wine prices) and food is good and at a sensible price. Ordered from the room service menu (Private Dining Menu) by the pool and enjoyed a nice curry in the sun. All in all, an enjoyable, attentive luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Slick as usual - but not as personalised for a special occassion”
Reviews.Author: Justbobhrh
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel and fantastic place to stay. I took my wife and 8 friends there for a 4 day weekend for my wife's Bday. Planned the events well in advance with the Hotel. The head concierge (Krystina) was great. The only criticism I have is that the hotel could probably have done something without charging me to acknowledge the special event. I wanted chocolates and a message in each room for our friends - that was organised beautifully but at an additional cost of $80 per room! Something like that should have been organised without an additional charge given we have 1 suite and 3 x grand deluxe rooms for 4 days. But overall, a magnificent experience. Our friends were blown away with the hotel and the buffett breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “service doesn't match property facilities”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: a most disapointing visit to a "five star hotel" messed my check in...took 30 minutes, same at check out was handled by too many staff members. it took an hour to log on to the interent despite three calls for someone to help. the hotel prides itself on the butler service to all rooms, that's okay if they are available ! I believe the front office staff need retarining and there is a serious shortage of "butler staff" to assist guests. It shouldn't take 30 minutes for the butler to come to your room to show you where a electrical point is hidden. I would be avoiding this hotel until the service matches the price per room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but let down by Housekeeping and a Smoke-filled pool-side”
Reviews.Author: Globaltattler
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the St Regis Singapore, the first being when it first opened 3 years ago. We have also stayed in the Grand Hyatt, Fullerton, Four Seasons, Conrad and Ritz Carlton in Singapore. Checked in for just a short stay as a get away. Aside from the usual posh lobby, well appointed rooms (kudos for keeping the furnishings in mint condition still) and great breakfast buffet expected of a top 5 star hotel, we also enjoyed attentive check-in (he proactively offered us a higher-floor to give us a better view), generous waiver of our child's breakfast buffet, and friendly valet services (they even went and got the car for us just to retrieve something we had left in it...and we only found out later that the car park is easily accessible from the lobby and we could've easily retrieved the item ourselves). Unfortunately, our stay was marred a little by the following, which I feel was highly unacceptable for a 5 to 6 star rated hotel and a brand name like the St Regis: 1) Poor and late housekeeping- First, when we got to the room, the toilet smelled like someone had just used it...it smelt really bad. Then, we found stains on the hand towel. We called for turn down service at about 6PM, went for dinner, and returned to find that nothing had been done. We had to call about 3x before Housekeeping appeared, by which time my child was tucked into bed and we had to simply ask for fresh towels and emptying of the trash. We requested a child's bathrobe, which didn't appear, and had to request it again the next day, only to receive it one hour before check-out. In the morning, we activated the Make Up Room light, left the room for almost 3 hours, and returned to find nothing had been done. (It is actually interesting, we wanted so much to love the hotel we held our breath when we opened the door...). Housekeeping then showed up close to noon, when we were watching an in-house video-movie, and we almost thought about forfeiting the movie just to let him clean in case he didn't return....He did eventually return, after we activated the button when the movie was done, had no service for another hour or so, then called again. By then, even though we needed to use the room, we decided to simply huddle on the sofa and let Housekeeping do his cleaning because it was Now or Never. 2) Poor pool-side experience The pool was small, which was OK with us, since it was beautiful and clean. However, there was ZERO pool-side service- no one at the towel stand, no water offered, nothing. The deck chairs were grubby. Given that this was a very small area, it was not acceptable that people were allowed to smoke close to the pool area as we all had to put up with the second hand smoking. In fact, 2 of these smokers were hotel staff girls, huddling in a corner by the trash can! 3) Erratic Room Service Room service took almost an hour to whip up 3 simple dishes the first evening, and ice water was served instead of warm as requested (a minor infraction perhaps)... But after that, the butler with a second pot of tea and the table clearing took an inestimably long time to arrive. The meal we ordered the next day appeared more promptly, but this might be because we were so hungry we decided to speed things up by ordering only 1 dish. 4) Too Soft Mattresses This might be a matter of personal preference, but I could not sleep a wink as the mattress sagged and provided no support. For a 3 or 4 year hotel, I want to say that this was because they had deliberated chosen a soft mattress, but this mattress problem was not my experience in my previous stay (or I would not have returned). For a short stay, we overall had a good time, but a long term guest might want to re-consider his options as these inconveniences could build up quite a bit of frustration over time.

Reviews.Title: “Very much pleased”
Reviews.Author: Shahhfield
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel during the time staying here. It had excellent staff and top quality of facility, which all made me pleasant. The hotel also had convenient location, therefore it was very easy to travel to business & entertainment centers surround. Strongly recommend to you!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolutely Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: This review is based on two stays – with a week between them – at this property. After a 13 hour flight from London, I decided to treat myself to the St Regis Bentley transfer, so I arrived at the hotel in supreme comfort. This transfer might cost many multiples of a taxi transfer, but to step off of a long flight, be escorted off of the plane to a completely separate area by electric buggy, and then be told that one’s luggage is waiting for them in the car outside, it is (relatively) priceless. Check-in (both times around, and I only had the Bentley transfer for my first stay) was smooth, and very painless – certainly no queues as others have noted. One thing I will say about some of the check-in staff is that their English, and general friendliness is not on a par with the standards in virtually every other area of the property. This is probably the weakest area of the hotel, front desk staff should all be extremely friendly and absolutely fluent in English (and other major languages). I experienced two grades of room, the Grand Deluxe, and Lady Astor. Whilst the Lady Astor grade has a slightly larger bathroom with a window, the room has smaller windows and overlooks the city, and not an especially good view of the city either, the Grand Deluxe definitely has an airier, lighter feel and enjoys views over the greenery of the Botanical Gardens. The lighting panel is not complex as others have implied, far from it, one button to switch off all the lights and a few “mood” settings, that’s it. The Bose sound system and large television complete the overall high quality feel of the room. Dimensions are generous, and decor is very attractive, with white wooden panelling, lots of marble, Murano glass chandeliers, and rich fabrics and textiles. On general maintenance, the Lady Astor room had a tear to the sheer curtain – something which should have been replaced almost immediately in an hotel of this calibre; very disappointing that no remedial work had been carried out. The TWG tea service – for me – made the butler service special; it was very pleasant to receive one’s chosen tea after a morning alarm call. The TWG tea is a really lovely touch and is served in TWG’s own brand teapots which are very stylish; far easier to call down for a drink than to start messing around with making it oneself. I never had to wait more than ten minutes (and often it was far faster) for a cup of tea to be brought to my room. The garment pressing service was speedy, and perfectly executed. Whilst not essential, butler service to all rooms certainly differentiates this property from others in the city. The concierge were very helpful (and patient!) in making restaurant reservations, and sorting out flights for me. The service throughout this property is of such an high standard, that when I walked up to a concierge who I had never dealt with previously, he knew my name – I am still unsure as to how he managed this trick, and even though they wear earpieces, the person at the other end still had to have known my name! However, I do note that it was impossible to call the concierge directly from one’s room, the phone always rang and rang and ended up being diverted to the central guest services number who would take a message to relay to the concierge. Whilst not ideal, the concierge did always return my call in a very short space of time. The doormen deserve a special mention for being so friendly, courteous, and also real characters who would share amusing anecdotes with you. The outdoor pool is a very pleasant – and largely underused – area; service is a little minimal, cold waters are brought over to you every so often, but there should be a sorbet/iced fruit service as this level of property too. The spa is delightful, and comprises a small indoor wet area with heated marble slabs, Jacuzzi, sauna, and steam room and an even smaller outdoor Jacuzzi area. One thing I will point out is that the spa areas are entirely separate for men and women which is absolutely fine, but it would have been nice for there to be a communal area where one can spend time with one’s partner. As with the rest of the hotel, the spa staff are superb. The breakfast is fantastic, and standards were consistent throughout my stays; I am genuinely puzzled as to how anyone can complain about this. There is an excellent selection of fruit, including fresh berries, a wide range of high quality cereals, and granola. All the usual cold cuts, about half a dozen European cheeses (something which needs to be taken in context i.e. the hotel is in the middle of Asia), American hot selection (quite why anyone would want a “full English/American” when there are so many other more interesting options baffles me, but the choice is there nevertheless), Oriental hot selection, Indian hot selection, made to order omelettes, selection of breads, and really good quality French style pastries. If the buffet selection is still not enough, there is an a la carte available with classics such as eggs Benedict, French toast, and waffles. Service is perfect; napkins were neatly folded each time one left the table to go to the buffet, glasses of fresh orange juice were continuously topped up, and the staff even replaced my tea with a fresh one so that I wouldn’t be drinking lukewarm liquid. The breakfast really sets one up for the day in a very positive frame of mind! The Italian restaurant was probably my least favourite, whilst the service was good, the food was just a little ordinary. The pizzas were fine, but they were certainly not one of the best pizzas I have ever had, and for the prices charged, and the fact that the rest of the property really excels, the food just needs to be a little more special. Decor is pleasant though, and one could – with a bit of imagination – be sat by an hotel pool in Capri. The complimentary wine presentation each evening is a very thoughtful touch; only a few guests took advantage of this, so it was never crowded. It comprised a flight of three wines and a selection of cheddar and biscuits to accompany it. I hadn’t intended having dinner in the Brasserie Les Saveurs (the menu seemed a little conventional compared to some of the cities other French restaurants), but circumstances resulted in my dining there, and I could not have had a more enjoyable dinner. Whilst all the tables could be described as comfortable, I was seated at an alcove (although it is so large and private it could almost be described as a room) which was especially pleasant. The level of service was ultra-attentive yet unobtrusive, throughout my two hours it was absolutely faultless. The waiter took note of our dietary requirements and the amuse bouches were tailored accordingly – again, a thoughtful touch. The food itself was superb, and married contemporary and classical techniques resulting in dishes that really were a triumph – they were not too traditional to be dull, nor too avant garde to become challenging. One must have the flambéed mango for pudding, it is done tableside, and is a really exotic tasting dish. Neither my partner nor myself had coffee, yet we were still offered petit fours. We dined there on an early weekday evening, and the restaurant was very quiet, it is a shame more people do not discover what fabulous food is on offer. I would love to find a restaurant that offers this style of food and service (although I can’t imagine anywhere in Europe offering such high standards yet being so relaxed and unstarchy) in London. Even if you may not ordinarily consider an hotel restaurant, this is an exception that you must make. During my stay I had one issue – which was largely out of the hotel’s control – and this was dealt with, with the utmost professionalism and discretion. Things do go wrong – even in seemingly perfect properties such as this – but if handled correctly they become a non-issue. The Platinum level reviewer seems to be largely whinging about not being offered something for nothing simply by having a platinum level SPG status (which is not actually that difficult to come by). Now, whenever I am in Singapore I will not consider staying at another property as my experience of this one has been virtually perfect. The location is also a pleasure, away from the more commercial areas (Boat & Clarke Quay, Marine Bay), near to the shops, trendy (and excellent) Dempsey Rd. Restaurants, and close to the greenest parts of the city. Quite why the St Regis is not leading the various CN Gold and other lists for Singapore hotels is a mystery as the other leading hotels seem so ordinary by comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some limitations”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Regis for a week and got to know the hotel well. The rooms are simply great. Restaurants were in my opinion poor although service was excellent. After receiving our lukewarm food on 2 occasions we didn't go back preferring to eat elsewhere. The hotel swimming pool is on small side and is generally shaded by tall surrounding buildings. Pool service is very good and friendly. Location is good and a pleasant walk to the shops in Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: gregorhayes
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this place is fantastic. Pricey - this is not pretending to be anything other than a genuinely first class 5 star hotel - but as nearly always in life, you get what you pay for. Service could not be faulted. Attentive without being intrusive; unfailingly polite from management to cleaning staff; every detail is considered. Room was amazing - everything you'd expect including a gorgeous large bathroom with supersonic shower, free standing bath, double sink. Tea and coffee free of charge, delivered within minutes by a smiling member of staff who couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast gets busy so get down as early as you're able. On weekends the hotel opens up its poolside restaurant for brunch also which is a nice alternative. The food itself is of fantastic quality and plentiful - I stuck to muesili and mountains of fruit but the full English option was there too! Perhaps my only issue was the location, at the far end of Orchard Road you're a bit out of the action. But hey, some people like that and taxis are dirt cheap and plentiful in Singapore so this is not a major complaint. Great hotel which made our trip to Singapore a really memorabl experience.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the St. Regis at the end of a 6-week business trip to Asia. I had stayed at many other 5-star hotels in Singapore and wanted to see how the St. Regis stacked up. The hotel has a very lavish style to it. The room was very nice, with extremely comfortable bed and an amazing bathroom. The room was also very large and had plenty of closet space, which was appreciated. I really had no fault with the room at all. The service here was impeccable, as is the standard in Singapore. The person who assisted me with check-in also escorted me to the room, showed me how to work the controls, and then the "butler" stopped by with coffee and to see if I needed anything. Definitely nice touches. Then at the end of my trip, I had a midnight flight back to Europe and stopped by the hotel to pick up my luggage. I was able to take a shower and make use of the spa facilities, which was very nice. Despite the fact that I was not buying any spa services, I was given a warm welcome, helped with my bags, etc. Very good service all around. The only slight downside to the hotel in my opinion is the somewhat out of the way location if commuting to the city center. It's very convenient for shopping and there's lots of good restaurants around, but about a 10-minute walk to the MRT. Maybe I'm a bit strange compared to most St. Regis guests in that I prefer to ride the MRT than take taxis, but the problem is that it's difficult to find taxis at rush hour in Singapore. In fact, one morning there were about 12 people waiting in line for taxis. That said, this is a minor inconvenience compared with all that's in the area. I really enjoyed the hotel and would be pleased to stay here again on a future trip to Singapore. The style is a bit over the top for my tastes, but the great service and extremely comfortable bed balanced it out.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best but you pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service, spa, pool, wine bar, etc The only concern is the price it is expensive, like all 5 star hotels in Singapore, remember it is only Singapore but they all charge so much. Anyway if you have the money stay at the St Regis it is great, the nest in Singapore - I have also tried Hyatt, Hilton, Sheraton, Intercontinental, Conrad, Swissotel, etc

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MikeyR
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Singapore St. Regis hotel, and for sure my last. This hotel is another case where the front desk staff make or break the experience for the guest. In this case, they were some of the worst I’ve seen. The hotel is nicely located at the end of Orchard Rd, easily accessible by taxi, and there are a lot of good restaurants and shopping options within walking distance. Nice lobby, with a coffee shop and a French bistro (more on that later). The rooms are plush, and nicely appointed, but the lighting controls are very difficult to understand and manage, and for some reason they hid the TV remote control in the cabinet under the TV. The experience with the front desk staff went like this, and I felt like I’m on a candid camera show, it was so unreal: Staff member: yes, can I help you (no hello, welcome to the hotel, nothing) Me: Gave my name, reservation number, Platinum SPG card, etc. Staff member: Here’s your key, elevators over there (very curt) Me: Did I get upgraded to a Platinum room? Staff member: No. (silence) Me: Why not? Staff member: We are full, and you didn’t ask for an upgrade Me: I thought this a standard SPG practice. Can I at least use the lounge? Staff member: We don’t have a lounge, this is the St. Regis, not the kind of hotel that would have a lounge, you must be mistaken. Me: I would like to cancel my stay please. Staff member: Sure, but we’ve already charged your card. Good bye Me: Speechless! Anyway, checked in, went down to the French Bistro to eat, the hostess, gave me the menu for the lobby coffee shop, told her I would like a table at the French Bistro, her response was, “I think you will like to Lobby coffee shop more”, I’m in a business suit, and spend 70-80 nights a year in hotels around the world. I was speechless for the second time in the same day. Went back to my room, called the front desk and asked for the duty manager, got voice mail. Tried again for three hours, no response. I gave up! Something is terribly wrong with the service in this hotel, and for $500/night. It just adds insult to injury. Shame on you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Aussie001
Reviews.Content: Love love loved it!! This hotel is located at one end of Orchard Road. We never made it to the other end as there was too much shopping in between... "Ion" is in walking distance and has all you need in the one centre. The butler service, 5.30pm wind and cheese tasting, t.v. in the bathroom, martini's in the bar, buffet breakfast and beautiful decor and just some of my favourite things about this hotel. Great foot refelexology to be had up the road. If going to the casino, you require your passport for entry. We will definitely stay here again. I also recommend a day trip by cable cart to Santosa Island...fantastic fun for all the family and some great scenery on the way across. The only negative to our stay was that my husbands work phone was tapped into....$18,000 worth of charges in just 36 hours!! We are looking into it now so please make sure all of your security tabs are switched on your phone / ipad.

Reviews.Title: “Superb from start to finish!!”
Reviews.Author: jacquie60
Reviews.Content: One word could describe St. Regis Singapore.....Excellent!!!! It certainly deserves its 6 star status. Our room was everything we could have hoped for. The staff were extremley polite, courteous and efficient. The concierge was very helpful and informative. We had dinner in one of the restaurants, Les Saveurs, and it was as good if not better than other Michelin Star restaurants that we have eaten in. The breakfast buffet was second to none...there wasn't one single item that was not on offer and again the staff superb. Our only complaint was that it just wasn't long enough as we were only there 3 nights but we will certainly be back in the future for longer. Jacquie Mason, Portugal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not quite there”
Reviews.Author: ASubscriber
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with an earlier reviewer who said this was more a 4-star. Let me say straight off that I only stayed one night en route, so perhaps didn't get to judge the place fully on its merits. The rooms are furnished to St Regis's usual high standard of quality, comfort and taste. But the place trips up on so many small points which a 5-star shouldn't. - The lighting system is far too complex, which you really don't need when you're stumbling around a strange room at night. The so-called reading light is a direct down-lighter from the ceiling, so you have to read sitting up in bed (many hotels of this standard give you an adjustable lamp). - The TV and sound system didn't quite work together, even after a repairman came round. We never managed to get surround sound for the TV, and there a weird vestigial trailing-off of sound after the TV was switched off. - The water pressure in the shower was poor, a problem I've never encountered elsewhere in Singapore. - When I booked in advance, I was asked to select a type of pillow and any treats I would like in my room. I chose foam pillows - I got down pillows. I requested some local fruit - I got two Granny Smith apples and a Chinese pear (perhaps these really were grown in Singapore). Like the earlier reviewer, I found the staff very willing to help but rather uncertain and in need of more training. A lot of these points may be put down as quibbles but this place sells itself as top-of-the-line 5 star. There's still more work to do, guys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: Smart_Xplorer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. Having stayed earlier at other 5 star properties like Ritz Carlton, Fairmont and Hilton, I would say that this is one is a class apart. Maybe the Ritz Carlton would be the only close competitor because of the excellent views from the rooms and the beautiful lobby. This hotel has a lot of art work in the lobby and is very well maintained. I checked in early morning at about 8 AM. the room was not ready and the front desk manager offered me some beverages while I was waitng. Since I was not hungry, she offered me use of the Internet facilities. I took that up and the room was provided by 830 AM. I had booked a 'Grand Deluxe' room - higher level than an executive deluxe room - which was a corner room with a city view. Well lit with a corner sofa and a 42 inch [probably!] LD. Woodwork was excellent and so was the king size bed. The bathroom was a work of art with a tv, tub, shower area and two sinks. Food was simply great and so was the service. Internet was free [Wifi as well as the computers at the reception]. Only issue I faced was the slow service from the butlers. no complaints though - the hotel was running at full capacity. Also, one suggestion to the hotel - they should provide larger sized drinking water bottles in the room - while the water may be free and one could order more, I would prefer not to wait for the butlers to provide it to me. FYI - Singapore water is safe to be drunk from the tap. Overall, an excellent hotel if you can afford about SGD 500 or more per night. I would like to make a special mention for the entire staff - very helpful, go out of their way - I had the same experience from the front desk to the security to the guys at the main entrance to the waiters etc. Only one issue - it is not close to the MRT, you need to take the cab everywhere. Probably not important since it is not a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best around!”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyTraveler73
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about this place? The hotel occupies a prime location at the top of Orchard Road. Our room was lovely - very spacious, beautifully appointed, large bathroom and butler service available around the clock. Lots of nice touches throughout the room including automatic day/night curtains, the ability to adjust lighting throughout the room and surround sound for the TV. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, without being intrusive. We ate at the French restaurant one evening and thoroughly enjoyed the six-course menu. The breakfast buffet was also excellent. All in all, a fantastic stay --- very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless”
Reviews.Author: BendigoRobin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely 5 star from whoa to go! Service, food, rooms everything. We loved it, loved all the staff we met, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 4 star hotel than a St Regis”
Reviews.Author: fcworld
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in this hotel, and will probably be my last. Anything that can go wrong, went wrong in this Hotel. It started from check in, when you had to stand and wait, and that was at 10PM at night, to the cold coffee served in my room next morning, to the worst breakfast I have had in any hotel in the World, and that is a big statement. The staff seem to lack leadership, and whilst they try hard,they do not deliver the service and standards of a 5 star hotel. This can only be put down as lack of direction and training. I had so many bad experiences in this hotel, that I could write this review for days. The airconditioning did not work correctly, the lights in the bathroom blew up, overcooked croissants,having to line up for breakfast. You have to be a magician to understand the lighting control. All in all a very challenging hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: mnc27
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and my one year old last year for an overnight stay in Singapore. The room was very spacious and the decor was what you would expect from a five star hotel, very classic and elegant, this is what I love most! The bathroom was huge... a separate shower and toilet, a lovely bathtub in the middle with a TV screen on the wall in front of it and two separate wash basins opposite each other... Ow and there's a walk in wardrobe in the bathroom too. The location, I actually prefer to stay near the city hall, but this hotel is very close to Orchard so it's all good. Breakfast was delicious and the staff was courteous and very friendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel, my toddler seemed to enjoy playing in the room, exploring every corner.... but it is very expensive..

Reviews.Title: “I give this hotel six stars! Best place in Singapore - Orchard area”
Reviews.Author: sfhtraveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, room, food, amenities, location. The pool is wonderful!! Negatives: The bed was a bit harder than preferred, at internet is not inclusive in your stay. I would stay here again if I ever return to Singapore. I recommend for those travelling with a baby. Pack and play was set up and ready to go when we arrived per my request. The hotel provided us with a bottle santizer. Room was quiet and spacious and cleaned throughout the day by their staff. Coffee service complimentary was a treat. Sheets were the softest I have ever experienced at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel and an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: milliecharlie
Reviews.Content: This really is an experience, not just a hotel stay. Service is impeccable, the rooms gracious, the spa an absolute dream, great restaurants with impressive wine lists - the whole works. Be prepared to pay for it, but it is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is so accomodating and friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: AlvinTSingapore
Reviews.Content: The stay at St Regis was a birthday gift from my wife which was a great choice. Checked in early at 12pm and to our pleasant surprise, room was ready for our enjoyment. Pretty fast check-in process too. Went up the lift to the room, was greeted by our butler who introduced the room and its amenities to us. All this while, I noticed that all staff from valet service to doorman to front desk and butler had a ready smile. Called for tea to the room via the in-room butler service. Response was friendly and courteous, almost too real for Singapore style. "certainly sir. thank you!" Room was spacious, with DVD player and Bose system. Bathroom was marble top to toe with TV enjoyment and a standalone bathtub, not always seen in most major hotel chains. Toiletries were from the Remede Spa which are excellent. Can't get enough of smelling good that day. There is also a wine tasting session at 5.30 to 6.30 every evening for guests with cheese assortment and grapes to go along with. Definitely a must go! Oh, did I also say that a complimentary birthday cake was given to me that came together with my tea. And my butler even apologized for sending the tea late because she was preparing my cake. Just too courteous. Breakfast was great too as there is none the usual busy breakfast crowd. Service was attentive and definitely an enjoyable one especially on a Sunday morning. Thanks to the St Regis's staff, we enjoyed our stay and will certainly patronage your brand again whether in Singapore or rest of the world. Keep up the high standards!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swissgirl69
