Reviews.Content: After our first stay at the St. Regis in Singapore, we are already planning to stay there again in 2012. We were a bit sceptical about trying out hotels other than the Ritz, Oriental or Raffles, but we were soon to find out that the Regis definitely bears the comparison with them. We were particularly impressed with the hotel’s wonderful décor. Art lovers will feel they’re in a museum. Nothing but (modern) art wherever you look. Even the most sumptuous breakfast buffet couldn’t stop me from gaping. Service, too, is superb. After a long distance-flight we had no difficulties checking in at the arranged time very early in the morning. Try doing that at the Raffles, for example… The rooms were simply wonderful, the location perfect, a stone's throw from busy Orchard Road on the one hand and just a 7-minute walk away from the peaceful Botanic Gardens. All in all, definitely worth going back to!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Finest Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: From the minute that we arrived and were given a very early (7 a.m.) check-in to the time of our guaranteed late check-out, everything was perfect. The large, deluxe executive king room was well-appointed with every imaginable amenity. The poolside, italian restaurant seated us in spite of our being 10 minutes past the 2:15 deadline. The Spa facility was world class and provided me with one of the best massages of my life ( and I have had MANY over the past 50 years around the world). The breakfast room was elegant with an impressive variety of quality options. In sum, a pure delight. Can't wait to return. TuanBesar69

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: joanna345
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, the rooms are lovely and the bathrooms are wonderful. Lovely friendly staff who make you feel special the minute you step out of your taxi. My boyfriend stays here frequently on business, when he occassionaly tries somewhere else, he always comes back to the Regis! I prefer the views from the hotels at the harbour, but this is much better for friendliness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Hans S
Reviews.Content: We spent Chinese new year here and it was great. The service is excellent and the rooms top class.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed at 5* well deserved”
Reviews.Author: unhappypilgrim
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights end of Jan for well earned R&R and wifes birthday,we had read he reviews and definately not dissapointed. This hotel deserves higher than 5* the service is impecable,all staff know the meaning of customer service.We stayed in a deluxe room which was more than adequate bathroom very luxurious, Butler service great but felt a bit guilty ringing for tea/coffee so they kindly provided us with a tea service in the room to make our own which was great.Had room service and we were amazed that this was delivered in a heated trolley and table set up as if you were dining in one of the restaurants.We had breakfast each morning which covered all tastes and everything was fresh and delicious, we had our own personal attendant at breakfast each morning (Susette ) she was just fantastic anticipating my husbands Mocha, and how he had his eggs etc, she was just amazing and all done with a genuine caring smile very rare these days Well done Susette you are an asset to the St Regis.In fact all of the staff at the St Regis were genuinely very helpful and nothing was too much trouble at all even the doormen were great.. It did not matter if you were well off or just average holiday travellers like ourselves you were treated with the exact same respect by all.We arrived home to Far Nth Qld to experience Cyclone Yasi we are all in one piece just a major clean up ahead, hence the delay in writing this review. We are going to save hard to revisit next year just to stay at the St Regis, well done to all the staff, we could all learn at lot from your devoted customer service

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, butler service was professional and attentive!”
Reviews.Author: live÷e
Reviews.Content: Good location, away from the high traffic Orchard Road area. One would feel more tranquil as the hotel has got lush green around. A typical business class hotel located in the city center, and you will not see any backpackers crowd in their lobby either. Hotel offers a world class spa and a lovely outdoor pool. Did not dine in as this city offers huge variety of restaurants options around the city. Rooms are well equipped with state of the art Bose sound/entertainment system, and the usual ipod/itouch connection. Be ready to be pampered by your personal butler!

Reviews.Title: “Great staffs, very nice and large rooms, close to Orchard but far enough to feel quaint”
Reviews.Author: IVsystem
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property in perfect location (just a few minute walk from Orchard but far enough to feel private) Staffs were very accommodating checking us in and out, food (we only ordered room service since we were traveling with a little one) was great, pool and gym was very nice although the pool wasn't heated. We were upgraded to a Corner Lady Astor Room which is larger than their already large grand deluxe and lady Astor rooms. Best part of our room was their bathroom. The tub and their shower room was so nice, I am looking for the same system for my own home as well. Three minute walk to the west is the Tanglin mall which has few local designer kids boutiques and great toy stores (and of course a food court) five minute walk to your east is Orchard. For me, the location was perfect since i like to be very close to main shopping area but still want to feel somewhat secluded.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, large rooms, good facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: MiddleEnglandMan
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations on a three night visit. Upgraded room had double balcony. Good space and quality. TV average, breakfast pricey - best to head out to many cafes locally. Gym excellent but you might not find it straight away - go outside past swimming pool. Otherwise fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at the St. Regis Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave15
Reviews.Content: Returned to Singapore in January 2011 and stayed once again in the St Regis. The hotel continues to be my favorite place to stay in Singapore. As I am a SPG Platinum member you get a number of complimentary amenities such as upgraded rooms, free wi-fi, butler service, free breakfast just to name a few. As always the staff were courteous and service was excellent for the most part. My only complaint on this stay was the close to 20 mins it took them to check me in. I believe they were having some issues opening up a room for me as I was late checking in due to a missed flight in Tokyo. This stay I also spent a little time in the spa using the whirlpools and steam rooms. The spa is spectacular and the service was excellent. The reason I keep coming back to the St Regis is not only the hotel amenities and service I receive but it's location also. As it is close to Orchard Road you have numerous shops and restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. As I person who travels extensively I would strongly recommend the St Regis Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Intimate, attentive and slick”
Reviews.Author: Justbobhrh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on my way through to Beijing from Perth. My wife can with me for some R&R. A fabulous location right at the top of Orchard Road. The hotel is beautiful, small and intimate (not like Westins which are huge and somewhat business focussed). I dont think I could have chosen a better place to stay with my wife. We were upgraded to a corner, Lady Astor suite. The service is very St Regis - quiet, unobtrusive and at most times seamless. The butler service was fantastic - my wife's pet hate is no tea making facilities in the room - here you can call the Butler 24/7 for tea; with a selection of about 1- different teas to chose from. I wouldn't bring my younger kids to this hotel, only because it is small and intimate and I would be concerned about them upsetting the ambience for other guests...in fact I think I only saw 1 or 2 young kids while there...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Elegance and Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: SuzSydney41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 3 nights on a Singapore stopover. I just loved this hotel - especially the complimentary butler service that came with our Deluxe Room. Being able to call someone 24 hours a day and get your ironing turned around pronto or a cup of tea - at no extra charge - made me feel like a princess. Its nice that the tea they serve is a premuim Singaporean brand and that the cups and silver they serve it on are of a similar standard. St Regis do work hard on the little stuff - there's even a chair in the lift! And whatever pillow you like - believe me they have it covered - there are 15 to choose from! The hotel is well positioned around the corner from Orchard Road shopping and down the road from the Botanical Gardens. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with OK service”
Reviews.Author: DeltaAT
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at St. Regis for conference and business meeting. Room was spacious, even though it was a bit dark for me. Bathroom was very nice. Too bad that I had problem to connect to the internet. The staffs were very helpful but I still couldn't get connection that night. I was expected flawless quality at St. Regis, but I guess bad luck could happen sometimes. Overall I was pretty satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “St.Regis is not just a 5 Star Hotel, it's a cult”
Reviews.Author: rajatgarg
Reviews.Content: Was here for the Christmas. Had a great time. Its not a very big hotel. Heard a lot about it, it stood to its name. Hotels like these redefine - 5 star benchmarks. I mean its not all that glitzy or grand but still its the St.Regis. Wine tastings, French dining ,Tea dances & Bentley rides. Elitest of the elite flock here. Its like a religion, high in style & service. Been to so many luxury hotels in my life, St.Regis felt different. More private, more like an Elite club. Nothing about it that makes you go awe, niether anything you can fault. Clean & Well maintained. Requests are seldom turned down and service is A+. You have to be here to experience it. Technologically advanced. Remede toiletries & Mirror image TV facing the bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: styleandfashion888
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - if you are thinking of booking it - don't hesitate! We are seasoned luxury travellers and this hotel has impressed us. It is brand new and impeccable inside. Luxuriously appointed rooms with every amenity you can think of. we stayed on level 18 in a room with excellent view. Were greeted with a box of beautiful hand made chocolates in the room. Free butler service is excellent - free ironing, tea / coffee service, packing / unpacking, etc. Hotel has an atmosphere of elegance and luxury from the minute you enter the lobby. Service - fantastic, very polite, polished and considerate. The only thing is the pool area is quite small and has only a few sun lounges. Hotel clearly caters to the business travellers more than to families. Location - excellent for shopping, right in the beginning of Orchard Rd shops. Food - breakfast was excellent. We also had dinner in a fine dining Chinese restaurant and enjoyed it a lot too. Overall - we will definitely return; it's one of our favourites in Asia now.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNMY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2nd time, below are the summary: 1. Attentive staff to attend your requests. 2. Excellent butler 3. Bigger than average S'pore hotel. 4. The only negative aspect is that my kids request to extend our stay:-)

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel, amazing service, great location”
Reviews.Author: jaftravelers
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at a St. Regis before...everything that we have heard and expected was exceeded! The Location - the hotel is situated a block away from Orchard Road. This puts you in the middle of the famous upscale shopping district and also a 10 minute walk to the MRT station which can take you anywhere on the island. This is a very nice area with plenty of posh dining and shopping options as well as hawker stalls for those who want to get a more "authentic" experience. The Room - we broke up our trip in southeast asia and ended up with two seperate stays at the St. Regis. The first was in a Grand Deluxe room which was spectacular. The second was in an Executive Deluxe room which was also great, but a little smaller. Both had great bathrooms with seperate shower and soaking tubs. The bathroom also has a television, so you can keep watching while you soak in the tub. The other great amenity was the power outlets are universal and can accomodate any type of power input. Either room would be great for a couple. The Service - As advertized, the St. Regis service is over-the-top great. Not only does the staff take care of any request and the butler service is there 24/7 if you need anything, but they are very friendly - something that we found you don't always get at other places. The Extras - Wine tasting, drinks & canapes, breakfast, and spa access were our favorites. Every morning the staff puts out a huge buffet-style breakfast with a mix of both western and asian foods. There is a chef there to prepare eggs or waffles and almost anything you could imagine or desire is available. It is a great way to start the day. After a long day of exploring we would come back to the hotel in time for the 5:30 wine tasting. The hotel has an amazing wine-cellar and tasting room and the somilier serves up some of his favorites each day. With finger foods and wine insights, it is a great way to start the evening. After that we liked to head over to La Brezza (one of the hotel restaraunts) for a complimentary drinks and canapes. The hotel offers any drink on the menu and the chef prepares a different light-snack each day. It is the perfect, relaxing way to start off the evening. The last point to note is the hotel spa - it is a beautiful facility with both free access to the wet lounge and pay-for services (as desired). We didn't get massages here, but did find the wet lounge a great way to relax after a long day of walking the city. The only "negative" comment about the hotel is that because of its popularity and status there were a lot of private events taking place in the hotel lobby and bar (wedding receptions, christmas parties, etc.). It doesn't keep you awake at night or disrupt services, but it was a little awkward at times to try and squeeze through the lobby in the middle of an elegant event. I should note that I am a platinum spg member, so some of the free-amenitities might have been a result of this.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: nemo78
Reviews.Content: Simply Superb! It was great returning to this hotel after a year and getting pampered in every way.... The rooms, food, facilities, butler, concierge, spa, location - all just spoil you so much!!! Worth a Stay evrytime in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Ok without "WOW" factor”
Reviews.Author: BMWBMW
Reviews.Content: Room was quiet if you happened to have courtesy neighbours. Two of the 4 nights, we had noisy neighbours with kids. The room had jointing room door which the noise transmitted easliy. Why a fancy "5 star" hotel designed rooms with jointing door?? We were not assigned a king bed room as originally reserved. We were given 2 beds. We asked for a room away from the "lift" and was assigned one adjacent to the lift. That took 45 minutes to change. Paid $ 250 dinner at the Chinese Restaurant. One special rib dish was no rib as it was just deep fried fat. I did not expect that a "fancy" restaurant would use fat as rib, to which one would expect from a hawker stand. It ought to care about the guests' health. We had high expectation of St Regis Singapore, so we were disappointed. Not likely stay again--as we had better experience previously at another 5 star Singapore hotel that had great service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: xbartolo
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing hotel that makes you feel like you are the king of the world. Something to try at least once in the life time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dejava
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1night and found this is a good hotel for money value. I will not spend a huge amount money to choose this for my holiday but this is the best which my company supported me. Enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but could do better”
Reviews.Author: BajanDreamer
Reviews.Content: Didn't get off to a very good start. Had booked a limo from the airport and confirmed it again by email before I arrived but that wasn't waiting for us so we had to get a taxi from the airport. Seemed to be some confusion when we checked in so instead of a queensize bed we were given a room with two single beds. Once in the room we were interupted about 30 minutes later when someone else let themselves into our room. They checked in some other guests to our room about 20 minutes after our check in. Management were very aplogetic but it did rather spoil the day. Why do they feel the need to ring every 5 minutes and knock on the door to see if they could do anything for us? We just wanted to be left in peace after an 11 hour flight. Very nice hotel, but the attention to detail is lacking a bit. Restaurant only seemed to be offering us a thanksgiving dinner. It was only later that we think we saw an a la carte menu. Who wants turkey at this time of year? Seem to think that everyone is from the USA. I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stand-out 5-star luxury”
Reviews.Author: Forsterfan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent stand-out five star hotel. My husband and I did some considerable research looking for luxury accommodation for our honeymoon. We deliberately sought out hotels that didn't offer run-of-the-mill rooms or restaurants. It met every expectation in this regard. The entire hotel from the lobby to the rooms and public access bathrooms are glamorous, clean and show no signs of wear and tear. Our compliments go to whoever did the decorating. It's such a gorgeous mix of eastern, french and english influences. Our comments include: • Rooms - spacious, glamourous and with so much attention to detail • Breakfasts - superb! A fantastic selection of hot and cold and in a very pretty restaurant • Staff - all round great. We found them to be very friendly with excellent english. In particular the doormen and the concierge went above and beyond for us • Location - excellent. The hotel is literally located around the corner from the top of Orchard The only small complaint I have is the room service I ordered late one night. It was an in-house burger and it was probably the worst I have had. It was tasteless (it seemed like just meat with no seasoning) and very little salad which was presented on the side - quite odd. But this is such a minor issue. All up, highly recommended and will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Pampering and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: gunjan67
Reviews.Content: The St.Regis is located fantastically close to Orchard Road and offers the ultimate standards of luxury and pampering. From the private terminal Bentley pickup through their Jet Quay service to a butler always on call, they don't leave any stone unturned to make guests feel special and always taken care of. The concierge can arrange almost everything from restaurant reservations to shopping pickup and alterations! The spa @ the St.Regis is one of the best I've ever been to and offers the Bliss Product line. The rooms are beautifully designed with great size bathrooms for a city hotel. The butler can take care of almost all your needs and room service will even whip up your off the menu requests. Overall, a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: adventureofalifetime
Reviews.Content: I arrived Friday evening from the airport late for a charity event,, taking place in the hotel. Upon arrival, I was shown to my room, butler promptly arrived, pressed shirt required for the event, food/drinks/service at the event excellent, drinks/service in the Ascot fabulous, butler and room service (food as well as service) heavenly. Perfect

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ria12
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with a super luxurious feel about it. The rooms are great, very big and spacious, befitting that of a palace. The room had a very very large LCD fitted with Bose sound system which was mind-blowing. They gave me a personal butler who would iron clothes in a jiffy (that too for free ! ) easily the second best hotel I have ever stayed in. I was pleasantly surprised by this one. Hadnt heard the name before, but now am glad I went and stayed there. Central location too, just off Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a good one after 3 stays”
Reviews.Author: tickerup
Reviews.Content: After 2 disastrous stays ,1st stay in a Deluxe Grande and 2nd in Metropolitan Ste (aka Murphy's Law Lab), the recent third stay in their lowest category room surprisingly turned out good. The check-in and check-out were smooth, unlike my first 2 stays. Butlers were proper and kind, unlike the Met Suite butler previously. The room was clean and well maintain, big contrast from the Met Suite i've gotten previously. Staff are nicer now, as they no longer complains about some other guest among themselves when i share the lift with them. Didn't try the restaurants, didn't get good experience previously, so wouldn't take the risk and ruined the stay. When to 2 nearby restaurants, California Pizza (nice) and Tony Romas (very nice), for dinner at a reasonable price of about $200 for two pax. At Decanter, its a different sommelier from my previous two stays, but they all had the same standard of eye-ball you and ignore you. Nothing new, didn't hurt my stay. Enjoy the wet spa sooo much that i used twice. Lastly the filipino tech guy who came to my room and strangely told me that none of the extended video input ports were meant to be connected and display video on TV. He said i can only pipe in music and not video. If so, strangely why are there various type of video input socket on the panel? Please train the tech guy. Overall enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 Star but at least they are trying!”
Reviews.Author: lovinitsolo
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at the St. Regis and while the hotel & it's facilities are 5 star the staff is not quite up to 5 star caliber. What is truly lacking by the staff is an attention to detail that you would find at, for example, a Taj Palace property. (e.g. the proper glasses not being in the minibar, 3 conditioners 2 shampoos & 1 body wash...I can only condition my hair some many times.....not replacing bath robes, etc.) While the staff are making an effort, and I'm sure management will have them up to speed soon, my stay was not a true 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Singapore was impressive from the beginning. The lobby features original works of art by renowned artists serve to raise your expectations of the rooms. Thankfully the rooms are spacious and they've reached a good balance of luxury and modern design elements. The butler met us as we were shown up to our room and gave us a quick tour of the room automation features and offered some welcome tea. The service level was outstanding and discrete throughout our three day stay.

Reviews.Title: “The number one hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: The number one hotel in Singapore The St. Regis Singapore stands out as unique in Singapore for me due to the, no expense spared - big and subtle touches, revealing customed attention to every detail, reflecting a true example of elegance and refinement. The St. Regis Hotel Singapore offers a traditional, very high quality modern fine expression of comfort with the very best at your service team. From a relaxed sit down high speed check in and escort to your room, introduction to your floor's personal butler and ultimate room service. The modern traditional decorated room features king-sized bed's with luxurious linens, hand-painted silk wallpaper, inviting window seats upholstered with rich designer fabrics. Regal writing desk with easy access to the Internet and WiFi. A very grand French marble bathroom featuring a free-standing bathtub with mirror mounted T.V and waterproof T.V remote control, separate jet massage shower. Found in a prime location of Singapore’s prestigious downtown and embassy districts, The St. Regis Singapore is close to Singapore's best in dining, entertainment, culture and shopping being just walking distance from the Orchard Road, hosting everything from upscale luxury brands to vintage local knick-knacks. The only Hotel I use in Singapore now and I highly recommend for a perfect stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “This is class, luxury, and comfort at its best”
Reviews.Author: sr888
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights for the first time at this hotel and after having stayed at the top hotels throughout Asia many times (Peninsulas, Mandarins, Ritz Carltons), the St. Regis rivals the best of them with the ultimate in class luxury and comfort. The staff from check in to check out went out of their way to please, yet they were not at all intrusive. The room was very large, very clean, and had just the right comforts from the bed to the well laid out desk area - loved the soaking tub - TV and Bose audio system were a very nice touch. Breakfast in the lobby was excellent and afternoon choices were great as well. Inviting pool and spa were very relaxing. The hotel was very busy but it never felt crowded at at all. Housekeeping was invisible and top notch. Butler service a great benefit. The location couldn't be better with Orchard Road around the corner having every shop or restaurant you could need. Wish my stay was longer and for sure intend to return. Well done St. Regis

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover”
Reviews.Author: katyjoyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Having 3 days stopover in St Regis, Singapore after flying 13 hours from Europe was absolutely perfect in every way. The service is the best, the staff very friendly, professional and so helpful with anything. The rooms and bathrooms are a dream and having a butler service for 24hr coffee, tea, cookies is a real treat. We walked the 5mins to Orchard Road shops in the mornings and the afternoons lay by the pool. At 5.30pm they have a wonderful wine tasting that you shouldnt miss. We have stayed in many of the great Hotels in Singapore over the years but St Regis is our top pick. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “What a place... No! Palace!”
Reviews.Author: Adi-C-B
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel! Great facilities and excellent restaurants! The poolside was exceptional, and they have dotted the place with some very funky modern art! The hotel isn't exactly in the midst of the shopping but a 10 minute walk from Orchard St and Ion mall. The rates are a bit high... But Oh-So-Worth it!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone with a a passion for the finer things!

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here have the butler draw you a bath!”
Reviews.Author: KEDBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and with our room (maybe all) we got "our butler" who would bring us tea, get clothes pressed or even draw a bath which is a lovely indulgence! We stayed here on Starwood points and were given a lovely room and wonderful treatment . We splurged on their Bentley pick up at the airport and it was well worth it. The food here is quite expensive so, other than one breakfast, we ate elsewhere but it's convenient to many places you can easily walk to. Although it's unobtrusive it felt as if they took security very seriously which was a good feeling. Oddly the house cleaning could have been better - leave clean glasses, replace robes and things of that nature.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel That Needs to Pay Closer Attention to the Basics.”
Reviews.Author: kartwoman
Reviews.Content: When reading other TA complaints about this hotel, I rolled my eyes, thinking "Come on. It sounds amazing. Why are people whining about service and details like housekeeping, food, etc." I get it now. I pulled my old review and re-submitted this one after management (Mr. Teo and the kind bellmen/driver, specifically) acknowledged and tried to make amends for the inexcusable troubles we confronted across the board, from our arrival in a taxi, the worst reception experience I've had in 40+ years of traveling, woefully undertrained staff and cleanliness issues at the Italian restaurant, housekeeping issues, subpar food (aside from breakfast, which I actually enjoyed contrary to other reviewers), and slllloooooowww butler service. The hotel is lovely (though not my personal taste) and has a nice location just off Orchard. I wanted to love it. But I do hope management takes the nuts and bolts feedback seriously. This wasn't garden-variety complaining - it was a well-traveled guest lending serious feedback on the most basic aspects of hotel service. With so many other fabulous hotels to choose from in Singapore, and with the St. Regis holding itself out as something above and beyond, they really need to step it up. Because what I saw on this combination business/leisure trip was a whole lot of bling -- and precious little substance -- until it was simply too late to salvage. I don't really need the over-the-top pillow menu. I just want sterling, efficient, and warm service.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointing stay - nothing compared to St Regis Bali”
Reviews.Author: KettleFam
Reviews.Content: After staying at St Regis in Bali we booked St Regis Singapore for 2 nights, looked great on the internet and location was what we wanted...but what a surprise? Starting from us calling ahead and ending up with a clueless operator and finding a wrong booking upon arrival should have promted us to leave rigth away. Rooms were really good and yes it does have the St Regis feel which is gone the minute you talk to anyone - sleepy bellservice, butlers were somewhere but not anywhere where we could find them and the GM's Assistant didnt even call us back when we ask her to connect us with her boss. Anyway, long story short - will be back to any St Regis but this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staycation”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: Picked this for a luxurious weekend stayacation with a close girl friend – to relax and chill out despite not getting out of the country. The difference hits you when you enter the lobby via the main entrance, greeted by a few chorus of ‘good afternoon’s. The check-in counters are not typical – it’s a few sit down counters for one-to-one service instead of standing front desks. Check in was quick and efficient; we were also escorted to the lift which I felt was a nice touch. I appreciated the complimentary upgrade to a Lady Astor room too. The distinction with St Regis is its butler service. Coffee and tea are ordered with the butler and they bring it to your room. There are almost 10 choices of tea, along with coffee, cappuccino, hot chocolate, as well as an extensive pillow menu to pick from, although the bed itself comes with plenty of them already. The Lady Astor room itself is big – 56sqm: 2 oversized single beds, a huge bathroom with a bathtub, 2 separate sinks, a makeup table, a shower, and a toilet. Plus a C-shaped couch and a coffee table. Cleanliness is excellent; nothing to fault. Some of the spa facilities are complimentary for in-house guests: steam chambers, Jacuzzi, hydro massage pool, and sauna (non in-house guests have to pay SGD85 to use them) – they were all quite good. The variety at breakfast was not as extensive as I thought, and quality honestly was just average for me. There’s also a complimentary daily wine appreciation for all in-house guests from 5:30pm – 6:30pm at the Decanter on level 1, which was a unique touch. There was indeed a difference throughout my stay because its St Regis – there were more smiley faces and plenty of good mornings and afternoons. We felt more looked after and very welcomed anywhere in the hotel. But as with all things, there are things to be improved: 1. Butler service – when we checked in, we were told that the butler will be at the room soon, so we waited. After half an hour, we called and the operator sounded a bit confused and asked what we need the butler for. We were in fact waiting for the butler to start our stay by telling us what his / her services are! The butler services was listed in a book set on the table, but I thought what they should have done is to get the butler to inform the guests what is available upon check in; otherwise the people who missed the book will not know that there is complimentary pressing of items upon arrival etc. There were also 2 occasions where 2 different butlers came into the room without pressing the doorbell – they probably used the master key and entered while we were still in the room. It is unacceptable, especially so for St Regis – it is only basic courtesy to ring the doorbell when entering an occupied room. Admittedly they were delivering tea etc on the 2 occassions but if their hands were fully occupied, what they should have done is to place the tray on the floor to free their hands for pressing the doorbell. It would have been a disaster if we were in the middle of changing our clothes or worse, a couple engaging in some acts of affection. 2. Turn down service – the 1st night I was there, a lady rang my doorbell and tried to explain in English what she was there for - the turn down service. But she couldn’t, and eventually had to explain in Mandarin instead which I understood. But I thought the staff should be trained to at least be able to inform in English the purpose of them appearing at the door – what happened if it was a hotel guest who could not understand Mandarin (and given the clientele of the hotel; very likely). The turn down service also included a bar of chocolates – nice touch. 3. Breakfast – during one of my 2 breakfasts, I encountered a very strange aftertaste in my orange juice – suspiciously like soap. I alerted one of the staff who nodded her head and took it back into the kitchen, but the issue was never addressed thereafter. 4. Spa garden – The spa garden is a outdoor Jacuzzi in the spa which I tried for both days – but on the 2nd day, the water looked obviously more murky than previously, which made me wonder if the water needs to be changed / cleaned more frequently. Outside of the above issues, my staycation was excellent. I’ll be back if I have the budget again of course.

Reviews.Title: “Breath-taking! 6 stars service with a heart!”
Reviews.Author: Viah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at one of the suite during the world cup season and the personal butler was simply amazing.. jus ring and all your requests will be answered ;) The rooms are a fantastic size and the bathroom was wonderful.. definitely set the standard for other 6 stars out there..You can definitely trust a St Regis~

Reviews.Title: “A Cut Above!”
Reviews.Author: Lains23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, in many countries, particularly for work and very few have compelled me to write a TA review! (Even the ones in Singapore which are generally excellent.) I stayed at the St Regis Singapore for a week at the end of August. I was impressed from the minute I walked in to the minute I left. Their service was amazing. I also had customers I was hosting throughout the week which stayed and also commented how great the hotel was. When I arrived on a late flight I was checked in and then shown around my room. Whilst I thought at the time it wasn't necessary, I soon realised I would not have worked out how to work all the hidden features in the room. (Bose sound system, TV in the bathroom, multi adaptors etc etc) Breakfast was pretty good (for Asian Western breakfast), had a good variety. Like some others have mentioned, they remembered which juice I like and how I like my coffee and they greeted me each morning. The rooms were fantastic and very comfortable. I was most impressed by the butler leaving me a personal note when I went out to dinner one night, to see if I would like a cup of tea when I came home. Then another night I had rung up to check how to use the internet, but I had gone out before I used it. I came back to a handwritten note of instructions placed on my PC to show me how to connect. Some might argue this was intrusive but they were always discreet and always surprised me with the service level. Another example is that you get 3 items ironed for free when you check in. But I rang to get an iron to press some other clothes (late at night). They didnt have one available as it was late but they came straight away and collected the ironing and offered to do it for me. They even asked which piece I wanted to wear the next day and what time I needed it to get dressed. (by 7am and I asked at 11:30pm) Wow. Oh and the gym was quite good also, not huge but adequate. Nice cool aircon and lots of cold bottled water. The only time I had trouble was when checking out. I had 6 accounts to pay and it was a little time consuming to sort it out but that is to be expected with so many bills. And I didn't get my Starpoints but one phone call and it was corrected immediately. Overall, I was so very impressed with the hotel and will stay there again whenever I can...AND I will tell people about it!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb in every way - cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Our first experience of a St Regis Hotel and wow did they deliver. We spent two nights here on our way home to Australia after being overseas for almost nine weeks. We had booked a Lady Astore Suite and alerted the hotel that our flight got in from LA at approximatley 5.45am. Whilst we did not expect to have our room ready we certainly did not expect the service we received. We actually arrived earlier at 5.30am and our bags were brought in and we where checked in by Mr Timmy Tao (Assistant Manager) who advised that as our suite was not ready the hotel had put a smaller room aside for us to use that morning to have a sleep and freshen up in and when we had woken up they would transfer our bags to our suite later in the day. We had also asked if possible for a late check out ont he day we were to depart as our flight did not depart until 9.00 pm. This was also accomodated and in fact when we got back into the room that afternoon to shower and change before leaving for the airport, housekeeping had been in and done the room, even thought we were checking out (we had had late checkouts in other hotels before, mostly Sofitels but in all cases Housekeeping had not done the room - another luxury touch - but to be honest I had had a bet with my husband that the service at the hotel was so exceptional that I would not have been suprised to find that housekeeping would have been in). But back to our check in. Mr Tao personally escorted us up to a lovely room and showed us all features (this room was impressive in itself and we thought wow if this is what we get for a smaller room just to use for a few hours - the suite must be very impressive. Within half an hour of arriving at the hotel we had checked in and were in bed. A few hours later our wake up call came quickly followed by tea and newspapers served by the Butler. We then showered and changed and headed out to Singapore refreshed and recharged by a few additional hours sleep. This was wonderful. Upon arriving back at the hotel at 5.00pm that afternoon we collected the keys to our Suite and found our bags had been moved and we settled in. The Suite was a corner suite and had its separate entry, separate lounge, large plasma TV, separate bathroom and toilet, with sliding doors into the entry and then into the main bathroo and then out the other side into the large walk in robe and then another lsiding door inthe the large main bedroom, with another large plasma screen. The bathroom was incredible, huge free standing tub with a small plasma screen at the end, a massive shower that was warm when you entered (full size heated mirror on one of the walls in the shower), Double sinks and huge fluffy towels, robes, slippers and wonderful bath products. Yes the light switches and blind switches were a little confusing and hard to operate as other trip advisers have started and by the time we were ready to leave we had figured them out. The butler service was a little slow, again commented on by other reviewers but I think there was only one per floor so we were not overly concerned. Free water and chocolates at turndown, free tea and coffee from the Butler service 24/7, free newspapers to your room and a lovely little tray of fresh fruit each day delivered to your room. All lovely touches. A special highlight was the wonderful Concerge Eric - We had been told how good he was by a business associate and they were right. We introduced ourselves with a note from our business associate who stays at the hotel frequently and nothing was an issue for him, He gave us some valuable tips for restaurants and lots of other dos and donts, he was also honest with us when we asked about certain things we had been told were worth doing, based on what we told him our style and preferences were he made alternative suggestions to things he felt were probalby more suited to our lifestyle. Also would like to compliment the staff each morning at Breakfast (which was included in our suite rate). Leila in particulary, the second morning at breakfast she greeted us by name and then asked if we wanted our juices (remembered that I liked half orange and half grapefruit) and also remembered that we liked our coffee and tea at the end of the meal not at the start without being reminded. She also remembered that I liked hot milk in a jug beside my coffee. Also asked me if I wanted Eggs Benedict again - This was very impressive for her to remember this and certainly made us feel very special. The food was well presented and the buffet selection more than satisfactory then you could have our eggs etc cooked to order. We also ate in the main restaurant one night, expensive ($31.00Singapore for the lobster bisque - but well worth it). The restaurant has a wonderful feel and is very impressive in its decor. The night we ate we were seated at a table two over from a family of four or five with three small children, we asked if we could move and it was no bother. Shortly after this the children at the table were quite noisy and in fact it was not pleasant, when one of them threw a major tantrum and ran through the restaurant. The staff came over to apologise and advised they would be moving the other guests down to the other end of the restaurant which was far removed from all the other guests. This was greatly appreciated as when you are eating in a fine dining restaurant at high prices the last thing you really want is other peoples badly behaved children spoiling your meal and its rare that a restaurant actually cares if other guests children are behaving badly. The staff overall are exceptional, prime example was we were in the business centre one day and June assisted us with the computer, for less then five minutes. The next day she was in the elevator with us and said "Good Morning Mr & Mrs Dobson" - amazing memory. Overall this was a wonderful hotel and an excellent introduction to Singapore, we are already planning to head back to Singapore for a long weekend to enjoy the hotel and shopping again. A nice touch upon check out was that there was a message from Mr Tao wishing us a safe trip home (he was not working that day), also Eric and one of the other staff members coming out to the front door and waving us off. This hotel is certainly now a favourite with us and based on this experience we will be keen to try other St Regis hotels throughout the world. In fact joined their loyalty club before we left. Just wished we could have stayed longer and enjoyed the other restaurants, the high tea and the swimming pool area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels and staff in the world!”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: You will be very hard pressed to find a hotel and staff of this calibre anywhere in the world. It really is up there with some of the best hotels in the world. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel; from the beautiful rooms to the level of service that the staff provide, it is just awesome. It really made my trip. The location is just around the corner from the main street which is packed full of high end shops and malls. Room service is also top notch with the food quality. There is a really good pool outside with a bar area.

Reviews.Title: “A true six star hotel”
Reviews.Author: awaxie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon off at this amazing hotel. We were greeted in our grand deluxe room with a cake for our honeymoon. Our butler then arrived to help us plan our itinerary. The service is impeccable. There are greeters everywhere who are friendly and helpful. This is the best hotel in singapore. The decor is gorgeous, the rooms are spacious and clean, and the spa is beautiful, modern and elegant. The spa treatments were excellent. This hotel truly caters to each and every request of the guest. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is perfect, next to orchard road shopping and near all great restaurants. The hotel rates were very fair, actually lower than other competitors such as four seasons, ritz Carlton, and mandarin oriental. This hotel is six star for sure and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluidroom2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for half a month, amazed by the service, having a private butler in the room was an experience as well. The mini-bar is as, well stocked as the bed and bathroom amenities with branded toiletries. The room and bathroom is elegant with a french design. Gorgeous tub fronting a mirror TV. It is Really a First class experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Great Hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Explorer17
Reviews.Content: Classy with very helpful staff. I arrived early and they offered me a seat in the breakfast room with internet and a lovely coffee, but check in was a piece of cake and check out just as easy. Nice rooms, but a bit of an odd layout...with the elevators in the middle and gangplank walk ways to the rooms. The breakfast rooms were really cold (too much A/C). The guest rooms were well appointed with good in-room internet, a nice "spa" feel and upper level rooms have a great view of the city and parks surrounding Tanglin Rd and Orchard Rd. Again, the A/C was hard to regulate and the beds were a bit hard. With some down time, I asked the concierge for ideas for tours and they came up with several options so I could choose what to do and how to best use my time. Everyone was very helpful. I fell sick (briefly) while I was there and the staff was helpful, discreet, sympathetic and efficient. It is a bit of a walk to the main shopping area of Orchard Rd which was fine for me - I like to walk and the taxi services were easy. But the St. Regis is some distance from cultural/sightseeing so you have to pay and plan ahead if you want to do more than shopping. Overall it felt like the lap of luxury, largely thanks to the remarkable staff.

Reviews.Title: “The creme de la creme”
Reviews.Author: SeanBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Singapore is the creme de la creme of classic hotel luxury. It made my recent business trip to Singapore a uniquely memorable travel and hospitality experience. The opulence, service, location and overall style of the hotel are impeccable. No expense has been spared on any of the details - it is a triumph of both style and substance. During my brief stay I was treated with an in-room white leaf tea service on arrival (inc. complementary suit press and shoe shine), I lounged on the resort-class open air pool deck, marvelled at the in-room luxuries and ate and drank like a king. The central location is also within easy taxi reach of the fabulously atmospheric Dempsey restaurant and bar precinct in a lush jungle setting. The St Regis magically turned what started as a mere business trip into a wonderful experience of luxury pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: fcukvrmum
Reviews.Content: my father is a spg member. So then my father decided to use the spg program. The hotel is good i even want to live in it. The pool attendant is very nice, the food also in ird is the best. But the thing that i hate the most is when a room attendant clean our room, his name is jonathan. When he left our room. The room is still dusty, he forgot to place an extra toilet roll instead he left a foul foot smell in our room!

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis Singapore - fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: essexnyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night during a trip through Southeast Asia, and the St. Regis was fantastic! We thought that the property itself is beautiful and very well cared-for. The staff and services of the hotel are what really made it a standout for us: • Concierge: Ian Tan and his team were excellent. We only had one day in Singapore and had to squeeze in sightseeing, shopping and the great food - Ian's guidance was thoughtful and invaluable - he really helped us make the most of our time in Singapore. The hotel's Bentley drivers provided the highlight of our trip to Singapore - they were helpful, efficient and very informative as we tried to soak up the city in 24 hours. • Rooms: the room design and décor is wonderful - I loved the high-tech controls for the drapes and lighting! Our butler was very caring and helpful. • Overall: Wherever we went on the property, the staff were friendly, professional and efficient. This is a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A first rate international hotel - comparable to the very best.”
Reviews.Author: aversetospam
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: A first rate international hotel on a par with the Grand Hotel Stockholm, the Imperial in Tokyo, the Four Seasons Ritz in Lisbon. Better than the Sheraton Kuwait City, JW Marriott in Washington and JW Marriott in Bangkok. Location: Off Orchard Road near the Tanglin shopping center. You will end up using taxis to get around since the property is not convenient to a subway station. While next to the Mall, it is not located in the heart of the shopping and tourist districts. Accommodations: Large well furnished room with all of the accoutrements, including very comfortable king sized beds, chairs and sofa, desk, and multiple large flat screen televisions. Large bathrooms with marble double sinks, luxurious bathtub, separate shower, first rate toiletries, soft robes. Services: Superb, including the butler on the floor, a knowledgeable concierge, the efficient and courteous front desk staff, and the dining room staff for breakfast. The staff was trained to sense the guest’s preferred level of service and friendliness and adjust accordingly, with formality for Japanese and German guests, greater warmth for more casual American guests and for families with children. Hints: Internet fees were, as expected, rather high. Free computers are available in the business center located behind the check in desks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb service.”
Reviews.Author: fosky99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis Singapore for two nights in August. It was our third stay at the hotel in 12 months, and each visit exceeds our expectations. We had an Exeuctive Suite which was spacious, well appointed and spotless. The butler service and housekeeping was excellent as usual. We had the St Regis Bentley transfer service including JetQuay which was excellent and remarkably effiicient after a long flight. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by Mr Teo the assistant manager who personally escorted us to our room. The pool and spa are very comfortable and the best of all the luxury hotels in Singapore that we have stayed at. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for both a business or leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “stylish luxury - and close to the shopping!”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: The St Regis must be the best of the 'chain' city hotels in SIngapore. It is stylish throughout, the bathrooms are awesome and there is a wine-tasting session included in the room rate. The real highlight for me though was the steam room in the day spa - beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “.Excellent location and very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July.After reading mixed reviews I was a bit concerned as we prefer 5 star qualities when we travel...This hotel met every criterea of a five star hotel.Gorgeous hotel very well located,beautifully appointed rooms and exceptional concierge service.I highly recommend this hotel for an excepional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Celticjo58
Reviews.Content: As an SPG member I choose the St Regis as I generally use the SPG group. I want to be fair in my review so will firstly mention the good points. The rooms are well furnished and very comfortable. The staff are very friendly. The spa is really nice. Although the pool is a little small it is very nice. The bad points : Charging $20 per day for a very slow and unreliable internet service is unacceptable. Quality of food at breakfast for room service was poor. Dried out eggs and mass purchased potato fritters in a five star hotel ? Upon complaining about a broken light it was immediately repaired, to break again a few hours later. Bar service was slow and I even left the bar because I could not get served. My biggest issue however was the management when I made my complaints. They seem to think that walking up to a guest and introducing themselves by first name and without mentioning their title or function is an acceptable manner of behaviour. Not as far as I am concerned. Overall I left the hotel unhappy and disappointed. I will certainly not use the St Regis again and would certainly not reccomend it to anyone who expects the 5 star level of service.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: aomori
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my parents and brother to Singapore in July, and this is our first time staying at the St. Regis Singapore. The hotel is just gorgeous, and the butler was so helpful and professional who helped us to arrange the tickets to the Universal Studio Singapore in advance. The butler also arranged the in room tea/coffee by request, and we just felt like home. The room size is big, as it's over 50sq m. The location is very convenient, it just took us around 15min to walk to the Isetan Dept Store at Orchard Rd. We enjoyed our stay at St Regis very much.... will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgold105
Reviews.Content: The rooms are excellent and the position OK depending what you want to be near. A short walk to Orchard Rd but in the heat and with young kids not as central as other hotels. Services is excellent. We found it more a business hotel and with 4 young children we felt it a little sterile and like we were out of place. Staff giving the kids not nice looks etc. should they invade on the business like environment. We checked in at 5:30pm and our rooms were not ready. this is a BIG negative when coming off an 8 hour flight with four young children. Also the breakfast is quite lacking. Otherwise we enjoyed the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: beauchamptraveller
Reviews.Content: Quiet, luxurious, and the staff treat you very nicely. The restaurants are worthwhile too, in particular the Italian on the pool and spa level, and the Chinese (try the lobster fried rice - yum). The bar inside the main entrance was perfect to come back to after a day in the heat, and my husband was able to conduct some meetings there. The decor is more Asian opulent rather than chic-but-indistinguishable-international-moneyed-modern. Location perfect. However, must gently disagree with previous poster - the MRT is not a mere 3 minutes away - more like 10/15 minutes, and those in the sticky heat, so just be aware. I recommend going underground on Orchard Road and walking in the air conditioned cool of the subterranean mall. Breakfast at the hotel is fine - basically a good buffet with international offerings, and an omelette station. Service was mostly good at breakfast but occasionally went wrong - someone forgot to bring us coffee, that sort of thing. Really nothing serious, especially when compared to the rest of the experience. Just want to add that our departing flight was awkwardly late at night, so the hotel allowed us not only to leave our luggage at the hotel after checkout, but also to return after dinner, use the spa to have a shower and change our clothes and generally ready ourselves for the 14 hours of flying we faced. That was a nice touch. This is by no means a cheap option, but I would stay at the St. Regis again, and recommend it to others without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing opulence and VFM”
Reviews.Author: AmitabhTeena
Reviews.Content: - Location - superb (edge of Orchard Road) , 3 min walk to Orchard St MRT - Opulent, large (by SGP standards) rooms - Amazing butler service (24-hr tea coffee free in-room service) - 3 clothes free pressing on arrival (too good for business travellers) - Good well maintained spa (little expensive) - Has a Chinese, French and Italian restaurant - No Indian or multi-cuisince restaurant (2 Indian Restaurants including Woodlands 2 building away)

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: PunggolField
Reviews.Content: why? Cos the room, Executive Deluxe Room, was simply delightful! Upon entry, a little walkway where there is a little bar counter with 6 bottled mineral water.. 1st wow factor.. never came across a hotel with such generousity to give 6 though they are 350ml-bottled... Next wow factor!! The l..o..n..g.. seater by the window.. fantastic.. can even sleep one adult comfortably... then another 2-seater victorian-style couch at end of bed... another wow! Bed, king-size is extremely big!! Maybe this is what they called Super King or European King, anyway, just look very big and comfy.... Here come the Ultimate wow factor!! Marvellous.... how do I address it?? Ermm.. shower room?? It is a room alright.. so big.. 2 separate wash basins... French marble vanity tops... exquisite! The stand-alone bathtub! My goodness.. with a LCD screen embedded on the wall... soaking and watching WC 2010! Standing shower glass enclosure, rain shower with massaging jets for the body... this is heaven~~ we used hp to take tons of pictures for memory's sake:-) 24-hr Butler service... we are coffee-craze and the coffee is simply delicious... can I say, the best so far... we order thru phone and were delivered shortly... Good service! I've stayed Four Season, Fullerton, Conrad but I boldly declare St Regis top them all !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. Rooms were huge and completely luxurious. Butler service was great. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially at breakfast and they always tried to remember your name. Pool area was nice but always shaded from the sun. Wasnt that close to too many bars and restaurants but taxis were pretty cheap. We did eat in the chinese restaurant one night and it was a nice meal but slightly over priced especially the drinks. One our last night, they surprised us with a bottle of champagne and chocolates which was a really nice touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a luxury stay!

Reviews.Title: “A 6star hotel? More like a big MINUS 6 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotelpert
Reviews.Content: My husband is a SPG Platinum member and so the ONLY reason why we decided to stay at St Regis was purely due to the SPG program. We travel to Spore at least 6 times in a year. Because of the SPG program, we chose to stay at St Regis as it's newer and more comfortable than the only other SPG hotel, The Sheraton. On our 1st stay in 2007, the main TV was faulty. On our 2nd stay, the room lights were faulty. At about 4am, the lights came on, shortly after, the curtains were automatically withdrawn. Then the lights came on again.... Imagine having to frantically search for the room lights and figure out the high tech control panel at 4am in the morning! On our next visit, the toilet TV was faulty! There was even a tattered hole in the bathe towel and rust stains on 1 pillowsheet! The following visit was diastrous. We checked in at 11.30PM, after a long and very tiring day, Lo and behold! Our door key couldnt work! A minute later, the bellhop arrives with our luggage. After an unsuccessfully attempt, he leaves and says he'll inform reception. After 10minutes, the bellhop returns alone but with a new set of key cards....again they dont work! He leaves us again and says he'll inform the butler as only the butler has a master key! After yet another 15mins, the butler FINALLY arrives! We were already standing outside our room door for almost half an hour! After offering his apologies, he informs us that the room door lock is faulty and the hotel security staff has to fix it. So at 12midnite, our door bell rings and the security staff 'fixes' our door. The next morning, I called the butler for a cup of coffee and hot chocolate. After 45mins later, still no drinks. I call the butler again and this time I was informed that the drinks were already 'served' and sent to room 2006. Problem was, MY room no was 2007! The butler then tells me that my call was reflected as a call made from 2006! Can you believe that!!!! ???? My last stay was in Dec 2009. As a Platinum cardmember, we were upgraded to a suite. We then had to extend our stay but were advised that we had to move to a normal room as 'all their suites' were fully booked. After having stayed in that room for 1 whole week, moving rooms was definitely not a welcome idea esp with all the additional xmas presents and lots of shopping. A check on their hotel website showed there were suite rooms available for booking! After pointing this out and making a verbal complaint, the htl manager finally relented and said we could keep our room. This was 2 days later! So that was it! My final straw with St Regis. All our subsequent stays were either at Sheraton Hotel, InterCon and most recently, we tried Grand Hyatt. Service at any of these hotels far far surpasses St Regis. The best service would be InterCon, where I found the staff very warm, friendly, cheerful and always ready to offer their service. After half a year later (ie today 30 June 2010), I eventually decided to give St Regis another chance. No suites upgrade this time, but only a level up to their Lady Astor room. Upon entering our room, we were greeted with nice 'welcome msgs', a fruit platter and a welcome note from our butler introducing herself and informing us to call her anytime for anything. I thought 'ok, so maybe their service has finally improved'. With 2 adults and 1 kid, we definitely needed more than 1 set of toilteries, shower gels esp. So hubby gives butler a call... no answer. 15mins later, he calls and again no answer. He needed to meet someone at the lobby so just before he came back, he informs the reception of our req for an additional set of toiletries. 1 hr later, nothing arrives. This time I tried my luck and call the butler, unfortunately, stil no answer! 15mins later I try again and this time I left a voice message and also asked for a bucket of ice. 30mins later, still NO call or service. I call the operator and enquired if the butler svc was 24hrs? 'Yes' was the reply...'Then how was it that we have not been able to reach the butler for the past 2hours???? And also, What ever happened to the add toiletries request we made thru the recep 1hour ago???? After apologising, he assures me the butler wil be sent to our room immediately. Within 5mins, our butler arrives, we thought, ok, so finally our toiletries and ice! NOoooooo.... he came only to get the ice bucket from our room! Imagine a 6star hotel not having a spare ice bucket??? TOTALLY RIDICULOUS!!!! At this point, I really didnt know whether to laugh or scream..... Conclusion? Beyond redemption! Bad service, TOTALLY no 'service recovery' or genuine attempts to 'win back their customer'. For the price you pay here, you'll be much much better off at the InterContinental hotel with better service, location, food (inside and outside hotel), shopping, convenience etc etc. Even the Grand Hyatt would be a much better option and cheaper too! In short, ANYWHERE else BUT St Regis!

Reviews.Title: “The Drawing Room”
Reviews.Author: crotats
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is just great, the one thing I really want to talk about is the Drawing Room, a Tea Lounge just off the Lobby. To begin with I like Afternoon Tea, my scones and Tea, the Drawing Room does it just great and the ambience is equally good, Service very attentive our server was Marla, pleasant, smiling, friendly and cheerful. To me this is best afternoon Tea in Singapore especially in the Scones and service department. forget about the Raffles Hotel afternoon Tea.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, great service”
Reviews.Author: hrainzhao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Orchard Road, which is a place you will visit a lot during your stay in Singapore. It only takes a few minute walk to get there from the hotel. On the other hand, the hotel is not literally located on the high street therefore you can always enjoy the tranquility even in the Singapore city center. The service is definitely great and it really deserves a thumb up. Staff are very nice and responsive. You will be really impressed by the genuine smiles from their staff. The room amenities and set up is very up-scale. You can feel the low-profile luxury.... like all of other St. Regis branded hotels, it offers great stay experience which you can feel as comfortable as home. The over-sized room is another plus. I think we stayed in their entry-level room, which is very spacious. I am under the impression that normally the you cannot easily find such spacious entry-level rooms in Singapore. The only drawback I'd like to mention is the food selection of the hotel breakfast. We didn't find much Asian food option which we really missed during our 5-day stay in the hotel. Overall, it is a great hotel and it definitely worth your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not that clean”
Reviews.Author: betchabygolly
Reviews.Content: What you pay for at this hotel is the quietness of its surrounding and the butlers who are always ready to give you coffee, iced water or tea at any time of day. I was going to watch TV and looked for the remote and surprisingly, there was food stain on its buttons, and it was gross because we were impressed how the rooms looked and expected that everything was clean. I would stay at this hotel again but would definitely not get breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but over the top!!!”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here on our way back from Italy. The hotel advertises that it is 6 star and so appears to try and anticipate your every need. Our room was fabulous - spacious , elegant and very well designed. It took a while to sort out the electronic gadgets but eventually we got there. The bathroom was great with two wash basins which we like. Toileries were large sizes and were Remede. Normally the shampoo etc does not concern me but this brand was really lovley. The bath tub was great and had a TV screen and remote control so you cold lie in the bath and watch TV. The flat screen in the main area was huge and there was also a DVD system with lots of CD's. More could be obtained by calling the butler. Yes each floor has their own butler! The butler is very helpful and will arrange such things as reseravation, pressing of garments and serving tea. we asked for tea making facilities to be set up in our room and this was done. we found our body clocks a little out so when we were wide awake at 4 in the morning we decided it would be better to make our own tea rather than have the butler serve us. The amenities in the hotel are great SPA and swimming pools and lots of bars and resteraunts. We used the Astor Bar and the Italian resteraunt by the pool. The latter being great. The Astor Bar had the world cup on TV so it was not a quiet place to have a drink. Breakfast was very good and lots of choice. Unfortunatley the staff of which there were any did not leave us alone. The minute you put a fork down they were trying to clear up or they were asking you if they could do anything for you. The same happens when you walk in the front door - someone wants to carry your bag. This hotel is great if you like attention. I found it very wearing after a while. The hotel staff do not appear to understand the word privacy. E.g I decided to put the do not disturb on the door and have a bath. whilst I was in the bath the phone rang so I ignored it. when I had finsished my bath I noted the message lights on the phone plus there was a note under the door. It appeared the butler had forgotten to return a clean tea cup to the room and was frantic that we would not survive without it. It is not the butlers fault - the hotel trains them to be so efficient they are not sensitive to people needing space. I did not one of the supervisors chastising a staff member in the resteraunt for not folding a napkin properley and I felt this was really bad mangement practice. I don't need to see this when I am eating breakfast and I was surprised that this should happen. The SPA is great but very expensive so beware as the price quoted attracts tax. we had a lovley stay but the constant attention was a little wearing but I am used to doing things for myself so perhaps I need to chill out. Do not stay here if you are on a budget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcogiov
Reviews.Content: We booked St.Regis with a nice pay 3, sleep 4 nights offer, so it was good value for money. Location is very good, pretty near to Orchard Road and MRT, but far enough from noise and confusion. While St. Begis in Bejing was absolutely perfect, the one in Singapore is not spotless, although it's an excellent hotel. Our room was really very good and classy, with large, confortable beds and an absolutely amazing marble bathroom. You surely get more than five star sleep. Butler service is fine, while I wouldn't choose St. Regis just for that. We didn't have the buffet breakfast in the hotel, just not to eat too much. In Singapore culinary temptations await you at every corner, so better start the day light. There's wonderful Hediard from Paris patisserie 100 metres away or you can have breakfast anywhere in Orchard Rd. Yes the swimming pool is small, we didn't use it for lack of time. Neither we tried the hotel restaurants, there are so many around! Service was was good, everyone was polite and courteous, but in some ways it was not on a par with the stellar one of our August stay in St. Regis Beijing. Given an affordable tariff, when in Singapore we would surely come back to St. Regis

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: CAWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Location – 5 Stars – Tanglin road turns in to Orchard road (Shopping, hotels, nice to walk) and is a nice walk. Property – 5 Stars – Opulent lobby and rooms. In the rooms: Floor to celing windows with niceview of the green area, high end condos and embassies etc. However, the bottom half of the windows have some white design spoiling the view and I wish they did not have that; Check-in – 3 Stars – We checked-in at 5 PM on the 7th April. Check-in was okay (the lady who checked us in had an attitude that was not friendly). Walked us to the elevator but did not explain anything about the hotel or features. Contrast this to our other stays at HongKong, Sheraton Grande in Bangkok and Sheraton in Pattaya, they walk you to the room and explain the property and features of the room and facilities. Butler/Front desk – 3 Stars. Decent overall. However, Capuccino and Cup of Milk was barely luke warm one morning when I requested for hot. They replaced it. The worse was the TV in the bathroom was not working and it took 3 calls to the Butler over 24 hours and one with Front desk manager before it was fixed. For each time, they would come and either switch it on or off without the remote working. There was hardly an apology from the Front desk manager when I said it has already taken 3 calls and 24 hours and it has not been fixed when (a) the problem should not have existed and (b) it should have been properly attended to after the 1st call Breakfast – 5 stars – High quality and good service Concierge – 5 Stars – Very polite and helpful Chinese restaurant for lunch (I think the name was Yan Ting) – 5 Star - Good food and service. We had lunch twice here. Housekeeping – 3 Stars – Fine overall but did not replenish toiletries even though they were more than half empty. Pool side – 2 stars – Servers were busy chatting. I had to walk to them so I could order a drink. When she did bring my drink, she put it in a table which was quite far from the lounging chair (which is in a quarter feet of water in the pool) and could not be reached unless you got up and took a few steps. This was very inconvenient but may be they do this to avoid spillage in the pool. I have seen similar set-ups at other hotels but they generally put a table next to you for drink (and do not serve food). Also, they had cold towels but I was not offered one – I had to ask for one. Check out: 5 stars – Smooth, Polite and Courteous Overall, I think unless you are on expense account, you can get much better service for lower rates. Like you can see above, the service is not consistent between departments or individuals. Many times it is top-notch and at other times it is disappointing. For how much you pay, I think it ought to be top-notch each time. This hotel is very nice but definitely not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellotravel
Reviews.Content: eveything was perfect room, location: 10 minutes walk to orchard

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: I was in the Regis residences and just had breakfast in the Hotel. all over service was great, food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very comfotable”
Reviews.Author: huetinhyeu
Reviews.Content: the hotel had the location was convinient, room cleaned.staff very helpful.you should gone there to stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: randjb
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the St. Regis many times. Sometimes just one night, once for a month. The staff is wonderful and friendly. we've always been greeted with a smile upon entering or exiting the hotel. We've only eaten at 2 of the 3 restaurants but, it was always a great experience. Check-in is pleasant and they really work to try and accommodate you. The concierge service is outstanding. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed. Fresh fruit is provided at check-in. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are great...free standing tub with a TV built into a mirrored wall and a very nice size shower. You can plug in your iPod or plug a cable into your laptop, to watch videos, etc., using the sound system in the room. There are electrical outlets everywhere! The location is just around the corner from Orchard Road. It's close enough to walk to all the shopping and eats you could ever want! But since it isn't on Orchard Road, it is not nearly the madhouse in front of the hotel that you get in other Orchard hotels. The Botanical Gardens is just a short walk away. The gym is medium sized and well appointed and faces the pool. The spa is great (& we're not normally spa people) and if you want one of the best deep-tissue/sports massages in the world, ask for George. He is truly amazing and very professional. The tea service is great with a nice menu of various types of tea. You can call and have it brought up to your room any time of day. The breakfast buffet is varied and all good, lots of different kinds of fresh fruits, and an omelet stand where you can customize your omelet to order. The service can be a bit uneven -- partly due to a problem you find everywhere in Singapore -- staff tend to move from job to job quite often. But when I say uneven, it varies from good to excellent. We've never run into poor service from anyone at the hotel. We wouldn't stay in any other hotel in Singapore. It is the best the city has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service improving again”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before and stayed there several times since its opening. Service slipped considerbably since the management change last October but is improving again. The rooms are great and it is a wonderful hotel. Some things which are not as good as they used to be such as the butler service and attention to detail. The breakfast is also not as good as it used to be and the service there is lacking attention to guests. The chinese restaurant and pool side brasserie are not worth going to in terms of the food. F&B is not a strength of the hotel. Still and overall one of may favorite hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. Best in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Amazing Rooms. A bit traditional, but luxurious and comfortable. Wonderful Bed, with a huge pillow menu to make it even better. Nice Big Bathroom with walk-in closet to keep everything organized. Enjoyed using the Remede toiletries. All the Small Things add up to Spectacular service... Free Suit Pressing Service upon arrival. - a great touch. Coffee and Tea service any time, care of your personal concierge. Good Location - close enough to Orchard, but Worlds away. 10 Min walk to Ion Orchard. easy stroll, Until it Rains! Easy Taxi ride to everywhere. Clarke Quay and Dempsey Hill nice places to eat nearby. Great Fitness Center. Top line equipment. and refrigerated towels to keep you cool. Enjoyable breakfast among the fountains and pool. Food was not as amazing though. I would have expected a much better breakfast selection from the top class restaurants in the hotel. Food was just so-so. Sausage, bread and the like. But Service was top-notch. Lobby was nice, but uninspiring. I would have expected more from the Best Hotel in Singapore. The Grand Entrance was nice, but actual lobby was ... Normal. Very Slow 'High Speed Internet' service. Disappointing for such a modern hotel. Uninspiring view of other buildings, even at high floors. Everything adds up to a Wonderful Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest room we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan66
Reviews.Content: The St Regis was well worth the money if you are after a few days of luxury. Make sure you visit the wet spa, Hot tub, Steam room, Ice shower, Sauna etc it is complementary to hotel guests and virtually deserted each time we used it.
