Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SCUBAJK
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with wonderful location near Orchard Road. Staff could not be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “This is supposed to be a five star hotel?! can't be...”
Reviews.Author: Maura-SoeparjadiKwik
Reviews.Content: With the brand name, reputation, and reviews that are near perfection, I expected a lot from St. Regis Singapore. Unfortunately, we were hugely disappointed. To start with at check in, while the staff was courteous, she didn't impress me as the confident type. She came across as a new hire junior person who just graduated from a hospitality school. I mentioned that my booking could be under two different last names (my married or maiden names). She said she couldn't find my reservations. After a panic attack, I found out that she was looking only for one name and not the other. She then took me to my room and said that the butler would show me the room's amenities. I waited for about half hour but the butler never came and I had to dash off to a meeting. While having a 24/7 butler seems like an intriquing idea that sets the hotel apart from all other luxurious hotels, at the end we didn't find the butler particularly useful. If anything, it actually became a nuisance. We ordered tea at night, and only tea came... no sugar, no cream. In the morning when we ordered coffee, again only coffee came... no sugar, no cream. Considering that sugar and cream were not made available in the room, the butler should have been better trained to serve the complete set. Probably we would have gotten better service by calling room service. To top it off, the coffee pot was badly chipped... and the lacquer on the milk-serving cup was already fading. You don’t even expect that in a three-star establishment! When we needed some tape to pack some boxes, we specifically asked for packing tape and not masking tape. The butler came back to us with masking tape. When we told him that what we wanted was packing tape, he said the hotel didn’t have any. We then called the concierge, who promptly gave us the correct packing tape. The concierge ended up being very helpful. They were also friendly and always smiling. We thought highly of the people at the concierge and the front door. The electronics in the room were also a bit screwy. When we turned on the TV in the bathroom, the TV in the bedroom got completely messed up. After a battle with the remote(s), we called the butler (again!) and found out we needed to reset the system by pulling out the power cable from one of the controllers in the cabinet. It was definitely not easily accessible, and once we pulled the power cable out we had a tough time inserting it back in because we couldn’t see the back of the controller. We also found that the light system in the room was complicated and we never quite figured it out (maybe because we never got that butler to show us around?). It seems that the lights are set up by mood type: bright (for reading), cozy (for when watching TV), and sleep. We couldn’t figure out how to setup the lights if one person wanted to sleep while the other one wanted to read. I must say though that the bed and the pillows were very comfortable and I slept well. I also couldn’t connect to the wifi at the hotel. I went down to the business office and was informed that the wifi at the hotel is so fast that it is not really compatible with the blackberries. The person at the business office was nice enough to take the blackberry from my hand and navigated through it with the help of the hotel IT department to finally get the wifi to work. While many people may have their laptops with them, the blackberries are quite a common gadget now that I find it strange the hotel is using a wifi system that is not automatically blackberry compatible. We found it a little strange too that there was no mirror at all in the bedroom (maybe it’s a feng shui thing?), but plenty of them in the luxurious bathroom, including the mirrored wall by the free standing bathtub and a full-length mirror inside the shower. The closet arrrangement in the bedroom seems awkward because there is not enough drawers/shelve space. If your main interest is Orchard Road, then this hotel is not too conveniently located as it is at the end of Orchard by the Tanglin Road. Overall, while some aspects of the hotel were nice like the bathroom, the bed, and the concierge, it lacks quality and I was disappointed because it was far from meeting my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to return-even though we now live down the road!”
Reviews.Author: Neoclem
Reviews.Content: Cant recommend The St Regis enough, I believe it would be the best hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in, the service, the room, the dining, the decor......it goes on. We have since moved to Singapore since our last visit and are planning to spend a night at The St Regis just to relive the fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: bdalax14
Reviews.Content: I know that high end hotels in Asia generally give more / better service than what you usually find in the US, but the St. Regis was above and beyond. Each floor had it's own butler! They offerred free complimentary pressing of your clothes (ideal after a 28 hour trip) as well as complementary water and tea / coffee whenever you wanted it. The turn down service was above and beyond as well, including adjusting the lighting, putting on soft music and drawing the shades (not to mention the complimentary chocolates and slippers)The rooms were also SILENT - I was adjacent to the elevator and wouldn't have had a clue while I was in the room. Also, you have to try the breakfast in the hotel - fantastic buffet! All in all this has to be the nicest hotel with the best service that I have had the pleasure of staying at. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: hodomania
Reviews.Content: First time stay at St Regis in Singapore this past February for around 4 nights. The rooms were very big and bathroom was spacious too. I liked the location (around 5-10 minutes from Orchard ION) because it was close to the busy part of Orchard but far enough to not be noisy. The 24 hour butler service is not as quick as one would expect.. but I live in HK and have been spoilt by extreme efficiency. The staff were friendly and helpful. The spa was excellent and their skincare line Remede is also very good. We also used the gym and thought it was well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, but lacking quality in the details”
Reviews.Author: Southbank67
Reviews.Content: The highlight was the room - wonderful design, good size - just fantastic! Great gym, good service, met my expectations for a five star hotel..... Our nanny had gone crazy selecting about 7 movies without realising we had to pay for them and these fees were waived on checkout which was a terrific gesture. The breakfast was ok but the quality of the croissants, tea and coffee was seriously lacking. A five star hotel should get these details right! Also, their lifts have to be the slowest modern elevators I can remember experiencing!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Scottflex
Reviews.Content: Loved the St Regis Hotel. At check in, we were upgraded to a Executive Suite on the 9th floor. The room was gorgeous........elegant.......tasteful..... beautifully decorated with many modern amenities. Bathroom was awesome. Our butler ensured we had everything we needed. There was a slight mixup with our reservation and the Assistant reception Manager personally looked after us. She immediately turned a negative situation into a positive experience. They handled it very professionally. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and co-workers. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Singapore. We visited the famous Raffles Hotel and had a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar. Raffles looked so old and shabby, we appreciated our gorgeous St Regis when we returned to the hotel after dinner. Thanks for a wonderful stay. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “I have definitely outgrown the W hotel...........”
Reviews.Author: tokyolady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis for 5 nights. The doormen was attentive at helping me with my bags. The ladies at the front desk were professional but I feel they could have offered me a friendly smile, they were a little bit 'stiff.' The room was gorgeous and very clean. I appreciated the lovely Asian decor. I spent a day at the spa and I enjoyed some spa treatments. I enjoyed the steam room and jacuzzi outside. However, I felt that the receptionist was a bit 'stiff' as well...she was professional but she did not offer any smile. The room service menu seemed to offer plenty of noodle and rice dishes but it lacked variety. It would have been nice to have a personalized pizza and more western varieties as well. The attentive concierge Hayato-san introduced me to a tour guide, Mr. Kon, who was great. He took me on a personalized tour that was worth every penny. The only reason that I didn't give the hotel a 5 was b/c I received a 9am phone on Sunday from the spa informing me that they found a female massage therapist (I hadn't requested a female therapist so it was quite obvious the she was attempting to replace me with somebody else). I wasn't impressed at receiving an early morning call especially since my DO NOT DISTURB light was on. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't have a DO NOT DISTURB system on their telephones.

Reviews.Title: “Is There A Thief??”
Reviews.Author: ocean_boi
Reviews.Content: I went there to view the Hotel. The staff at the Door was very friendly. However the Staff "Thess" at the lobby was judgmental. didnt offered the kind of service level that St Regis claim to have. I left behind my avaitors at the lobby toilet. When I seek Thess for assistance, she went to check with the staff cleaning the toilet, then she came back telling me " it is not found. maybe someone had taken it away" without looking at me as if I was lying and didnt offered to take down any details of my lost item anymore. Do they only care for House Guest? Is there a theif, in your hotel because you can say " maybe someone took it awway"

Reviews.Title: “splendid~”
Reviews.Author: Mew_Woo
Reviews.Content: i have to praise that the hotel is very good!~ not only the traffic condition is convenient ,but also the peripheral environment is charming!~ what's more,the decorate of the hotel is luxury and elegant. then,i'm satisfied with the service of the hotel,it make me comfortable & enjoy myself so much as to forget to leave. in brief,it's really worth to try. but,the price is fancy...

Reviews.Title: “My worst Christmas meal ever.”
Reviews.Author: Inky011
Reviews.Content: We were not residents of this hotel but my son, daughter and I (all over 30) chose to have our Christmas Buffet Dinner here during our holiday in Singapore. It was a very expensive mistake and truly memorable for all the wrong reasons. Presumably all the starters had been eaten at lunchtime because only empty plates and limp salad remained (8pm). We had to ask for a bread roll to sustain us. The main course was turkey - TURKEY ROLL!!!! Something never before seen or tasted by my family. There were NO potatoes and the inedible gravy was cold. As it was my son's treat to his sister and me I didn't want to make a fuss. He, as a lawyer living in Dubai, didn't have to as he will ensure that none of his colleagues travelling to Singapore ever make the same expensive mistake as we did. What a bitter disappointment. We will be returning to Singapore for Christmas again in 2010 but will be giving the St. Regis Hotel a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Jaimeapo
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing, and expensive, the installations where with this luxury touch, the food was marvelous, the service was just first class...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service culture”
Reviews.Author: Ozzietraveller08
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bentley with the VIP airport experience - very efficient and nice to breeze through the airport like a real VIP. The ride in was magnificent and a great start to the stay at this hotel. We were overnight and the first impression were the friendly staff offering assistance. We were checked into the room, in our room. Room was very well appointed with large 42" sharp LCD and good amenities in a very good size 40sqm room. Loved the pool and ended up having a facial in the deluxe spa. Breakfast was very nice the next day although I thought that there was not a lot of restaurant variety. The Hotel is in a good location near Orchard road, a steamy 5 - 8 minute walk to the main shops. This is a very good quality hotel with exceptional staff - highly recommended, I will be staying there again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely all!”
Reviews.Author: P0p_Eyes
Reviews.Content: I loved the stay because of the warmth of the people working at the hotel. There are 10 of us who stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and everything went on smoothly. The reservation was done online and it was a speedy one. When we arrived, they asked us where we would choose to facilitate the check-in process. We may opt to do it at the room or at the lobby. We rather chose to have it in our room so the rest of us can get some rest since we arrived Singapore at almost midnight. It's also a good suprise that they gave the kids some gifts! And it's charming that they sent each room a box of chocolates as a New Year greetings. The rooms were clean and great. Since we stayed over for the New Year's eve, we decided not to join the hassle at the Marina Bay for the fireworks show since we have kids with us. But luckily, when midnight came, we were amazed to know that our room actually overlooks the Marina as well (although further) but the fireworks are very clear and visible to us. They also allowed us late check out and it went fine as well. We also had our dollars changed at the hotel and it was fast and they didnt ask too much questions. They also give very good tips for places to see. The concierge are also very warm and are gladly offering help at any time. Overall, i'd love to visit The St. Regis Singapore again. Oh, we got one premier room, which is very roomy and two deluxe rooms. Although their beds are quite smaller than usual, it was compensated by the good things of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE!”
Reviews.Author: coco_hk
Reviews.Content: St.Regis Singapore might be considered out of the way from Orchard rd but this is why I love it. Away from the shopping it is not too far if you do want to shop, but far away so you can have a chilled out time in Singapore. This is a POSH hotel from the moment you enter. The Bentley's parked out the front are a dead give away. From the moment you arrive you really feel like royalty. The lobby is grand, the check in homely with couches. The lift has a very cute bench in it which comes in handy when you have had a long day and want to rest while going up 14 floors. Rooms are modern glamour. Cream and walnut paneling, hand painted bed heads and a free standing tube welcome you in. Current society mags (which I LOVE) posh fruit (peaches!) and Harry Connick Junior playing on the cd player (VERY COOL!!!!) are some of my reasons why I always stay here when I'm in Singapore. Butlers come with the room and you can call on them whenever you want tea or coffee. I mean who likes making it themselves really? I only have 2 complaints. the lighting is rather random. it is really hard to just turn the light on as their are all these settings with different themes. In the middle of the night it can be a problem. 2nd complaint is the lack of a power socket next to a mirror. GIRLS need this for blow drying ones hair. Aside from that the hotel is AMAZING and worth every penny you spend on it. HIGHLY recommend it. Other things that are worth a mention: Pool has these really cute pool beds which are fun for a day in the sun Breakfast is AMAZING top quality food THE BALLROOM is hands down breathtaking tv in the bathroom so you can relax in the tub and catch up on a hbo movie. X COCO

Reviews.Title: “Can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: trvlerSydney
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the St Regis after reading the reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The room was lovely, the staff very attentive, the quality of room products exceptional (the best robes ever!) and the restaurants very good. I was on Level 3 (which is the lowest level for rooms) and the view was of tree tops. In hindsight, I should have booked a standard room - not a deluxe. I understand that the standard roms are on the other side of the hotel with no view at all (and obviously cheaper). I used the dvd library a few times - some good classics and a change from the standard hotel tv menu. Also used the JetQuay service from the airport. Was picked up at the gate and taken by buggy to a special customs, seated in a lounge for a short wait while my suitcase was collected. Then straight into a car bound for the hotel. A great service (SGD295). If you stay here, make sure you go to the fish spa a few doors down from the hotel (towards Orchard Road). An experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, still quite new”
Reviews.Author: ajsm
Reviews.Content: The Singapore St. Regis is on Tanglin road between two shopping centres, Tanglin Shopping Centre and Tanglin Mall, about a five minute walk to the start of Orchard Road. Another five minutes takes you to the junction of Scott Road where Takashimaya, Shaw Centre, Ion and many other large monuments to consumerism reside. So, good location. The hotel is "relatively" inexpensive for a St. Regis - I saw a number of special deals - and certainly it wasn't full when we were there over Christmas. However, like other top end hotels in big cities, the restaurant, bar and room service are pricey: SGD$19 for an orange juice by the pool. There is a complimentary wine tasting each evening to which I brought a few guests. Wine being so costly in Singapore, it was a nice treat, but the wines I tasted on two nights were decidedly average. There is a pool which I enjoyed despite the water being on the cool side and the pool itself being located in a shadowy wind tunnel created by many tall buildings. The fitness room was modern, clean, good, uncrowded. You can request a Herald Tribune every morning - yes! - along with your Straits Times. The rooms are spacious enough to put an extra bed and the sheets, pillows and bathroom are fantastic. (There's pillow menu with 13, or is it 30, pillow choices). There's a flat screen TV with lots of channels (and one in the bathroom which constantly malfunctions), a DVD player, and also audio inputs for your iPod/iPhone which output your music on great speakers. Your butler can bring you a choice of DVDs from their library (though when we were there, most of the choices were already taken since you can request as many as you want) and he can also bring you complimentary tea or coffee twice a day - a habit I could really get into. My only complaint, which seemed to sort itself out over a few days, was the temperature control which kept our rooms too cold. We stayed in an Executive Deluxe Room (actually their lowest end room - don't you love hotel room nomenclature) and also a Lady Astor room (about the same as an Executive Deluxe but with pastel colours and more ladylike furnishings). Bottom line, you'll be happy and if you got a good rate or points deal, you'll be really happy. Oh, and I forgot, you can obtain free parking passes for your guests from the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer/Exporter
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is Gorgeous and at Christmas the huge tree and decorations in the lobby were outstanding.. The rooms are beautiful and better and bigger than they look in the photos. The only problem is the vast number of buttons for the lights with labels that don't make sense. I husually don't use a pool in a city hotel but the herethe pool and spa are too beautiful to ignore. I rang to ask for grenn teabags to be told " madam, the butler will bring a pot of tea. " it came with fine china cups - perfect. The only problem was that we did not receive an invitation to Christmas Eve drinks until after the event and that breakfast is not included in the rate. The location is at the quiet end of Orchard Road but within walking distance of the busy parts so it is like an oasis. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun room - lots of buttons to play with.”
Reviews.Author: joaozinho
Reviews.Content: Good location, near Orchard road. Very elegant reception with Botero sculptures. Our room was not ready on check-in (at 6pm!) but they gave us a free breakfast to make up for it - a pretty good deal for a 15 minute wait as it was a great buffet. Bathroom is as scandalous as all the other reviews say and the room was better than it looked in the hotel photos (not as small as we expected). Only hitches - bathroom tv didn't work, they didn't have any the pillows we asked for on the crazy pillow menu and the butler never brought us the water we asked for. Overall though a very fancy place and worth it for some over the top spoiling yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyinRed03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband as part of our honeymoon. We loved this hotel so much it was difficult to leave! The service we encountered was all very great. Check-in was very friendly. Since we are Starwood Gold members we were upgraded to a deluxe room, which was very pretty and well-appointed. Waiting for us in the room was a plate of chocolate desserts and macarons with a sign saying "Congratulations." Our butler, a Japanese woman named Hitomi, was excellent. We asked her to press some clothes and also contacted her one night when we needed express dry cleaning service. She was always very professional and kind. We took advantage of the complimentary tea/coffee menu several times a day. The two men working at the concierge desk were both helpful and assisted us in making various dinner reservations. My one complaint was that the men at the entrance who assist in calling taxis were not very warm. However, all in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “opulent, value-adds justify the room rate”
Reviews.Author: AusTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a grand deluxe rm (garden view) on a high floor. this is a truly exceptional property with high spec finishes everywhere you look - e.g wood panelling, gold trim, marble everything! the bathroom is sensational with a free standing tub, in-wall tv, double basin and huge shower. the butler service is good, with unpacking and pressing on arrival but we didn't see the butler again until we ordered an in room dvd - the butler appeared with a strangely sub-standard list of choices. the dvd service needs upgrading as it sticks out as dragging the rest of the amenities down. the butler concept is well-sold but not really well executed. the value-adds at this property really justify the room rate. the spa is complimentary and top shelf - I spent hours each day there in thefive different zones (separate male & female wings). there was free wine & cheese during happy hour during our stay (served in "decanter"). outside happy hour there were excellent hors d'oeuvres served in that same bar, and poolside during the day. Only slip up - the French-accented manager at Labrezza was rude. Otherwise the hotel is deservedly one of Starwood's best offerings.

Reviews.Title: “an incredible hotel not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: hotelguruoslo
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller I have stayed at my share of moderate, good and luxury hotels over the years. As such, when I come across a fantastic hotel like the St Regis Singapore, I want to tell anyone who will listen. The 'basic' rooms are better than most 'luxury' (read expensive) rooms in fabled hotels elsewhere. The rooms are made with quality materials throughout. Lighting, sound and video systems are fully integrated. the bathroom is pure luxury. External sounds are nil as are those from nearby rooms. the service is pleasant and understated, yet always present. Although I unfortunately stayed only one night due to my schedule, this hotel is now in the top group of city hotels I have experienced in the world. As for the room itself, I have not had a better experience. There have been bigger rooms, better views and more money spent, but in terms of quality, luxury, peacefulness and practicality, the St Regis Singapore has topped them all.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite! Lovely hotel with surprising perks”
Reviews.Author: trvlr888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in December'09. We were most surprised by how warm and friendly most (but not all) members of the staff are. We've been traveling around Asia for the past two months and were dressed in more casual clothes during our visit. We fully expected the staff to be a bit cold and snooty towards us. True, the women in the reception area did act that way during most of our interactions with them (hotel manager, this is something to improve). However, everyone else (the ladies at the spa, our butler, room service, the bellhops, the concierge, the waitstaff in the bar, the bar manager, etc) were absolutely friendly and delightful. We were also surprised at some of the perks that most hotels of this class either don't offer or charge extortionate amounts of money for: - 24-hour butler service - Free internet in the business center (3 terminals); this included free printing - Complimentary access to the main spa area: an absolutely luxurious sauna (with ice chips outside to cool down), hot tub, pool, etc. - Complimentary 24-hour access to the fitness center - A complimentary wine tasting every evening, including a nice selection of cheese and crackers (and no pressure to stay and order dinner or more wine) - Complimentary coffee/tea/lattes served every morning by your butler Two additional nice touches were the high quality chocolates left beside in a gold box every evening and the a "pillow menu" (select your perfect pillow from one of 15 or 20). We were especially impressed with the manager of the bar. During the wine tasting, he came around to every table and chatted with the guests about their stay, the wines being poured, wines they enjoy, etc. It was lovely and not at all pretentious. Great job, St. Regis manager and staff! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Arguably the best hotel in Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: seahawk75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel once again, and it did not disappoint. Not too far way from bustling Orchard Road, it has well equipped rooms and probably the best spa i have ever been to. The customized massages are not to be missed, please ask for William or George, they are magicians! Service is also pretty good, so is the breakfast however, the hotel needs to have more dining options. But in Singapore, you can enjoy a variety of cuisines all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Gavbay
Reviews.Content: Let's preface this by saying that my family has seen a lot of nice hotels throughout Asia and the States. That said, the St. Regis is still the most wonderful hotel we've had the pleasure of staying in. We spent 3 weeks in a suite and connecting room, and everything was spot-on. The rooms were beautiful of course, but the best part was the service: the on-call butler was an awesome feature that at first we thought was silly but ended up being incredibly helpful in a few situations. The staff was always courteous, professional, friendly, and pleasant. Cleaning and housekeeping were always consistent, and the extras like chocolates and fresh fruit delivered daily made our stay so nice. Concierge was always extremely helpful and friendly. Room service was always quick and the food was fresh and enjoyable. I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel! I would definitely love to go back to Singapore and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “REMARKABLY IMPECCABLE SERVICE THIS TIME”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at St Regis only a couple of times, we was extremely impressed when upon checking in, was very warmly greeted by Mr Boon CK (reception manager) who not only recognised us but wow also remembered our name. That was a truly nice touch . As Platinum member, we were somewhat disappointed that a suite upgrade was not given, but we were upgraded to a spacious corner Lady Astor room. We also had free internet and wi fi and complimentary breakfast. There was also free wine tasting session i the evening. We requested for newspaper which was immediately delivered to the room and had complimentary drinks and fruits presented by a very pleasant and pretty Japanese lady butler. We were more than impressed with Mr Govind another butler who not only repaired the faulty nite drape( but it broke down again the next day) but also managed to secure a private room for our lunch booking at Yan Ting despite being told that it was fully booked when we requested through the concierge earllier on. The service and food at Yan Ting was commendable and i would recommend dining here. A chinese maid appeared to do the turndown and although she could barely understand English, was nice and did a good job . Also given a box of yummy chocolate in a pretty little box. All other requests during our stay were met and there was nothing to complain about. We were graciously granted a late check out and met yet another charming staff, Ms Kelly who also recognised us and provided a very personal touch .Although she was busy, she took time off to inquire about our stay and to wish us a Merry Xmas in advance. However, the room we stayed had some wear and tear issues with the furnishings which must be redressed at it is not befitting of a luxury St Regis property.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Business travel”
Reviews.Author: PJGMumbai
Reviews.Content: This is a very elegant hotel with impecable service. The staff was extremely helpful. We needed to rush to a meeting and they put us in the hotel Bentley and delivered us on time. This was done without a request-they were so tuned in to our needs at that moment.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: fourseaons21
Reviews.Content: took me more than a year to finally write this review, for all this while i was hoping that i would get a just explanation from st regis. room decor is nice, just like you'd expect from other five star hotels. what went horribly wrong was the morning after when my daughter felt something hard in the pillow. So she started digging in and guess what she found? BROKEN PIECES OF GLASS. Not just several pieces but many many tiny pieces. so we called the butler up and showed him the problem. The butler's response was a total letdown to a hotel that pride itself of its butler service. He just offered to bring us another pillow and left, acting as if there's no big deal with the broken glass. But we kept our cool. After a while i rang up butler service again. another butler came up and this time we complained about the broken glass pieces. Sensing that we were not happy he apologized and went out to fetch the housekeeping manager who can only manage to apologize too. They didn't even bother to try to explain how the hell the broken glass pieces got into the pillowcase and how the housekeeper totally missed it. That only means something! They never change the pillowcase even after the guest leave!!! YUCKS, this is 5 star hotel, my goodness!!! They scrimped and save on soap and water. ZERO hygiene level. On the same day we checked out. At the lobby we were greater by some manager who's quite senior, probably just under the general manager. This manager's apology didn't even sound sincere. they offered the 4 of us a free ride to the airport in a crammed mercedes. Come on, i could have paid sin $50 for a maxi cab that could provide us much more comfort given the no of people and the amount of luggages we had. Do they think they could appease us just like that after such a close encounter that my daughter had with the broken glass? I hate their mentality that they think they could fix everything just by offering a free little something. We are not cheap!!! We are nice people who decided not to pursue the matter, that's all. The way they handle the situation, the initial response, the apology, housekeeping service, the butler and the manager's attitude were a total letdown. I'm sure even 3 star hotels would have handled the situation with much more grace and sincerity.

Reviews.Title: “6 star luxury with a few bumps to iron out”
Reviews.Author: KiwisLA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the St Regis. Had a brilliant room on the 18th floor, very large with a huge comfortable bed full of pillows, high backed chair and stool, pillow strewn sofa, huge TV and a good sized desk, plus a huge range of well lit cupboard and drawer space. The fridge was a pain as it didn't have any room for our private purchases and the mini bar was prohibitively expensive, but then it is a 6 star hotel. It took us 2 days to work out the light system is it very comprehensive! The bathroom is marble and gorgeous. Lovely stand alone bath tub facing a mirrored wall with a TV inset. His n hers sinks, although a major draw back was there were no drawers to put your toiletries so everything has to fit onto the vanity top, odd for such a well thought out hotel room, designer must have been male! Great shower with extra jets and rainfall attachment. Toiletries are high end and everything is provided, right down to a loofah and dental floss. Good soft large towels and plenty of them. A nice touch is free use of CDs and DVDs and you can plug your iPod into their sound system. Housekeeping put a jazz CD on for us at turndown so we always returned to the room with dimmed lights and music and a little box of chocolates, really nice touch. Along with the papers delivered every morning in a little bag, and a pillow menu. Our room came with a Butler 24/7 which we used on a regular basis as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. You call the butler service and pick from a menu of teas and coffees which are free. Nice touch, fantastic at first having your morning coffee from china cups on a tray, but as they delivered it by the cup only I think the butler thought he was in a revolving door to our room as we are avid coffee drinkers in the morning. Our last day the coffee being delivered was burnt, strong and tepid. The butler changed it twice but it didn't improve so we ended up making a run to the Starbucks just around the corner for a decent latte. It was the only time we felt the 6 star service let them down. We used room service which was quick, delicious and well presented. They bring a table in with a white tablecloth beautifully set up with an orchid, etc, and the hot food is underneath in a warming drawer so no cold breakfast! We had a drink in the bar beside the entrance, good service, champagne and macaroons were delightful. Didn't use any of the other restaurants as we were busy going out to local restaurants instead. I used the large outdoor pool one morning. I was the only person there and obviously provided amusement for the surrounding office buildings! The pool is cool and good for laps. I didn't use the spa as it was too expensive and never found the steam rooms so can't comment. The staff were excellent, from the greeters at the door who refuse to let you open a door yourself, to the check in receptionist who walked us up to our room at 2.30am and ordered coffee from the butler (thank you Fiona), to the concierge staff for whom nothing was too much. I would like to give a special mention to Ian Tan, Chief Concierge, who was amazing. He went the extra mile, not just the usual restaurant recommendations and bookings, but being an absolute gentleman and walking me to the Fish Spa down the road in the evening when I was on my own. A special person who makes the hotel a 6 star experience. If we ever get the chance, we will definitely stay at the St Regis again. Hopefully next time I will find the steam rooms, sample afternoon tea, and manage to get back to the hotel in time for the complimentary wine tasting early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an amazing experience you will not forget”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieInL0nd0n
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a five night stays at the St Regis in Singapore using our SPG points and the 5 for 4 nights promotion. We had an amazing time ! It all started at Changi Airport where we were met off the jetty by an hotel representative and were wisked on a buggy through the airport terminal to the CIP terminal. Immigration procedures took 30 seconds to complete and we were seated in an elegant lounge with drinks and snacks while our luggage was being retrieved . Within 25 minutes of landing, we were seated in the hotel's Bentley on our way to the hotel. As a Platinum SPG member, I was upgraded to a deluxe corner room and we enjoyed in room check-in. The room was extremly classy, elegant, luxuriously appointed (hand painted silk pannels, lacquered wood veneer lobby with an elegant wet bar, marble floors, the usual electronics gizmos, electric drapes, etc..). The bed was very comfortable and dressed in beautiful, luxurious high quality linen. But the highlights of the room, was the amazing bathroom, with its free standing bath tub, separate wet room, and separate WC. An avalanche of marble combined with wood and expensive lighting made for a unique experience. The heating was cleverly hidden behind the various mirrors gracing the bathroom. Obviously, high quality robes, fluffy towels and top toiletries were complementing the scene. We were introduced to one of the many butlers who looked after us during our stay. I have to say that they all have proved to be extremly efficient, courteous and always there. The longest we had to wait for them to appear was 7 minutes (and that was on a very busy day). Overall, the service across the hotel was impeccable, the employees extremly polite and helpful. The breakfast in Les Saveurs is a unique, high quality experience (as a Platinum SPG, it was offered to us for free throughout our stay). In comparison, I attended a business breakfast at the Fullerton during my stay and it did not compare at all with the spread laid out at the St Regis, the variety and quality of the food on offer is superb. Please note that at peak time, you will have to wait for a table, especially at week ends. The Astor bar is a great location for well mixed, fancy and classic cocktails or a glass of delicious champagne. We also used the Spa and the Pool during our stay and they both receive very high marks indeed. Although the hotel was full, the pool was a haven of privacy and peace and quiet every time we visited. During our stay in Singapore, we visited the Fullerton, Raffles and The Mandarin Oriental. There is absolutely no question that the St Regis is the ultimate luxury hotel in Singapore at the moment. It may lack the old fashioned charm of the Raffles but its exclusive atmosphere and super decoration makes it a worthy contender as the leading house on the island. We shall return !

Reviews.Title: “Now I Get It”
Reviews.Author: Mattman40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis a couple of years ago after it has just opened and we were very dissapointed. We decided to give it another try for our weedinfg anniversary just passed, and we are very glad we did. They didn't just iron out the kinks we experienced the first time, they went over them with and very hot steam roller. Abosolutely perfect, the staff have the balance of help versus hinder spot on, which was lacking last time, they upgraded me due to plat SPG card and the room was great, and everything worked, which was a problem last time, the breakfast was not upto Shangri-lah standards but it was none the less very very good, which is was not the last time. But most of all you got that six star feeling, which we defintely didn't not a couple of years ago, Well done................. I guess like all good things they need time to mature, and the St Regis Sing, is in its prime now.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable luxury”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: This may be the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed in. It's all you'd expect from a St. Regis, but the rooms are really quite something. The only other Singapore hotel I've tried is the Grand Hyatt. I liked the Hyatt, but it seems downright spartan in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & butler service, pity about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DirkHartog
Reviews.Content: I tried this hotel since they were advertising a 20% discount on pre-paid rooms. We booked into a Lady Astor Suite and were upgraded to a a Deluxe Executive Suite - nice start! This is a common hotel ploy for newbies to a hotel but appreciated anyway. The lobby area already looks a little dated. I'm not sure about the designer choices. Perhaps they were going for old-style luxury but some of the carpeting and light choices makes it look dated even tho the hotel is only 2y old. The suite was great, one of the best I've stayed in. It was luxurious and with all the mod-cons even if the numerous lighting controls took the full three days to decipher. Bed was comfy. Butler service was friendly and efficient and nothing was too much hassle. We would have liked to have the option of making our own tea in the room but it was nice that we could get the butler to custom make a ginger honey lemon tea since I had a sore throat. You get two tea servings a day for free. My wife told me the massage (done by a guy in this instance) at the remede spa was great and the facilities looked good with rain shower room, wet and dry saunas, jacuzzi etc.. The gym and lap pool (at least 20m, maybe 25m) also looked very good altho I was not feeling well enough to try them out. It's about a 5-10min stroll to the start of the main Orchard Rd shops so the location is pretty good and there is a small mall with a supermarket 2min walk away in the opposite direction for anything small or urgent. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is the breakfast and unfortunately it's a big negative. The food quality and selection was poor, even for a 3 star hotel, and the service was of a similar standard. It's as if they subcontracted out the breakfast room to a cheap third party caterer. Very few of the fruit on offer was ripe (mostly sour) and the hot foods area was almost inedible (scrambled eggs was like yellow soup one day, the sausages tasted like cardboard). I am not surprised about the previous reviewer saying the afternoon tea is poor if it's done by the same kitchen and staff. If breakfast was not included in my package I would have definitely eaten at the cafe in the mall which is quite popular with expat wives doing their grocery shopping. Despite this gripe, the hotel is now definitely high on my list of hotels to stay in Singapore as long as they keep offering these deals. I don't mind paying a bit of a premium over nearby 5 star hotels for what is a better hotel, in my opinion, but the normal rack rate is a bit much. It's definitely worthwhile for a special occasion or a pamper. Just go to the nearby mall for breakfast until they get this problem fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea - Reasonable Food + Poor Service and Cleanliness + High Price.”
Reviews.Author: Gemakan
Reviews.Content: We only visited for Afternoon Tea, but I think it's worth giving feedback on that experience, especially as it is so different from the rave reviews that almost everyone has given here who has actually stayed in the hotel. Here's what happened: "Champagne High Tea" in the Brasserie Les Saveurs was advertised as starting at 3:00pm. We arrived a few minutes after that and we, together with one other guest, were told that it had not yet started, so we stood around in the lobby. Shortly after we were shown to our table. The waiter pulled back the seat for me, and I immediately noticed that it was badly stained (presumably with food or drink?) in three or four places. I asked for it to be changed. I sat down and it was immediately obvious that the champage flutes on the table were dirty - I picked mine up and saw both lip-stick marks and water stains. I asked the waiter to replace both glasses. We placed our order and asked for some iced water (which I could see was close-at-hand on the waiter's table). After maybe 5 minutes, none had been provided. The restaurant was starting to fill up and it became clear that there were just not enough staff on duty to provide attentive service. Eventually I had to walk over to the same waiter (head waiter?) and ask again for the water. We order the quiche and satay savouries. Maybe ten minutes later, quiche and dim sum arrived instead. That was sent back and next our requested quiche and satay appeared. Later in the meal another waiter appeared to bring us the quiche and satay which we had already been served. Later still, yet another waiter appeared with - you've guessed it! - the same dishes again. After the second of the four deliveries, the head waiter came over, apologised for the error with the first, and offered us a complimentary extra glass of champagne. We enjoyed most of the food, except for the rock-hard, stale scones and one sponge cake which must have been several days old. But absolutely nowhere was there any 6-star "wow" factor. Instead there was a bill of SGD 125 (about USD 90) for 2 people. I would have been happy to pay that steep price for afternoon tea if it truly was a 6-star, excellent food and wonderful service offering, but it very much was not. On the way out, we happened to be greeted by the hotel's general manager. I gave him our feedback which he accepted graciously. What surprised me, overall, is how a hotel of this notional 6-star rating can get away with disorganised, untrained and insufficient waiting staff; with food that is no more than good and in some cases awful; dirty furniture and filthy glasses; and sky-high prices?

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: shivanip29
Reviews.Content: We booked using Starwood points, and were at the St Regis for part of our honeymoon. We were treated really well, the room (we had a standard) was huge, very modern and exquisite, with large marble bathroom (flat TV in front of the bath tub!), and a tray of fruits and sweets waiting for us. Location was great -- right on Orchard, and about a ten minute walk to the train. We got comp'd breakfast (a treat due to honeymoon / platinum status) every morning, which was tasty and plentiful. A butler is assigned to all guest rooms, though we never used ours. Our experience overall was incredible -- exactly what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “A 6* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melvin0822
Reviews.Content: Quite a new hotel in Singapore. The Executive Deluxe Room was great in all aspects. Complimentary in-room selection of TWG tea (premium tea). Must try their afternoon tea and Chinese tim-sum buffet. Not cheap but good quality. Staff are polite and helpful. Also do attend the wine tasting at 5.30-6.30pm (complimentary for hotel guests!) Location wise, it is not right in the centre of Orchard Road but major shopping malls are about 5-minute walk away. Looking to return to stay at their Executive Deluxe Suite next.

Reviews.Title: “Very First Class Absolutely Amazing, the only choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AstrieWallerk
Reviews.Content: there are not word for describe what mean enter in St Regis Singapore. The Class is in each thing The Hotel is incredible : there are same absolutely unique masterpiece of art of BOTERO the famous sculptor and painter famous paint, fountain when you have dinner or lunch, concierge very well formed, absolutlely to try and learn what is the top class. the room is incredible, very very very lyxury, from the bath, to the sorround system of Bose, from the shower to the elettrical tent. the view is unique on a very big green park when i were there, arrive the president of Singapore and there were the hollywoodian actresse charlize theron Is the only choice in Singapore ! i came back as soon as I could

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular! New Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndyCali74
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel. Great location. Friendly staff. The rooms are to-die-for. They beautifully blend traditional design and contemporary accents. The bed is beyond comfortable and the bathroom is what dreams are made of! Trust me. Marble flooring, full length mirror in a shower and multiple shower heads, free standing tub, flat screen TV embedded in the wall mirror, gorgeous chandelier, two stunning vanities, I could go on and on... There's a gorgeous pool and a very clean gym with great of cardio equipment. The hotel is right off Orchard street which is one of the main shopping streets in Singapore so it's super convenient. Also, you can jump start your day at Starbucks or Coffee Bean right on the corner. This hotel is exceptional. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in modern yet classical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oursdur
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a superb breakfast and incredible fresh fruit juices. Thanks to SPG we got upgraded to a suite and the connecting room for the children was so vast we felt we had our own flat ! Service was excellent, and we were impressed by the home cinema system installed in both bedrooms. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I stayed under starwood”
Reviews.Author: treetop193
Reviews.Content: I tried quite a few starwood properties across asia ( at least 15) , but this one stands out . Its luxurious but not too in your face, cosy yet modern ,i claimed my free night so i stayed over for the weekend and spent most of the time in the hotel. there is enough to keep me and other half entertained for the whole day ! ( cant say this for a lot of city hotels) . from the art pieces to the gym to the spa to the wine tasting to the free dvds to the TWG tea .....excellent weekend getaway even for the locals ....only one small complain being that sometimes when you want a cup of coffee , its quite a hassle that you have to wait for the butler to do it for you ( they dont have any coffee tea facilities in the room) and it might take a while for them to come. so order in advance!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: doola13
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is not only a beautiful hotel the staff are wonderful, the rooms are to die for i think i could stay over and over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: elodieDubai
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute and stayed 5 nts on the web promotion. We had 2 connecting grande deluxe rooms, twin and king. The rooms are excellent! Our butlers were so friendly and attentive and solved minor problems for us very quickly. There is no mirror in the bedroom, so I asked if a portable one was available - within 10 minutes our Butler had personally found one from the Spa for us to borrow. Unfortunatly although we had booked a non smoking floor, one of the suites was being used for a meeting and a lot of smoking! The front desk tried to deal with this and immediatly offered us an ioniser for the room. A scented candle also appeared to help mask the smoke. We loved having the tea/coffee service and didn't have to wait too long for this. We also loved the luxurious bathrooms and the remede products, which were a treat. The pool area is designed beautifully and the sculptures are incredible. We think the hotel should offer smaller versions for purchase! Without doubt, the highlight of our stay was Sunday brunch at the Chinese restaurant. Free flowing Moet and the most incredible, high cuisine, at very reasonable prices. After many trips to Asia, this was one of our best dining experiences - the menu and dim sum is fabulous - world class. To sum up, the St.Regis offers a great location, with staff who really go the extra mile. There is no presence of arrogance or importance in the hotel - it is extremely professional but relaxed and friendly. It would be hard not to stay here again in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “A Very High Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: camsean
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is located on Tanglin Road, just off Orchard Road. Our stay at the St Regis was made possible by Starwood,s recent free weekend night promotion. Giving away rooms that normally cost more than S$400 rates as a fantastic promo in my book. Right from check in this hotel had us saying 'wow'. The lobby is super luxe with acres of marble, huge chandeliers and original works of everywhere. Including a Frank Geary sculpture near the main entrance. Even the lifts made us 'wow' as they are the only ones I have ever seen with a little sofa inside. Despite being on a free stay we were upgraded from an Executive Deluxe to a Grand Deluxe room, and it was really deluxe in every way. From the automatic curtains, the amazing TV built into the mirror in the bathroom, to the gorgeous furniture and four speaker sound system for the CD and DVD player. We were also invited to a wine and cheese tasting in the bar, Decanter, and the quality of both were as you would expect at such a fine hotel. Our room service dinner was also exquisitely presented, and more importantly, delicious. The staff we encountered throughout our stay were unfailingly polite and helpful. We travelled to Singapore from Jakarta, Indonesia for the weekend just to stay in the hotel and all we can say is it was well worth the effort. There are only so many superlatives you could use in a hotel review, but the list of them for the St Regis Singapore would be very long indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury made perfect”
Reviews.Author: reneyapbp
Reviews.Content: I redeemed a free night @ the st regis from my starwood preferred guest awards (if u haven't signed up, pls do so! It's one of the best programme among all the hotel grps). From the spacious executive deluxe room to the free-standing bathtub and non-fog mirrors, to the wonderfully comfortable Ploh pillows and its extensive pillow menu, i wished my stay was for longer. The blinds were such a joy to play with - we could effect night mode by shutting down all natural light. THe room is great for inducing sleep...just lie on the bed, with the warm lighting and all you feel is that you want to sleep forever and a day. The toilet and bathroom are separate - and the bathroom had a rainforest showerhead and a side powerjet. Such a pleasure to be in the shower. An executive deluxe room is going for S$400++ a night. IF you can't afford to stay in for more than a night, a night is good enough to splurge on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: safeDriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of the free stay from the starwood program. One of the best rooms i ever stayed in. Very big and spacious. The only thing which is strange is that you have to ring the butler to request for coffee :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: lechoufleur
Reviews.Content: My stay at St. Regis Singapore was mostly very comfortable. Loved the room, and what you see on their site is indeed what you get. The bathroom, in particular, was absolutely superb. The toiletries provided were amazing, save the typical hotel-quality toothbrush (a tad disappointing for a hotel of this caliber). Other nice touches I enjoyed were the DVD menu, pillow menu, and beverage menu. I was informed of the complimentary wine-tasting -- which sounded it could be fun -- but unfortunately I could not find time for it. The turndown service was a lovely gesture and made the room cosy and calming. Though, being used to getting chocolates on my pillows at other hotels, it felt incomplete without the chocolates. The only blemish was that the butlers often took 15-20 minutes to bring the beverages -- which was much too slow. Considering that, I would prefer an in-room standard mini bar with tea/coffee. Also, the butler who answered the calls at night could try to sound less blasé. Service-wise, I found the doormen and bellboys to be much more welcoming and warm than the butlers. Overall -- I enjoyed the spacious room and its fittings, but honestly I do not feel the signature butler service added any value to my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent hotel with exceptional attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and found the hotel to be fantastic in the short amount of time I was there. The beds were very comfortable though I should have requested for another kind of pillow from their pillow menu featuring 15 different types of pillows - I found the standard pillows to be overly soft and being a side sleeper, my neck was not fully supported. Bathroom was huge and mood lightings for both room and bathroom to be excellent. The bathtubs are huge and deep, and the shower was perfect! Remede amenities were provided. Also, shower and toilet are separated by frosted glass and doors. The best part is the legendary St Regis Butler service. Teas offered were from TWG, a premium brand, and the butlers are all exceptional in their service attitudes. My friend noticed that the butlers never once back-faced the guests; they all retreated backwards till the door before turning away from the guests. I also ordered room service which was not bad, but the Chinese restaurant in the hotel is amazingly good with very reasonable prices to match. If money's not an object for you, then I urged you all to stay here, though I think that for Singapore hotels, it is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “very good 5 stars !! will go again”
Reviews.Author: pmetka
Reviews.Content: his st regis is a good 5 star hotels and there is not much to say except it was overwhole a fairly good stay , the indoor air conditionned Tennis court right in the center of the city is absolutly brilliant ! just 2 things could be enhanced 1/ the breakfast that lack of choice and it could use a little bit more of the st regis bali BB menu ! , check my other review about that hotel . 2/ the fact that the restaurants advertise closing times 22H30 but in reality refuse to serve you after 21H30 ! Even if the staff confirmed beforehand they will be open at least untill 22H !! so really who do you have to believe if you want a late dinner ???!! that is really a poor service for a st regis

Reviews.Title: “Subtle Perfection”
Reviews.Author: thirdsunday
Reviews.Content: I loved the way everything in this hotel is perfect, and yet you dont feel like they're trying too hard. From simple things like the bathroom fittings, to the way the staff attend to your every need, you dont feel like they're trying to hard to impress anybody, and yet you get the feeling that a lot of effort has been put into it to make things just right. The pool is kinda small and the water is really cold, but the poolside is a really nice place to hang out. We definitely plan to be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hnewdelhi
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a lovely experience - the butler service is exceptional. Most hotels around the world could learn a lot from the St. Regis Singapore. I found nothing at all that fell below my expectations, in fact, most things, from the tea menu to the internet in the room to the bathroom were a bit better than expected. Good value for money too. Definitely worth visiting on all trips to Sing.

Reviews.Title: “St.Regis proves again - it's just the best!”
Reviews.Author: Alexey_Rodionov
Reviews.Content: After booking our stay at St.Regis Singapore we have asked for the transfer service from the airport to the hotel. We've been offered a Bentley transfer which included the arrival service JetQuay (an excellent VIP treatment on the arrival). After arrival we've been driven to the hotel and the moment we exit the car, immediately we've been escorted to our room and all the formalities (passport copy/credit card details) have been settled withing minutes still in the room. It was impressive and fast - between getting in the car in the airport and getting unpacked in our room - 30 minutes. So, needless to say - the service is on the highest end there. Few small and nice touches of the caring service: 1) everyone in the hotel knows your last name { I have no idea how they do it :) } 2) when the doorman gets you a taxi, he immediately writes down the taxi company name and license plante number and gives it to you... Why? "if you forget something in the taxi, it will be easier to find it back".... 3) etc.... but all your stay you are surrounded with the "small touches of care and luxury" Breakfast is excellent. Chinese restaurant on the 1U level is extraordinary. Especially the Sunday Champagne Brunch! All-you-can-eat (a la carte) and drink (Moet Chandon!) - is only 99 Singapore dollars per person (50euros). Perfect experience and chance to explore wonderful cuisine! Personally for me and my family this will be the only address to stay in Singapore next time! P.S. rooms are excellent and are the "intelligent rooms" P.P.S. very close (3 min walking time) to Orchard Road. Enjoy Singapore together with St. Regis Hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: aussie_platinum
Reviews.Content: Staff are great, hotel is amazing, rooms are a highlight. You will not be disappointed here. Full breakfast available free for SPG Platinum, and a wine tasting in the evening. Also, they pressed 6 items for free for us on arrival. This hotel will be number 1 in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: oh_holidays08
Reviews.Content: Staying at the St. Regis is simply indulgent.... the 24-hr personal butler service, the stylish chic rooms, fully-equipped with all the bells-and-whistles that are above and beyond your ordinary 5-star hotel. The luxurious touch of the hotel is evident from the moment one arrives at the lobby, all the way to the bathrooms, the Remede Spa (which is complimentary except for massages), daily wine tasting, and the ever-ready airport Bentleys for yours truly. Surely the St. Regis was designed for a lazy pampered traveller in mind; the 15-pillow menu, complimentary drinks from the butler, Bose Surround System paired with a respectable DVD collection, top-notch bubble bath in a stand-alone tub, and the list continues on and on. Foremost, the staff are incredibly attentive to all your needs and needless to repeat, the level of service is impeccable and unparalled. Location is definitely icing on the cake; walking distance to the Orchard shopping area to spend to your hearts desire, yet not smacked amidst all the hustle. To think that all this is coming from a seasoned high-flying traveller ... why stay anywhere else while in Singapore?

Reviews.Title: “Overall Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: givemesunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the beginning of Orchard Road (the main shopping street) and therefore convenient for shopping. The room was huge and beautiful. All the walls had floor to ceiling wainscotting, which gives the walls an expensive look. The furniture was beautiful and high end. The beds were the softest (still on the firm side) that I slept in during a month-long trip to South-East Asia. The marble bathroom was fabulous with two vanities and a bath tub with TV. The shower had an amazing water pressure. All the plumbing fixtures were Toto-brand (the best). St. Regis had some little touches that made it seem like a better hotel than any other. The morning newspaper was delivered in a little little bag. Instead of just one paper they delivered two. The floor buttler was available to press clothes or to help in any way. The room was super quiet. Since I was travelling with two kids I have to say that the pool was an adult lap pool. I loved it, but the water was pretty cold and the kids rejected swimming in it. The service at the pool was nice too. While I was swimming a waiter left me some cold water and a plate of fruit. An overall excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Proffessional, Dedicated to your relaxation in every way”
Reviews.Author: omaiaa0p
Reviews.Content: The St regis hotel was my choice for myhoneymoon in Singapore. We were upgraded to a deluxe executive with a gorgeous view of Singapore and its harbour point. The food was good especially tomato basil soup. Singapore is such a gorgeous city. The service was more than excellent with a special butler dedicated to your every need. The room was great with an amazing marble bathroom with a tv in the middle. I would definitly go there again but next time in the lady astor suite.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nilesh_jogadia
Reviews.Content: St.Regis is one of the best hotel when in comes to Luxury and well decorated. Stay was extremely good and latest equipments were used to make the hotel suites go with latest trends . Spacious Bath room with lovely amenities & LCD screen insire the side mirror. this hotel not for a budget traveller. Easy day n night curtains with switches next to the bed & high speed internet connections. Lovely n classy furniture with beautiful carpets. Stay was memorable and was a happy customer with all the service received from the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has set the new standard”
Reviews.Author: Simestravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St Regis for 3 nights in May, using part SPG points and part payment. Quite simply this is the best hotel Singapore, or even Asia has to offer. Being long time users of Shangri La - in the abscence of a good choice in the Starwood brand where we have platinum status - we know what is possible in Singapore but the service, special touches and room decor really puts it in a league of its own. Go there and you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Many stars but questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: ClausJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days. Normally stay at RitzCarlton but wanted to try other hotel. Hotel is nice looking in an average way.. Service ok but not great.. Asked for coffee 3 times at breakfast (day 2) before I got it.. Fitness center very small and underequipped.. Pool is nice and very modern, but service down there is really bad.. Long wait for sandwich.. No one in sight for drinks order for 15 minutes at least.. And lots of little things in room didnt work as it should : broken lock on drawer - damaged holder for shavingmirror.. Not staying again..

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile. A Wonderful Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: luckylorks
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is predominately a business hotel however, traveling with my wife and three year old was an absolute breeze. The friendly staff started with the doormen, check-in and the Butler. We stayed in the larger Deluxe Corner Room for three nights. We enjoyed every second of it. Our family don't particularly enjoy Singapore - we find it more sterile than KL, for example - shopping is the main activity - so we spent a lot of time at the hotel eating and at the pool and walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been to”
Reviews.Author: henxiguai
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for two professional meetings, and was booked by the host at the St Regis. I stayed for 10 days (at no cost), and had a fantastic experience. The room I had (an upgrade from the standard room) had everything you could wish for and more (TV in bathroom, huge bath tubs, six jet showers, huge bed, epod pad with surround sound system)... The service was very good if not excellent (once the butlr was a bit intrusive but the others were perfect).I also loved the spa, extremely clean and well serviced. The hotel is very modern and has a number of original pieces of contemporary art that makes it stylish. The food was excellent, although a bit expensive, but given that the hotel is close to all the malls and restaurants, one can always go out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but service could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: woodsdevil
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore at least 5 times a year. We usually stay at the Pan Pacific which we love but this time instead we thought to try the St Regis. We are not fussy people but defintely prefer to stay at a 5 star hotel minimum. After reading about the St Regis, we were expecting great service which was lacking from the moment we stepped in the hotel. The checkin was underpar, the reception was cold and not personable unlike at Pan Pacific where they engaged in a light banter with the guest to make you feel welcome while not intrusive. The room is beautiful, reminds me of the Mandarin Oriental or the Four Seasons. Can't argue with the size and facilities provided. Our butler's english wasn't up to standard as he kept tripping over his own words. After he left, we noticed a large piece of stepped on potato chip near the settee, which the housekeeping missed! 2nd day, they forgot about our fresh fruits also. On checkout, there was no 'have a good stay' formalities, just took our key cards and say no extra charge, not even a goodbye from the lady. Only bright side is this little hotel staff call Assam who greeted us on 2 occasions with a sincere welcoming smile on his face. I think with what they claim at St Regis, their service is sorely not up to standard. For the same price range, next time I would rather go back to either Four seasons or mandarin oriental. Unfortunately I already made a booking for our stay in June.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: born4hotels
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was the rooms - huge, spacious, amazing bathrooms, and fresh fruit every day. I would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cmchoo
Reviews.Content: This is the best Starwood hotel that I ever stayed in South East Asia. From the lobby to the guest room, the interior decor was really great in detailing. You’ll find a fabric bench in the elevator. The electronic curtain and IP phone are rarely seen in other hotels’ guest room. I love the Bose surround sound system, they got 5 speakers in the room! I like to watch TV in the freestanding bathtub but the remote control was malfunction, I didn’t make complaint because I don’t like to be disturbed although I know the staffs are very friendly. They changed different fruit plate every day. You’ll never know what you get for the next day. I like the cheese chocolate which served on my 2nd day. They have so many pillow choices in the pillow menu but I couldn’t find a pillow for Stomach Sleeper like me although I ask for the smallest pillow they have. The breakfast choices were a bit limited. You can choose the hot dish from the limited menu, and get continental breakfast or fruits at the buffet counter, nice ambient but not a good value to pay for breakfast. The swimming pool area looked a bit cram, very near to the wall, anyway I didn’t swim. My aim for this trip was shopping, that’s the main reason I stayed near to Orchard Road. I also didn’t go to the wine bar for the wine tasting session ‘cos I always came back when it over. I like this hotel very much because I always choose the hotel with the best interior design followed by good services. They did it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: LuluGirlPerth
Reviews.Content: I have never done a hotel review until now. I have stayed in many hotels the world over. The St Regis in Singapore is the first to get everything right. It was fabulous from start to finish. Every detail was executed to perfection. No stingy extra costs for anything. My whole family were very impressed and it didn't cost a bomb either.

Reviews.Title: “I am in Looove!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay date 03/13/09 for 5 nights. When I walked into the room(Grand deluxe) I fell in love with the quality,decor & design! I took tons of pics so when I renovate our master it will look like the room we had. The workmanship was impeccable, whole slabs of marble lined the bathroom walls,cut to make it look like big tiles,lined with marble molding;Burled Walnut wood vanities and dresser draws,handcut glass chandlier in the bedchamber & bathroom;handpainted silkscreen backdrop behind the luxurious bed,I could go on & on. Love the technology that was equipped within the room. Daily you receive a different fruit & chocolate platter, the butler made up our room 3x's daily,poolside they bring you a platter with fresh fruit,water, cold towels, & a sprizter with cold water (no charge). Breakfast takes place in the main dining room, another amazing room! The continental spread is remarkable,french pastries,cured meats,lox,salad,congee with different toppings & meats,lo mein,exotic fruits,etc. I could not wait for the morning to arrive! The hotel staff is professional yet friendly and knew our name by the second day. We loved it here and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “great service and ultra-luxurious, but a few teething issues”
Reviews.Author: lindfield
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the St Regis. It's a beautiful place with superb staff and decadent rooms. The interesting artwork at the hotel is an added bonus. The location is great - near enough to walk to the shopping on Orchard Rd but just removed enough from the crowds to be peaceful. We experienced a few technical problems, however - a toilet flooded, the deadlock was broken, another lock in the bathroom didn't work, and a marble tile cracked into two upon stepping onto it (and I'm not that heavy!). These were all attended to quickly and graciously. And I'm sure these faults are just due to the newness of the hotel and are teething issues. But still, given the prices we were paying, I was a bit suprised at the total number of faults - which required time off our holiday calling and explaining things and waiting in our room for things to be fixed before we showered, etc. It would have been a nice gesture for the manager to offer a reduction off the final bill to make up for the inconvenience, or at least to speak to us personally to apologize. All in all, however, I would still recommend the hotel. The service is very professional, and overall, it was a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic in the Making....”
Reviews.Author: SBCCA
Reviews.Content: Three-night stay in March. Elegant and designed to last. Not trendy. The decor will look better and better as it ages. This St. Regis has the class to rival the original in NYC. Although the decor...and service...are traditional and deluxe, the technology is current: big plasma TVs, five-speaker Bose sound system installed, ready connections for your iPod or laptop to play through the sound system, great multi-nozzle shower, heated mirrors, fast internet. The main restaurant is super; the staff called my by name on my second breakfast...and gave me the same nice table by the window. Top art throughout the hotel rather than the typical mass-produced stuff one usually finds. Give yourself a real treat and reserve a Bentley pick-up from the airport. You will be met at the jetway and whisked away in an electric cart to a private immigration officer before settling into the backseat of one of the hotel's three special order Bentleys. Classic design. Classic service. All it needs is the patina of years to equal its namesake on Fifth Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back again! FANTASTIC in every way.”
Reviews.Author: crimsonrose
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. Stayed here for Valentine's weekend. I could not fault one thing! From the minute you arrive in the cab, you know you have arived where service means everything! WOW! You sit down to check in, no standing in lines. You are met by your butler who then shows you around your room, explaining the high tech lighting and features of your room. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to an Execute Suite (massive 2 room suite) and it was sensational! 3 flat screen TVs, one in the bathroom positioned near the free standing bath. The bathroom amentities are excellent (everything you can think of plus more, including a loofah, bath salts, mouth wash, facial cleanser (from Remede). The shower is spacious with extra mini shower heads half way down the shower stand. Twin sinks and separate toilet. Bath robes and his/hers slippers provided. The King size bed is pure heaven to sleep on, only thing missing is the electronic clock! Complimentary water bottles are provided daily along with a fruit plate. Pool and pool area is fabulous, there is a ledge along one side of the pool that you can relax on. Restaurant downstairs has a great buffet breakfast - so popular we had to wait to be served. It has dancing fountains which are lit up at night outside all the large windows. No lounge for SPG Plat members so we were invited to a lovely wine tasting each afternoon in the bar. The French wines were excellent. Service: Outstanding. All the staff are so friendly, welcoming and just simply NICE! Everyone we met, greeted us with smiles and good morning/afternoon etc. No one seemed upset or aloof, maybe they pay their staff really well ;)! The butlers were fantastic and will bring you hot tea and coffee whenever you wish, your choice of pillows from the pillow menu and anything else you might need. We loved it so much we cancelled our Sheraton Towers res to stay here longer! I will definitely return here whenever I get the chance, and I hope it is soon!

Reviews.Title: “not a five star professionism”
Reviews.Author: qsdf
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff do not have the sense to address guests by name. I asked for fresh mango during breakfast and the waiter totally forgot that. It is located at the end of Orchard road.. it is a bit far if you have shopping bags and taxi not available during rush hours... The bathroom is wonderful but the chandelier is awful.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is all about the experience”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Pro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap. What you get is a very relaxed experience and great service. The hotel is only 1 year old. You can pay almost the same price and get much less for your money. From the airport transfers with the hotel Bentleys, to espresso from your private butler, mini bathrobes for our 2 year old, relaxing swimming pool, great room facilities, and the latest technology. This is what 5 star hotels used to be like. My advice is to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit over the top, but I liked it”
Reviews.Author: happy2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis last Oct 2008. It's the most expensive hotel in Singapore today, I usually stay at the Millenia Ritz Carlton but I wanted to try St Regis just once since it's the first luxury hotel in Singapore in more than 10yrs. Stayed there 2 nights. Hotel is located in the Orchard Road area, a few steps from the Shangri-la, shops like Isetann, Wheelock Place w/ Borders, Zara, Hermes are just 5 minutes' walk. Check-in was smooth and quite solicitious. Didn't have to wait at all. Was introduced to my very own private butler (on call anytime 24hours although I never did call him), who takes about 10 minutes describing every nook & cranny of the room. He offered to unpack my bags, but I felt uncomfortable with that. It was a bit awkward since he was so insistent in doing something for me, so just gave him a dress to press (free!).
