Also awkward since I wasn't sure if I was supposed to tip him & how much so I ended up giving SGD10 since we were just standing there. The room is very comfortable. Glamorous old-style, opulent feel, but definitely has all the bells and whistles (Boss speakers, huge flat screen tv, different mood lighting, electronic curtain). Comfy bed, sheets of great quality. What I love most is that the sheets, comforter, bed cover and even carpet were very new/clean (I sometimes freak out when I see a tiny stain on the carpet or bedcover, enough to ruin my stay). Loved the bathroom, with the standalone bathtub in the middle and a 12" flat screen tv in front of the tub. Ritz Carlton's bathrooms were supposedly the world's sexiest (bathtub by the big window overlooking the city/marina), but the St Regis bathrooms are better since they are newer and you just know they spent more money for it, despite lack of a view/window. There's a separate stall for shower, toilet, clothes, two sinks separated by the bathtub. A big plus- they have regular sized Remede products in the bathroom, not those generic hotel-issued ones. I loved these!! I thought that alone made the high rate worth it. Breakfast at the lobby lounge - size not too big, so the place feels more private/exclusive, overlooking the fountains. Breakfast selection was quite disappointing though for the price I was paying, just mostly cold cuts & cereal. Ala carte menu for breakfast also limited. Not impressed. I didn't try their Sunday brunch though, so that might be better as Sunday brunch is a big thing among the hotels in Singapore. Remede Spa - I think this is the first in Asia, massage expensive (as all 5-star hotels are) but just wanted to give it a try. It was ok but for the price I would go somewhere else. I usually stay at the Ritz, and I am so used to it (especially love the high, comfy bed w/ fantastic sheets, also the wooden floors in the bedroom since I hate carpeted rooms) and I miss the views, sleeping with the city lights below you and waking up with the view of the marina. But the Ritz is starting to show it's age in some parts of the room. Overall, I love the St Regis. It's new, probably the best Singapore has so far, stay here if you have the money to burn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: travelguru240
Reviews.Content: This St. Regis Singapore has it together! The rooms are spectacular, clean, and comfy! The staff went above and beyond for us in every way possible. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and sent us to fantastic local restaurants! Make sure to get a Kaya Toast when you are in Singapore! It is a local favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Best experience.”
Reviews.Author: A_Lukman
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the service of the hotel. It is a new hotel, perhaps less than 1 year old since grand opening, a little over a year if counting soft opening. I hope they can keep the service at this level over the years. As soon as I got off the cab, they got my bags, and the receptionist sent me up to the room where a butler was waiting for me. As soon as got in the room, my bags, was there and the butler explained the room various switches and remotes. The room was a suite, and it was nice. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of ventilation. My friend smoked in the smoking room, and the smell of cigarette was still evident for a couple of days. I also had problems with the dvd player, which an engineering staff came and fixed it. But overall, it was a Beautiful room, clean and very comfortable. Again, nice room, great service. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “All round great experience”
Reviews.Author: lawyerfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis in January 2009 with our two children (aged 8 and 10) in connecting Grand Rooms. Overall, it was an excellent experience and one that means we will return to the St Regis instead of the Shangri-la Valley Wing (where we had stayed just prior to this stay at the St Regis). The rooms are easily the best in Singapore - although the decor appears a little quirky from the website photos, in real life, the combination works and you instantly get the feeling of luxury and warmth from the room. They are very generous in size, the quality of the fittings and bedding is exceptional and no expense has been spared in pulling it all together. The electronics (tv, lighting, drapes, telephone, broadband - wireless in room etc) are all cutting edge. Of these, the lights (smart wired - eg 'movie', 'reading' etc) are the least value add and take some getting used to. The telephone is a VOIP handset with lcd screen icons etc and so just getting room service is an adventure in touch screen technology in itself (I use these phones at work and so I had a head start, but still saw this as an example of how an effort to install the 'best' can be counter-productive). The tv (a 42 inch lcd) was very good, with a good selection of movies - the kids loved it. The room also had a built in surround sound Bose music system which was playing jazz when we arrived - a nice touch and was used by us more than we expected. The room comes with a butler service, which is quite helpful - especially when you come to iron a shirt - as there is no iron in the room - just make sure you plan ahead as a 40 minute wait for a shirt at busy times can impede the best laid plans... When we arrived, we asked for the room rate to build in breakfast - which cost us an extra $30 per room per day, but this was far preferable to paying for breakfast at the standard rate. As for the breakfast offering, this was probably the only let down. The fruit display was outstanding, the espresso coffees good (especially for Singapore), but the hot meals were relatively ordinary - my eggs benedict were lukewarm, hard in the middle and uninspiring. As there is only one restaurant available for breakfast, it can also be quite busy and a short wait in the Drawing Room is not unusual. This is where the St Regis can learn from the Shangri-la where breakfast at The Line cafe is extraordinarily good and very memorable. We also had in-room dining - I can highly recommend the curry and local food options. The butler was also very prompt in removing the dining trolley without fuss. We also used the gym daily - it has the latest Technogym equipment which must have cost a small fortune. The attendant was very friendly and attentive and the whole experience very very good. If you are a gym user, this an A experience. All in all, we would not hesitate to stay at the St Regis again. It cots us about 30% less than our recent stay at the Shangri-la Valley Wing and was more enjoyable (though the service at the Shangri-la is extraordinary).

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TouristSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. My husband and I enjoyed five nights at this fantastic 5-star hotel. Staff show exceptional hospitality. The rooms are small, but comfortably arranged with entry way, sitting area, and beautiful decor. Technology surrounds you with 2 flat screen TV's, jazz playing on the CD player and electrical adapters. Drapes and lights are altered via a control panel. The bathroom has a deep tub and the shower has multiple heads and a mirror on one wall. A butler is standing by to bring a beverage of your choice day or night. Nightly turn down service included fresh fruit and chocolates. They surprised us with a custom cake and champagne for my birthday celebration. Use of the spa is included with the room cost. Shopping, restaurants, and the botanical garden are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at a cost”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Ball2007
Reviews.Content: Good location on a side road of Orchard Road, but not necessarily the best location as Orchard Road is like Oxford St in London, busy and full of tourists. The service was amazing, using your name when you check in, giving you a butler etc. Rooms are excellent, well appointed and a descent size, pure luxury. Concierge and all the staff very helpful, however I did find the cost of drinks a little on the steep side, as was breakfast. Pool a little disappointing, more of a large plunge pool.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the St Reeg”
Reviews.Author: vgchao
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to BENLEE123's review. Comments on that review are right on. One thing to note, if your flight is leaving late, you can use the spa facilitites to shower after you have checked out. My husband and I worked out, used the saunas and showers before hopping on our 14 hour flight home. The spa is wonderful. Very well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / great service!”
Reviews.Author: abbache
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Regis for work. What a great place. It's rated 4 stars, but I'd say it's a 5 star. Great pool, great gym, great hotel room, superior service. Everything was super comfortable and I really loved having a tv built into the wall in the bathroom by the bathtub. I really loved this place...

Reviews.Title: “amazing, one of the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: travelwellallthetime
Reviews.Content: perfect, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. upgraded to a massive suite, with everything you would ever need in terms of quality hi-tech toys in the room. tv's everywhere, bose sound systems, tv above the bath. mood lighting etc. wondeful place

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel : Luxury on Overdrive!”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: I was just back from a stay at the St Regis. Shortly after my disastrous stay in Mandarin Oriental Tokyo ( read my review ) and feeling totally unsatisfied, I cut short my Tokyo trip and return to Singapore. Then I decided to splurge one last time for my hard-earned vacation and book a suite at the brand new St Regis instead. Besides, the price of the suite in Singapore is not that much different from a hotel room in Tokyo anyway. Arriving Upon my booking I was told that the room rate includes airport transfer. I thought it will be the standard pick up after clearing customs and hop into the car kind of airport transfer. However, the St Regis managed to surprise me. Upon disembarkation from the plane, an airport staff was already on standby to pick me up at the airbridge. I was then whisked away in a buggy cart to the CIP terminal where I cleared immigration without queing. Even more impressive, my bags has already been collected by the airport staff and in my limo waiting for me. What an excellent first impression! Upon arriving at the hotel, the hotel manager and the head Butler was there waiting for me. I was immediately escorted to my suite to take care of the usual check-in formalities. Then the butler gave me an introduction to the room facilities and amenities and a “crash course” on how to use the technology in this suite. Believe me, this is a must. It’s the second most technologically advanced hotel room I have encountered ( after the Peninsula Tokyo ). The Room The suite ( called “Manhattan Suite” ) measures about 90m2 and comes with separate living room and bedroom, and a full marble bathroom. The style is classical, but everything is very very luxurious. Every part of the suite is decorated and adorned in rich and luxurious material. Either top quality polished veneer blond or dark wood or refined silk wallpaper. Even the floor is made from top quality wood. Furniture are also all classical and with rich colorful patterns and more importantly, it’s comfortable. I love the functional L-shape working desk. The bathroom used top of the line French Brenche de Benou marble with fittings from Hansgrohe. There is a free standing bathtub, dual sinks and the most complete shower cubicle I have encountered, including a powerful overhead rainforest shower, handshower and side massage shower jets. The bathroom is supplied with Remede Spa products from St Regis’s own Spa. Room also comes with lots and lots of gadgets. Two Sharp Aquos LCD TV and Bose home theater sound system in both the living room and bedroom. Ipod connection. Touch-screen phones. An amazing ( and sometimes confusing ) range of lighting switches. Some nick pits ( and for the hotel management to read and improve ) :- For a suite, they should have incorporated a bigger bathtub, maybe a platform bath instead of the same tub that are used in their standard rooms. It’s OK but if you are over 5’ 8”, might have problem fitting in. The closet is not ideal. It’s rather narrow and there are limited shelve space. They could have incorporated a laptop size safe. The lightings are confusing and take some time to figure out. There are 4 mood lighting settings and different switches on the bed panel and remote can activate different lights. Sometimes it seems the system got confused, turning on the bedroom light as well when I press the bathroom light. The pillows on the bed are quite heavy. I’m sure I can request for lighter foam pillows if I wanted to. There is no easy way to connect the iPod in the bedroom to the sound system. I have to manually connect the cables to the sound system at the back panel. They should provide a iPod dock. Due to the hotel’s location, it’s facing Tanglin road and there is not much of a view at night. The view in the morning however is quite nice. But frankly, all the abovementioned are just really nit picks which hardly distract from the quality of the stay and I can hardly think of anymore. Long story short, it’s an amazing suite room that’s unabashedly and unapologetically opulent. Right up there with the very best I have seen. Despite the style not exactly to my taste ( I tends to prefer more contemporary design ), I was very happy with this charming suite nevertheless and feel totally relaxed in it. Everything is absolutely top class. In summary, this room is a showcase of luxury on overdrive. I would dare say this suite would even be fit for a king or a visiting head of state. Just see the photos with this review. Service As already mentioned above, the arriving and welcome given by the St Regis is excellent. Absolutely no complaints here. St Regis also distinguished itself as a hotel chain that still uses the Butler system. Note that St Regis butlers are not like butlers in other hotels who most of the time are just house keeping staff. The butler is like a personal assistant during your stay and can help with bringing beverages ( unlimited tea or coffee ), unpack your luggage, help with housekeeping task, delivery of laundry etc. And because he or she is a dedicated butler, so they all get to know the guest on first hand basis and the goal is to provide personalized service and anticpate guests needs. All service calls in the St Regis centred around the Butler so at most time, you only need to call upon the Butler. During my short stay, all my requests were attended promptly and professionally. I was generally impressed with my butlers though some are clearly better than others. Let’s just say there are still room for “refinement”. Common Areas The St Regis has some of the nicest common areas found among all hotels. On entering the lobby for the first time, one cannot fail to notice the huge overhead chandelier that adorned the ceiling. The style as in the room are all classical but it’s very tastefully done. The airy LaBrezza restaurant at the ground floor has a impressive soaring atrium. Conclusion This is a top of the line 5-star luxury hotel thru and thru and while I have not seen the other hotels, I can confidently say this is the top hotel in Singapore currently and more than measure up to the best in other Asian cities. It’s gratifying to note that finally my home country Singapore has a hotel with enough class and quality to match the best in other cities, such as the Four Seasons in Hong Kong or the Peninsula in Tokyo. I do look forward to a future opportunity to return here again. And I’m pleased to award it my top 5/5 ratings, a rating which I do not give out easily. But does it now become my #1 hotel? Not there yet, but time will tell on repeated visits if they can keep this high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JUELLE
Reviews.Content: Our recent stays at St Regis was delightful, the Hotel is a calming retreat from busy Singapore. From the pleasant welcome on arrival from the Doorman, check in with efficient and charming staff and escort to a very well appointed suite. This Hotel is beautifully designed and decorated, without being flamboyant, our suite decorated with style and flair, the bed, linens and pillows luxurious. The bathroom - marble, mirrors and glass - fabulous. A huge freestanding bath, TV, separate shower (almost vichy) to die for. Butler service - charming staff Restaurant beautifully appointed and fine dining with flair Pool & Spa excellent My husband and I were delighted with our St Regis stay and recomend it as your Singapore home away from home

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Opulence”
Reviews.Author: east_bluff
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe how thrilled my husband and I were for spending a day at this St Regis. We booked the hotel after reading on Trip Advisor that this is the newest hotel in Singapore. We got an Executive Deluxe Room on the 18th floor with a beautiful view of the city. All the beddings and fixtures are of top quality. The marble floor and walls carry beautiful veins. Remede bath products were used throughout. The Remede Spa completedly impressed us. The service was impeccable. The receptionist not only walked us to our room after checking in but also walked us to the taxi after checking out. Since we had only 1 night in Singapore and we could not get to Bee Chang Hiang for pork jerky before the store closed at 10 PM, the concierge actually sent someone out to get us 200 g to taste. When we came back from dinner, our delicious pork jerky was waiting on the table. It is rare that we feel so relaxed in a hotel room and look forward to returning to it, and we certainly felt that way with St Regis. We definitely will be returned customers for this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful comfort at the “other end” of Orchard Road ..”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Taxi drivers seemed uncertain of where the hotel is, as it is new. Tell them it is on Tanglin Road, right next door to Tanglin Shopping Centre (the one with Asian antiques, not Tanglin Mall) and across from The Link at 1 Nassim, and they will know where to go. Haven’t stayed at this end of Orchard Road before, my favourites like Ngee Ann City are at the other end, but it was OK. Anyway, we arrived at the St Regis at 7.30am (after a red eye flight from Istanbul) and they apologised that the room wasn’t yet ready!! It took, oh another ten minutes or more before they could escort us up… We were only here one night, it was just a transit stop to rest on the way home to Australia. Therefore many of the services available at the St Regis (like the butler service) were not really of much use to us, as we just wanted to catch up on some sleep. The room (Executive Deluxe) was blissfully comfortable for this purpose and we slept for quite a while then stirred ourselves to have a delicious brunch at our favourite Straits Kitchen at the Hyatt. Followed by a little retail therapy, so we didn’t actually spend much time evaluating our room at the St Regis, since we were either sleeping – or not there. The beds, pillows were very comfortable; the curtains darkened the room effectively and were motorized; bathroom had a free-standing tub as well as a great shower and good quality toiletries. Especially the shower gel mentioned by another reviewer…Good-sized couch which was comfortable. Liked the artistically arranged fruit plate too. Very large flat screen TV. You could dial up a particular lighting style for bedroom and bathroom, ranging from restfully dim, to brightly lit. Unfortunately none of the possibilities provided a directional bedside reading light which did not disturb your companion (Especially the “reading” option). It looked as though the directional downlights which would have worked as reading lights had been swivelled to light up the centre of the bed for some reason. Hotel employees were very pleasant and helpful, judging by the limited contact we had with them. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant (Brasserie Les Saveurs) because we were tired and had an early start again the next day. After seven weeks of travelling and eating exotic food we opted for a hamburger! Service was very slow, and then the hamburger was lukewarm when it came, though the accompanying fries were hot. As well there was a nice amuse bouche, bread basket, and my husband also had an appetizer which he liked. Would have liked to order dessert as well, but did not risk it since service was so very slow for other course. The restaurant was pleasant, had a lighted dancing fountain display (Las Vegas-style) which amused us for a while as we waited…

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la, Valley Wing for 10 years, 3-4 times a year. Since February we have stayed at the St. Regis. It is a beautiful hotel, with outstanding service, in a great position. Everyone, from the Doorman to the Manager, goes out of their way to be of service. They make you feel you are the most important people in the hotel. The rooms are amazing and I love the gym and pool. Now the restaurant is a brasserie, the menu and meals are excellent and reasonably priced. Hard to beat this hotel anywhere in the world. Carol, Perth, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Well what a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: Well what a disappointment, during check-in the receptionist couldn't find my booking and asked me to show her my confirmation, I had to use there business center to print this off. Then she was so rude and very arriviste but god she is only a receptionist !!!. Anyway she then told me that they hotel was "running full" and that the room that I "didnt book" was $40 more, i told her i would go down the road to the Ritz or Raffles, then she quickly found me a room, but honestly I really wish she didn't, I really have never felt so uncomfortable in my life, I should have gone down the road to another hotel. I cant believe that this hotel would be arguing for $40 more, lt was like she was bartering with me. Its really not like me to feel uncomfortable in this type of environment, i meen i grew-up in these hotels, my dad was a GM for this group of hotels (SPG) for many years so i really did live and grow up in these places, anyway this lady really did manages to make me feel very unwelcome. On the plus side this hotel does have the best rooms in Singapore, they are just wonderful really great. Very nicely furbished and quality furnishings. Bose sound system, LCD TV and one in the bathroom too (didn't work). The Remede products in the bathroom were very nice, loved the shower gel. Beds are to die for, they are the really nice St Regis beds (just like the Sheraton Sweet sleeper or Westin heavenly beds) wonderful. Cant say much for this hotels location its up what i would call the Wrong end of Orchard Road, and it doesn't have much of a view from the rooms, Nothing like the view i had at the Ritz out over the city and singapore flyer!. The rest of the hotel is nothing to wright home about, there is a small lobby a funny restaurant that looks out onto a brick wall and a very small swimming pool area, its just this hotel doesnt have any atmosphere, i really dont know whats its missing but yeah its a strange hotel in a strange location. I must say that while all the staff came across very inexperienced a few of them were on the ball, like the front desk manager, without me even complaining he sent up a card apologizing for the poor check-in and offered me complimentary breakfast, then when i checked out I was offered to keep the room untill my flight later that afternoon, which was nice. However I must say that the little incident really did tarnish my stay and really did set the tone for this hotel, I really don't think i will be staying here again not only due to this but i really didn't find its location good or convenient to my business.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_on_Holidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. The hotel has a ultra chic pool area, nice spa area that is able to be accessed by all hotel guests. Wine tasting in the evening puts a nice touch to the end of a day. Service was great. Staff treated you like a star, although sometimes the service can be pretentious, over the top and overwhelming. There were some problems with house keeping in terms of cleanliness of the room but this was resolved by the duty manager who upgraded us to a bigger suite. Breakfast service was slow but this was a given as the restaurant was too large an area to manage effectively. Also noticed that room service in the mornings were slow but quick at other times. Quality of butlers also varied at times. Would return to this hotel without hesitation as it is truly a beautiful property. Rooms are elegantly and beautifully decorated, butler service put a nice touch to our stay and the concierge was extremely efficient. Nice, high quality toiletries in the bathrooms from its in house spa, good tvs and comfortable beds made our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “6 stars, no less!”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: One is spoilt when in Singapore for great hotels and indeed there are another half dozen 5star+ hotels coming soon. The St Regis is the first of the 'new breed' and it has left even my old favourite, The Fullerton in its shadow. All rest of the 5 stars are dated ..doesnt matter if its Ritz-Carlton, Fullerton , the gawdy Sangri-La or the very 'institutional' Sentosa....they have all been left behind by the arrival of St Regis. The staff and as such the service is what really sets this hotel apart from the competition. True first class service: no issue, no problem, no matter, tiny details! The rooms and suites are absolutely the best in Singapore - style, class & comfort! The bathrooms are luxurious - loads of stunning rather unusual marble and heated mirrors (so they dont mist up!). The Spa too is superb although management of the Spa is the truly only weak link at the hotel. The Spa staff offer the best hotel treatments in Singapore and they have no competition! None! The Chinese Restaurant must be one of Singapores best. The Italian is boring and feels like a bit of an after thought while the main dining room works well for breakfast and lunch but dinner is a bit 'Las Vegas' with coloured fountains that are simply too active and busy for a relaxing fine dining experience. Management of the hotel is top notch. The Concierge Team headed up by Ian Tan cannot be faulted - perfect every time! The decoration of the hotel in general is very good although there are a few over the top 'artistic touches' which hopefully in time will be toned down. I am happiest when in Singapore ....and happiest when in Singapore to be at The St Regis. Well done - you certainly have my business!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel trying hard”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis twice on our way back and forth from India. This hotel is beautiful with excellent food in the restaurants. Did not have any of the problems of the most recent reviewers. Management is trying hard to get feedback from guests and we spent some time with management at the wine hour on both occasions expressing our views. We were instantly recognized by staff upon our return from India and we felt very welcome. Anticipate this hotel will eventually be regarded the best hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at the St Regis Singapore”
Reviews.Author: gaurav6
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous staying at the St. Regis Singapore after reading (on Tripadvisor) about the terrible time that people have had there. Fortunately, I loved my 2 days at the hotel: - breakfast was high quality and the staff was super attentive - little touches help- they jump and get you a little table on which you can put a newspaper! - rooms were good, great bose sound system where you can connect your laptop or an ipod. - excellent spa - the butler got tea for room service in a flash and piping hot only crib was that the elevators are really slow! gm

Reviews.Title: “go to the fullerton!”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsO
Reviews.Content: the servic at this hotel is very poor. What can go wrong here generally does. Example - we called butler and waited fifteen minutes for a cup of decaf tea. brought chamomile by mistake. Butler went away and came back with normal tea, not decaf, went away again next time she got it right. butler left and we realized there was no milk. Do we laugh or cry??!! Funny when you want taxi, every other hotel has a light to put on so taxi drivers know ehn they needed. Here doormen run round waving their arms until a taxi driver notices them. Food is great but let down with bad service too. Oh and the drain smells in the toilet. Wife says next time go to fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1stclassluxurytravel
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the previous reviewer.. Something is just not right here??? We were really looking forward to the end journey of our European leg to unwind for 5 nights at the St Regis.. But it was a continual process of errors and problems and a real let down. The Hotel itself is New and beautiful, and incredible chandeliers and decor throughout.. but for a wonderful stay this hotel needs to sort out its electrical problems.. we had lights that didnt work, the tv in the bathroom wouldnt change channels, the aircon would sporadically go on and off, they did have an engineer look at the problem however it continued not to work effectively.. The butler(s) were lovely but it would have been nice to have our own kettle to make a cup of tea or coffee as opposed to have to call everytime we wanted one.. It just felt uncomfortable to have to continually call them, and an intrusion into our privacy.. There is 101 switches near the side tables that we just gave up on trying to turn lights on, lights off, back light, hall light, it was just over the top and frustrating to keep on trying to get it right.. We found the bed rather a little to firm for our liking and were amazed that there was no options for pillows.. I like a large pillow but my husband doesnt and ended up with a very sore neck after 5 nights.. The staff were gracious, however on 4 different occassions we asked questions to staff to be greeted with "I am from china" ?? The staff themselves were lovely and tried very hard to be polite but had no understanding of any english, this was both in the Ya Ting restaurant when we asked for another bottle of wine and in our suite when they came for a turn down service and we asked what time tomorrows newspaper would be delivered.. Hmmm? The spa facilities were lovely but lacked a certain vibe, actually there was a complete lack of ambience throughout the entire hotel, one could attribute that to the current low occupancy, but not in this case, we have been to many newly opened hotels and there always seemed to be some energy and excitement, but not here.. The food at Le saveurs was very reasonably priced and the breakfast was possibly there best service, food of a very high standard.. Also the staff here were excellent. Overall I would recommend certainly booking a table at one of the restaurants at the St regis, but check in somewhere else.. The Ritz and Conrad are much more dated then this beautiful New hotel, but they consistently get it right.. We have never left either of those hotels nor the Fullerton with such a lack lustre experience..

Reviews.Title: “Another Kens Column Review”
Reviews.Author: KensColumn
Reviews.Content: Singapore has many fantastic hotels and the newly opened St Regis is one to add to your list. A beautiful hotel with outstanding service.The rooms are excellent and the pool although small is very nice. They have a great Spa and exercise room as well. The food although expensive is great and the breakfast buffet is outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel second possibly to the Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “Need to work out service problems”
Reviews.Author: Edges
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four days at the recently opened hotel during the Easter weekend. I was initially impressed with the welcome I received at the hotel, from the welcoming doormen, reception and the butler. I was looking forward to the level of service for which St. Regis is renowned for. Unfortunately, the service that I was getting was not as detailed as advertised. In fact, it was in the details that they failed to fulfill my expectation. I found my room temperature very hot when we were checking in, there were masking tapes marking spots that needed touch ups on the ceiling and the carpet was a bit dirty. When I complained, I was taken very seriously and I was given an upgrade. Unfortunately that was not the end of my problems. Again they failed to impress me with their low attention to details such as my room was not made up at 3 PM even after I pressed the 'make up room' button at 11 AM. The hotel is a nice change for me in the often mechanically efficient Singapore. I like the personal touch such as the hotel managers approaching guests and having small talks as they were having breakfast. I accept that the hotel is new, but they should work out their housekeeping management immediately before their reputation goes down. I can be a fussy guest, especially when I am paying top dollars at a property like this one. That is why I am rating my stay as okay.

Reviews.Title: “So much staff with nothing to do”
Reviews.Author: Elator
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel that really is richly decorated throughout. Problems exist and can become quite annoying though. There are so many members of staff permanently standing around with nothing to do except get in your way, chat amongst themselves and bother you - expect a knock on your door at random times when you'll be visited by a butler to "just check if you're okay" or some other feeble excuse, to "check you've got enough soap". YES, NOW LEAVE ME ALONE!!!! Openings on the drains in the bathroom mean at times you can get a bit of a foul smell in the rooms. Constantly empty bars and restaurants mean that the whole place is devoid of any atmosphere whatsover. Could have been great but falls short on too many levels.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, but still working out kinks in service”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBoris
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights at the St. Regis Singapore, about 6 weeks after the hotel opened for business. Arrived at 2am and was escorted to the room by 3 staff (!) - the manager, porter, and the butler. Room was large & beautiful, with flowers changed daily, fresh fruit delivered every evening, great views of the city, very comfortable bed & furniture. Bathroom is spacious and well equipped. Butler is at your beck & call 24 hours a day and brings press pot coffee (complimentary) any time you need it. Gym is well-equipped and not at all crowded. Restaurants were all good - the French and Chinese restaurants are elegant and the service deliberately slow-paced (figure on spending 2-3 hours for dinner). The Mediterranean restaurant by the pool offers a more casual environment and faster-paced service. While the hotel is a fantastic place to stay, it is still in "startup mode" with gaps in service noticeable from time to time. One example was a room service dinner - I placed our order and was told 30 to 35 minutes for delivery; the food did not show up for 90, and it was barely warm by that time. On top of that, the butler and the room service manager offered different explanations for the delay, adding to the feeling that things are not quite running like clockwork yet. With that said, I would recommend the St. Regis to travelers who are looking for high-end accommodations in Singapore. I expect the service issues to be resolved over time.
